reviewText: Not only are these bulbs saving me money, but they look great!! Very attractive looking glass-work inside... I love 'em!

I used these ladders for years in a work environment and was very much at ease with using them: 4ft, 6ft, and 8ft. It's designed well. You know it when you are on it. You feel comfortable on the first or any other step. It's just solid. It's also great that the top holds many of your tools and gadgets. When I needed a ladder for home, this is what I looked for. I also was lucky that there was a special promotion at that time. Great Deal! At work, these lasted for years. At home, this will last forever! You'll never need to buy another of the same size.
summary: It's the one ladder to buy! You will not need another!

reviewText: I have ordered a total of 8 of these and have not had a bad one in the bunch!!!! They are super bright, well constructed, and have certainly held up to all the abuse I've dealt out!!! I will not use any equipment in the field that has not been tested by me and met my high standards!!!! And these flashlights passed the test across the board. They have been dropped, submerged, and seriously abused. Shipping was fast and free and the price is incredible for such a quality light!!! Do yourself a favor and order a couple, I'll bet you'll be back for more!!!! I am in the process of ordering three more myself. For once I couldn't be happier!!!!!
I wish they keep their reputation and change towards better lock as product lock is very poor . Other than that it is not great but ok .
These are just plastic but they look cool as heck and are quite bright I got mine on sale cheap and am happy with them
summary: They look way cool but are really just plastic

reviewText: I bought this solely to repair a plastic model airplane for a grandchild.Followed the directions and used it sparingly on clean surfaces.Didn't bond in the slightest.Since I purchased it for a single purpose, I didn't try it on anything else - and probably wouldn't.Jerry
summary: Utterly and completely ineffective on a plastic item

reviewText: I bought this so I could make a few projects with my Kreg pocket jig.  I never did, I had so many other things to do with my Kreg I never got to this book. But that does not mean I cannot comment on its content.  I have been wanted to make the clock for a long time, there are projects in here that a young person can manage.  the instructions are straight forward and easy to follow, anything to do with the Kreg jig is easy.  I will be using this soon, hopefully.
Everybody knows Klein tools are the best and these are no fluke! The grip feels good and solid in your hand. The hollow shanks make them more versatile, too! I would recommend these to anyone!

I've owned this for about 8 years and use it approximately once a week. I bought it to get at high cabinets and shelves in an apartment with 9 foot ceilings (where the shelves and cabinets go all the way up to the ceiling). I wish it had one more rung but it is still very good as it is. It's rated for 300 lbs but I have weighed more than 325 lbs in the past and it held up just fine under that weight. I felt no give in the step rungs or the top step. I felt perfectly at ease and balanced. But please, don't use it if you're over 300 lbs then blame me if you get hurt (you'd be surprised, people have done similar things and blamed my reviews). I'm just telling you it withstood over 325 lbs, which means to me that it is plenty strong for the 300 lb rating it is advertised as.I did not buy from Amazon but I would have at the price currently shown ($38 shipped from Amazon) if I could not have gotten it where I did locally. And if I ever need another and can't get it locally, yes I would buy it here because I've had mostly good experience buying through Amazon's website. I recommend using Amazon Prime. You can get the perks of free shipping from Amazon Prime if you make certain purchases. Ask me how if you're interested. No, I'm not selling anything, I'm just into helping people save money.I include a photo above of where I keep it hanging in the kitchen. It doesn't take up much room. When folded it measures 13.5" wide, 28.5" tall, 6" deep.My only complaints are those you get with any ladder:1) I'd like it to be easier to clean because I keep it in my kitchen, but cleaning it is difficult. But that's the same with any ladder. To clean it I open it, put it in the bath tub, spray it down with Windex, and scrub it with a floor scrub brush, then run the shower over it, let it dry, then hang it again. Eh, you do what you have to do when you live in a tiny apartment.2) Your feet hurt on the metal steps.
summary: Rated 300 lb but takes on over 325 lbs easily (don't try this at home)

reviewText: I do a lot of glass engraving and use a Dremel engraving tool for most of my work.  That is a vibrating type of engraver (vs other Dremel that I use that is a rotary).  This tool is also a rotary and as a result can do bit finer work than the Dremel engraver.  I was able to pick up on Amazon a set of the diamond bits that fit this (my Dremel takes larger bit) and so far very satisfied.  You do have to push the button continuously when engraving.  Not difficult but would be nice if it had a locking mechanism so you did not have to keep pressing if using for extended period.  But that is minor item, at least for me.  Have not tried using this on metals or surfaces other than glass so cannot comment on its use there.  I find that for signing my work this is far superior to the Dremel engraver although care has to be taken in either case.This is addition to my earlier review.  I have a set of diamond bits to use with this tool but when I went to change the bit I found the original bit frozen and would not come out no matter what I tried.  I called Amazon and got the phone number for General Tools. Before ordering a new one I wanted to be sure that the bits were removable.  Seemed so since had a locking nut but wanted to find out for sure.  Told them I was just over my one year in warranty and explained the problem.  Told me they would be happy to send me a new one at no cost and today via UPS it arrived and this bit is easily removed.  Cannot say how impressed I was at the service.  Could not have been nicer on the phone.  They did not want the old unit back saying that occasionally there is a bad unit.  So am giving to friend who wants to try on marble in his professional art work and if works am sure he will be buying his own.  Not often you find a company this responsive on an item like this one.  As a result I would not hesitate to order other tools from them.
summary: Does excellent job for my needs

reviewText: I was so happy to get these. I'm living temporarily in a very old apartment building where nothing is up to code and every bit of wiring in this place makes you fearful of an apartment fire. Of course, these apartments only have one pathetic smoke alarm in the bedroom and none anywhere else. I put one of these in the hallway, one in the dining area and another in the bedroom as a backup (since you get three in a pack.) These aren't quite as loud as a regular smoke detector, but with their tiny footprint, they're so easy to put anywhere and in a lot of places. The more the better, right? I sleep much better at night knowing these will alert me if there is a fire. It's also nice they come with lithium batteries that will last for years!
summary: These are so small. You'll be amazed!

reviewText: Not much to add to the other 5-star reviews. Received it, installed it and repaired a dead kitchen under counter light. Works great. Remains to be seen if it lasts any longer than the original transformer did. Easy to install. Just diconnect and reconnect one wire at a time so you don't get confused. A heck of a lot less expensive than replacing the whole fixture.

I bought this to replace the piece of junk Dewalt brand one I had that lasted for one minor project.  It seems to be sturdy and I will change my rating if it breaks without cause like the Dewalt.  Minus one star because the bits sit deeper in to the adapter than some of the shanks on my nut driver bits can handle. They will not lock in to place because they hit the cup of the bit before getting deep enough.

reviewerName: C. Beard "I have not gone where I intended to...
reviewText: I have four of these in different lengths and love them. I use them in drivers and impacts with no problems. My only complaint is the head is big so if you are in a tight spot you have to make sure you don't damage the finish of the project.

Pros:-3 brightness settings (cycles high/off/medium/off/low/off/repeat) or set to high only-simple install with no tools req'd.-insanely bright flood light-no more dark spot in the middle of beamCons:-as others have noted, there are different generations of Maglites are incompatible with this mod.-strictly flood light, no focus capabilities (reflector is removed entirely from lamp)-switch for cycle/high is poorly located & cartoonishly small and cheap feeling-to change from consistent high to cycle & vice versa, multiple parts must be removed (remove lens, then remove LED assembly, hope you can more the switch without breaking it, reassemble...)This is not an upgrade/mod for everyone. Most every benefit it adds to your maglite comes at a compromise somewhere else.  For the most part, it is a decent upgrade, but for the cost, you can get an equally bright surefire or other brand light. It feels like TerraLux went cheap in many ways throughout their design and build, and for that I would generally not recommend this product unless you absolutely must have the worlds brightest maglite and you can afford to throw money away without a care.If you are also looking for the proper Maglite that this is compatible with, give this one a go:MAGLITE S6D035 Display Box Heavy-Duty 6-D Cell Flashlight, Redamazon.com/MAGLITE-S6D035-Display-Heavy-Duty-Flashlight/dp/B0002JT3K2/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1375235931&sr;=8-1&keywords;=MAGLITE+S6D035

This router table has been good to me so far. I probably have run 400+ ft of board across it. I am not a professional, but fairly demanding in precision.They were very generous with accessories like feather boards, miter guage and bit height measurement tool. It appears that it would work with almost any router. It wasn't particularly difficult to install my new SKIL 1830 router.It was a little tricky to get used to the hash marks for the table. Each hash is probably about a 1/16" so you have to figure out where on the hash that you have to be to get more precision.Folding legs and easy toggle switch are all great. It can be mounted, or in my case, I just slip over some screws that are drilled into a bench. The cord length from the table isn't particularly long so you will want to put near a plug or use an extension cable.
Dont buy. Product is poorly designed and incomplete. Had to improvise to make this work otherwise it would have been tossed. Pretty much junk.

Was looking for this for my dark Maitland Smith and other fine mahogany furniture. The dark color adds to the rich luster of the finish. Hard to find this dark colored paste wax. By happy that I found it here, and one tin should literally last years.
Bone color is nice and the soft close is very nice. Had to get this with the toilet as there is no provided seat with the toilet.  Little pricey.

For the 6 bucks I paid for this thing i'm more than happy.  It is very small and easy to carry in a pocket or on a belt with the clip.  Much brighter than LED's of the past that were more expensive.  Wish I'd bought more at the time for the low price.  As soon as I see them cheaper I will be buying more.FYI  the unit I got doesnt seem to have more than an on/off.  No strobe/low/high.  Taking only 1 AA is awesome though being cheap.

Porter-Cable PC3012 Oscillating Precision Plunge Cut Blade, Bi-MetalBlades work as they should, they are bi-metal but only to cut small thin nails, they are not design to cut bolts, I know that the description is somewhat deceptive, but I didn't expect to be able to cut bolts with it.What I don't like about it, is that there's not many palces that sales this blades, Lowe's quit carrying them, I do order from Amazon, But if I run out of them I have to wait for them.I will be buying the Rockwell RK5140K Sonicrafter Hyperlock with Universal Fit and Constant Speed Control Oscillating Tool Kit pretty soon, because of the versatility and the fact you can use any blade and it has great reviews.http://www.amazon.com/Rockwell-RK5140K-Sonicrafter-Hyperlock-Oscillating/dp/B008N3R9QE/ref=wl_it_dp_o_pC_nS_nC?ie=UTF8&colid;=3I6786DE2ZLUQ&coliid;=I12BARBVBZX0FR
summary: Porter-Cable PC3012 Oscillating Precision Plunge Cut Blade, Bi-Metal

reviewText: You might get the idea from the product name that these are somehow "noise canceling" earmuffs.  Well, they certainly aren't any kind of active noise canceling, but for the price you might have guessed that.  Anyway, this is a simple product, just a couple of pieces of foam inside a plastic shell.  It does attenuate outside noise, but I doubt any noise canceling is possible with foam.  Note that wearing the product for more than about 1/2 hour will cause irritation.  The material that covers your ears is a vinyl/plastic, without much padding.  So basically, the plastic part of the earmuff sits against the skin, making them uncomfortable except for short durations.  I've seen another pair that have leather covers, which would probably make them more comfortable.
Two bulb legs broke off two of them, as I was soldering them into the board. Ridiculous. Other than that, the remainder worked fine.

This is definitely not a cheap flashlight or battery pack.  The light alone is impressively bright for such a small piece.  For high-end users, this is a device I would recommend.  The enclosed AC charger is a plus for those who may not have a USB plug available.  The strap is also convenient during carrying.  Highly recommended for travel bags and for anyone who needs added juice on the go.

Built good and durable finish. I keep this one in my car for a small portable travel light. I also find myself using this one on camping trips as it takes falls well and has a good dust cap on the back.

I have to agree with many of the other reviewers who like this router for its smoothness, power,and low noise level. The grips are great, it plunges nicely, and the quality of materials seems top rate. However, my experience with this router has revealed two flaws that greatly detract from what would otherwise be a truly fine machine. While these flaws are not necessarily deal-breakers, those of you who are considering buying this tool may want to be aware of them.First, as another reviewer has pointed out, it is impossible to accurately center template guides within the base plate. The user must screw the template guide holder into the baseplate, and since the holder does not precisely register into the baseplate, it is thus extremely difficult to accurately center the guides. If you use template guides and require even a moderate degree of accuracy, this flaw is a deal-breaker. Do not buy this router. On the other hand, if you never use template guides or plan on parking this baby in a router table, you'll have no problems. This would be a fine router for those purposes.The other problem is another quality/design issue that can be remedied but is a moderate annoyance. On my machine, the release/locking lever for the plunge mechanism came loose on several occassions, making it impossible to plunge and lock the router at a desired depth. There is a small set screw in the lever mechanism that works loose and has to be constantly  tightened and adjusted. This problem is not an isolated incident as it also has occured with two other cabinetmakers and their identical routers in my shop. In the end, having tired of constantly fiddling with our machines, the three of us adjusted the mechanisms as best we could, applied Lock-Tite to the set screws, and hoped we did it right because there would be no way to disassemble the levers once the Lock-Tite cured. Fortunately, the fix worked fine, and all three of us are happily using our machines without any problems. Again, not a deal-breaker and the problem was fixed, but this seems unnecessary for a $200 router.The other router to consider in this price range is the DeWalt DW625 3 HP plunge router. Though it has more power than the PC 8529, it is the same size and weight. It's also variable speed and would be great in a router table. I've never been a huge DeWalt fan (many of their products seem overrated and overpriced), this seems to be an excellent machine. Several of the guys in my shop own them and use them for the dual purposes of plunge operations as well as major hogging through lots of material (the extra hp makes a big difference). Add it to your list of possibilities.

Bought 2 of these.  Much better sound protection than the electronic Howard Leights they replace.  Cans are a bit large.  I did a mock up shooting a scoed rifle and I was hitting the stock a bit.  Hope it's not an issue.  Got these because every time my wife and I go to the range we always end up next to a tool firing his cannon repeatedly with wreckless abandon.

I already had 2 of these but needed 2 more for a project.  I had the originals for 3 years or so and they work great as have the new ones.  Fold up very well for storage and have a "V" top that allows you to work with round material you might have to cut, which is really helpful.
summary: Stanley 011031S FatMax Sawhorse with Adjustable Legs (1-Pack)

reviewText: Trying this product out the first time amazed me: it cuts really fast and very smoothly.  Even in a fast cutting mode, it cuts reasonably smoothly.  Of course, I was easy to impress: I had been using a Craftsman jigsaw for years, and never knew what I was missing.  Obviously there's no going back now!  Having read the reviews, I had very high expectations, but the Bosch performed even better than I expected.For a regular woodworker, this saw is a great complement to a table saw.  The table saw excels for straight cuts and quantity cutting. This one is great for irregular or curved cuts, materials not suited for a table saw (e.g. metal), or cutting things you can't bring to a table saw (like a wall).I think the versatile jigsaw is a great choice for an infrequent carpenter or handyman, or someone on a budget.  For years a jigsaw was the only saw I had, and I built many useful things.  The main reason for other saws is that they may be faster or cut more smoothly (and a few things you can't do with this one, such as grooves or mouldings).While any power tool can cause injury, it's clear that a jigsaw takes longer to do serious injury than other power saws, so in that sense it's safer.  For this reason my wife is willing to use it.Using a straight-edge as a guide, you can still do a good job on long straight cuts with a jigsaw if you don't own a table saw.  I made a simple jig - a scrap of 3/4" pine cut to a width equal to the edge of the shoe to the cut edge of the saw, approximately 1 1/4" but varies with the blade - which, when placed along the cut line, makes it quick to place then clamp the straight edge.  To make it, clamp a straight edge to a work surface, place a straight scrap snug against it and clamp, then cut with the Bosch saw.  Mark the purpose of the scrap and store it near the saw.Nits: I don't like the non-intuitive blade change, and have had to remind myself by re-reading the manual when I had not used it for awhile.  The blades aren't cheap, but are of very high quality.  There are a LOT of choices in the blades, and unfortunately Bosch does not explain the particular advantage of one vs a similar one very well.These nits would have led me to give 4 1/2 stars, but overall they are small nits: once the right blade is installed for a job, this is a one beautiful tool.
summary: Wow - high performance and versatility in a portable saw

reviewText: I purchased this to fit as a pre-filter to my whole house filter and it works just great.  The carbon filter is thin but dense.  Would recommend.

I believe that Amazon's brief description tell you much of what you need to know about this product:  it received the highest noise reduction rating of any approved lab tested model.  I own both ear muffs and ear plugs and these muffs from Peltor are simply excellent.  I think the "noise canceling" description can be somewhat misleading, as these muffs are not an "active" noise cancellation device.  None-the-less, right out of the box you can tell that they are well made, high quality muffs.  After placing them on your head, you'll next notice just how comfortable they fit and how much they actually isolate outside sounds.  I would recommend these for anyone that may work around power tools or other machinery (or even firearms) that are very loud.  In my opinion, a $10 or less pair of muffs will work very well for mowing the lawn or other "higher than normal decibel" sounds... in fact, you may prefer the cheaper muffs, as the cheaper muffs should not be as isolating as the Peltors.  That said, there are certain very loud tools for which you may prefer these muffs due to the fact that they muffle sound SO WELL.
summary: If you don't wish to hear something... these are your muffs.

reviewText: This power supply has great performance but is sorely lacking in design. It is small, efficient, and user-friendly. I plan to use it for power bread board projects.However:1. The shape made it a bit difficult to get into a standard electrical switch box. I was able to get it enclosed using a heat gun on the switch box.2. As other reviewers stated, some of the screw holes that would normally secure the front plate to the box seem out of spec... I had to drill them out larger to align.

I love all things Petzl and have the previous XP2 headlamp. So I was very excited to get a new and improved lumens version. If you didn't have a previous revision(60 lumens), then you should be very happy what what you are getting. I am, on the other hand, not so much. It is brighter, no question about it. But Petzl is loosing me on two things.First, the tint of the new "White" is slightly purple. 10 years ago I would be happy as a clam with this tint. But in this day and age it's a little strange that a respectable company such as Petzl is doing it. It's not horrible by any stretch of the imagination, just a little disappointing. On the other hand, most people won't even notice it.Second, the new "Red" is very, very dim comparing to the previous revision. It's usable, just not as useful as the older revision.Having said that, I am going to keep this headlamp because I got it for a song(well, kind of), and one can never have too many headlamps (yeah, right).A word of advise. Unless you are a treehagger, and I am saying it in the most endearing way possible, avoid reachargable batteries and Petzl Core rechargable battery. Why? Because your 80 lumens headlamp will perform like a 50-55 lumens headlamp with those low voltage batteries. I suggest either Energizer Lithium or better yet, new and awesome, Duracell Quantum batteries. Check your local Costco or Sams Club for the best deal on those things.Oh, and that whistle that is a part of the strap. I wouldn't count on it if my life depended on it.Nothing is perfect in this world and this headlamp is not either, but it's much better then most in the same price range. I would buy it again and I would recommend it to a friend.Sincerely Yours
This is a nice little kit for a good price. It comes in a custom carrying case. Good set for getting started or adding on. Recommended.
This has added the extra security needed in our house. It was easy to install, easy to program and provides that extra safe place for valuables.

I have the PC 892 router. The Edge Guide I received doesn't mention the 892. There is a new "42690" (Why PC uses the same model number is beyond me).  The new version packaging does list the 892,893 routers and has a circle cutting attachment.  (see Porter Cable website)  The packaging is completely different in that it lists the other routers and the circle guide.  Beware of what you get, I WANT THE NEWEST IF I'M SPENDING THE MONEY FOR IT;  NOT THE "CLEAN-UP BOY", GETTING RID OF OLD STOCK.  Just time wasted, I sent it back and have to order from someone else.
summary: THIS IS NOT THE IMPROVED VERSION OF THE 42690

reviewText: Overall, they protected my eyes,and were clear and comfortable.  I was wearing a facemask which made it fog, and they did not fog up when I wasn't wearing a mask, even when I was sweating hard.
summary: Good glasses, but they will fog

reviewText: I picked my unit up under the 3M/Filtrete brand, but it's the same unit by Radio Thermostat of America.  Without the wifi, the set up was easy enough, no different than most units, I didn't even have to read the instructions for most of it.The wifi however, that's another story.  It works, yes.  But it was so fussy to set up.  The app on the iphone kept hanging up, it seemed not to be working, restart the process.  Eventually it got on the network and was able to connect.  Since then it's been 99%.  From anywhere I have internet access, I can see the temp in the house, and control the HVAC, it's nice.  The app is free, and works, but all you get is live info, no historical, no programming, but it suits most.  The computer app that you can also install also works, but you can't change anything, only monitor.  From the RTOA website you can do a bit more like set up the 7 day program, easier than on the thermostat it self, too bad the local computer can't do it quite so directly.  All of this depends on the internet being available, the connection the computer, thermostat and iphone all make is to RTOA's servers, not direct to each other.  So if you're internet is out, even on the same network I don't believe it works (but then the remote control issue is fixed by walking to the thermostat).Over all, for the money, it does the job.  It's a relatively small premium over other 7 day programmable thermostats to get the wifi/internet control of the thermostat.  What would be a nice bonus would be email alerts if the temp drops below or goes above certain values, and programming from the iphone would be a nice bonus too.Update:  The thermostat has been 100% trouble free, the app has gotten better with in app programming, widgets and other niceties.  I upped my rating to 5 star, for the $99 price tag, free app and web interface, it's hard to give it anything except 5 stars.  While set up was a bit tedious, it did work.
summary: It works, eventually.  Updated..... it's been almost perfect since installation

reviewText: These work just fine. . . but for the price here you can get 4 pairs at HF!The glasses themselves are the thin light plastic ones — they are not heavy duty or anything special, but they work just fine. Just not worth the ~$5 asking price!

These bulbs are actually quite bright. Used for bathroom globe lights and I have 3 of these in there. These bulbs are the most neutral white I have ever seen. Almost pure white no hint of blue and very little of that soft white color.

I mainly use this nailer to hold pieces together while glue dries.  Essentially, it is replacing clamps and really speeding up my builds.  The work flow goes cut-glue-tack-tack-tack ... next piece.  No waiting for glue to dry, just press on.  It reliably feeds the Bostich brads that are so easy to find.  The only problem I've had was my own mistake in driving brads that were too long for the pieces I was fastening together.  If I was using a hammer, I'd have noticed.  With a nailer, well, there were a lot of brads driven before I noticed.  It is very easy to drive a lot of brads without thinking much about it.I'm quite happy with this gizmo.  It turns big projects into quicker smaller projects.

Came very sharp, ready to go. The sheath is really basic, doesn't hold the knife in place and I would probably fashion something else if I were planning on taking it on any excursions, but that's a tiny drawback. The knife feels super sturdy.
Priced just right to have for the next project where a short drill bit is required to work in tight places, if used with an angle drill. A few more sizes could be offered, but one can make do.
summary: Short Drill Bits for Tight Work

reviewText: Excellent and reliable, waterproof (rain proof) LED flashlights that are handy to have everywhere around your home and vehicles as the light is so bright you easily see what you may have dropped.

I had an old one, bought about 4 years ago and it finally bit the dust. I went to WalMart but they had none, so I came here. It was a great price for 2 of them.  This one fits WAYYY better than the other one I had.  This was has elastic bands on both sides to keep it snug.  The fabric is thick, soft, and nice to look at.  You cut to fit the exact size you need and instructions are clear and easy to understand.  It has really helped keep the drafts out.

I have an air compressor in my freestanding workshop, and have air lines to my garage which is 30 feet away.I wanted a remote so I could turn the air compressor on from the garage without having to walk around the buildings, unlock the workshop, hit the on switch and then walk back around every time I needed a little air...Took it out of the box, plugged it into an outlet & the compressor into it, put the included battery in the remote and hit its "on" button.Instantly the compressor started.Now for the distance test. Will it work though the 2 walls (one cinder block and the other stud & stucco, about 45 feet)??  No problem!  Works reliably every time.The main box has a power cord, a single outlet, a resettable circuit breaker, and a tiny recessed button to pair additional remotes (there is a large label affixed that has great instructions on remote pairing). Measures approx. 5 1/2 x 2 3/4" x 3 1/4"The remote has 2 buttons, one on & one off, plus a red LED light. The LED lights up when either button is pushed, so you know the remote's battery is good. (also has label affixed that has great instructions on remote pairing). Measures approx. 5 1/2" x 1 3/8" x 7/8".Great investment. Highly Recommended

To see Filtret's whole house system, go here:Filtrete 3WH-HD-S01 Large Capacity Whole House System.  Nothing about the system costs much, just the labor.  It's a job for a plumber to install.The standard capacity filters have to be changed more often than one might think.  Their life each is 3 months for standard usage, which includes 2 bathrooms.  Filtrete is saying 4 of them will be needed for one year for this standard 2-bathroom use level.  That's not expensive.  I pay a lot more to change the filter in my GE refrigerator.The Safe Drinking Water Act requires the Environmental Protection Agency to periodically review that national drinking water regulation for each type of contaminant.  The result is we're getting more highly treated water in some areas.  I think anybody can notice the added chlorine levels in the water because it can be smelled in the shower.I recommend this product as a whole-house solution to basic filtration.  If possible, it's still advisable to more thoroughly filter water actually intended for drinking.  Therefore, the homeowner has to weigh practicalities when designing a system.  This Filtrete system is quite affordable.
summary: Filtrete's whole house solution is affordable

reviewText: I have owned this hose for about six years now.  It does an excellent job of catching dust from the 1-inch fitting on many of my Porter Cable tools.  I had used a Porter Cable sander with one at a friends, and was so impressed with how much better it caught the dust than my sander, I bought a new Porter Cable sander, that came with the hose, and sold my old sander on ebay.I had a "Mr. Nozzle" hose on my shop vac when I bought my sander, and the Porter Cable hose hooked up to it with no problems.  (The "Mr. Nozzle" hose is a lot better than the standard hose that comes with the shop vacuums, and is well worth the money it costs.  It flexes better, and is a lot more durable.)I have since been influenced in my tool purchases by whether they have good dust capture capabilities, and as a consequence have several more sanders that hook up to the 1-inch hose, two Porter Cable Saws, a biscut joiner, and several routers I use it with.I am satisfied enough that I am ordering another today, because I forgot mine at my sister's house and can't stand the dust that gets in the air with out it.

Recently purchased this for making name signs and monograms for the grandchildren.  Found that included letter patterns where a nice addition.  Set up took some time as there were two sets of instructions with pictures only but not a big deal. Did find all parts were there and the only reason I didn' give it a five star because the stylus tip was broken off.  But after a minor fixing with a dab of gorilla glue it worked ok.  It does take some practice and a steady hand but is a very cool tool to have

The led is super bright which is nice.  The focus is also really nice.  However, the switch is terrible. It will not remember what setting you left it on.  Instead it moves to the next setting each time you power it on.  So if you have it on low, then turn it off, it will start to strobe the next time you turn it on. Then you have to cycle back through to low... every single time you use the light. It doesn't matter how long the light is off. Every power on moves to the next setting, even if you left it off for 24 hours.  Very frustrating and very sad for such a nice led and build.It would have had 5 stars has it not been for this obvious design flaw.
This unit is small but very powerful. I use rechargeable batteries since I use flashlights in my work and these are very efficient

When you see the name "Pony" on clamps etc. you can be assured they will last a long time without problems.  The little vice is perfect for light duty work or a young child.  It comes with a powder coat paint finish and actually looks good!  For heavy work a larger vice would be required but this serves a purpose and you won't be disappointed.  The face of the jaws do not have a grooved surface but they are smooth so they would be good for hobbyists.  Highly recommend.
summary: Pony 13025 3-Inch Light Duty Clamp On Vise

reviewText: I just got this gizmo yesterday from Hong Kong, and so I can't say anything about it's durability. It worked right out of the box (with my installed battery), and the light is very bright. The front bezel adjusts the focus of the beam by sliding forward and back...rearmost being the most diffused. I wanted to use this flashlight as an aid in getting from the bed to the toilet in the dark house at 3 AM, and so I unscrewed the front piece that contains the lens and inserted a piece of red paper cut to the size of the lens opening and then reassembled...and it works fine now for my purpose. The tailpiece screws off easily for battery insertion (one AA). All the threads are very nicely cut, and there's an O-ring on both the tail and the front threaded parts. Overall it seems to be equal in quality to MagLight. The clip is held on by Allen screws, and should be removable, seems to me. I highly recommend this light, but with the caveat that I just got it and haven't used it much.17Jan13 update: I inadvertently discovered, in the darkened house, that this light does indeed have the ability to have three "on" settings. The first click from "off" goes to "full on"; then a light tap on the rubber-covered switch takes it to "dim"; and from there a light tap takes it to "very rapid pulse". So, there it is. The taps for "dim" and for "pulse" are made quickly and lightly--just a bouncy touch on the pad. A full push of the pad from any of the "on" settings takes the flashlight to "off". By the way, I'm still liking the flashlight after a few night's use for lighting the way to the bathroom as mentioned above. And, I bought it from BBQbuy in Hong Kong, and the shipping was very quick, and the actual delivery took a couple of weeks.
summary: Seems like a very good little flashlight

reviewText: This little guy is awesome for rating power consumption! I plugged a small power strip into it, and connected a computer with dual flat-panel monitors, and rated overall power consumption over a day! Using this utility, you can really see how much power your items are taking up, and how much money they are costing you per hour! (Also, a cool thing to check is how much power things use while off! You would be amazed!)The interface is simple, and easy to use! Everyone should keep one in their house, and use it!

I am so happy with this filter. I've used it quite a bit over the past month or so. It's nowhere near as loud as I thought it would be.After the first two days of use (a weekend) the outer filter was 50% caked. Yikes. I've got a dust problem!I definitely recommend this unit. It looks sharp, too.
summary: Moves a lot of air. No rattles. Not too loud.

reviewText: The tools themselves are okay for simple tasks around the house.  Easy to keep in a drawer.  I doubt anyone would want to steal these tools, they are..... ugly.  I think the screwdriver is the most handy tool, and the hammer is good for gentle tapping of small nails/putting predrilled furniture together.  The actual tools themselves are pretty neat in that there are many little tools inside the big ones.  That's handy.  I think the kitchen would be a good place to put these in a drawer for rapid access for the little things in your house that need fixing.
you just can't beat this light for the money  these are the best deals around. i have bought about a dozen so far and will buy more.

This is the best penlight I've had. Brightness is unreal for a penlight with 2xAAA batteries, but although they say 180 lumens I'd say it's more like 150. It's slightly brighter than my Coast HP5 which is rated at 141/41 lumens for the high and low settings. But still, fantastic for a penlight. I've had no problems with the tail cap switch like some have had but as I'm not a LEO or military I don't need to worry about light discipline. Fit and finish is outstanding; the threads are also anodized and feel very smooth--smoother than my Olight ST15 which is a much more expensive light. Surprisingly the barrel is iron or steel and the head and tail cap aluminum after checking with the magnetic end of my Olight ST15 titanium.I note one reviewer said the Nitecore EC1 is a better EDC but to me those are different lights. The Nitecore requires a lithium battery, CR123A, which can be hard to find. Lithium batteries require different, special chargers from ordinary alkalines and NiMH. AAA alkalines are much easier to find than CR123A's, although not as easy as the AA. I also wouldn't carry the EC1 in my shirt pocket as with a thinner penlight. My one gripe is I wish the light control sequence was the opposite with maximum brightness first, then I can dial back if I wish. But other than that, an almost perfect light.

At $4 this little Cree LED flashlight has what I'm looking for - great bang for the buck.  I bought this Cree in Jan'2014 so I've owned it for about 6 months.  What inspired me to write this review?...tonight I was out in the backyard double fisting 2 flashlights...one was this little Cree (which takes 1 AA battery) and the other was my old giant Maglite (which takes 4 D cells)...I compared the 2 light outputs and this little Cree was actually brighter than the Mag!  I will add the disclosure that the Mag is much older and not LED (and I paid around $30 for the Mag).  Still, physically the Mag is at least 20x larger/heavier than the Cree so kind of embarrassing that the Cree outshines it (ie, Doberman overpowered by Chihuahua).  This Cree has good build quality too...still working well after 6 months (and still with my original AA battery).  Shipping was a bit slow - but order a couple even if you don't need them (yet) and they'll be there when you need them.If I need to fend off a burglar the Mag wins, but other than that I'll pick this $4 Cree.  In consideration of price/value - 5 stars from me.  I hope you found this review helpful.
summary: This puppy has a big bite!

reviewText: This is a good tape ruler.  I have used it much more than I had thought I would.  My "honey do" list greatly expanded suddenly when this tape arrived and finding centers of each wall and so many other things, this ruler became my constant companion for weeks.  Now I use it several times a week.  Flawless operation, which is what I like.  Smooth operation.  Be careful when it is recoiling to keep your finger out of the way, though, because the recoil is powerful.  I (and my finger) learned that lesson.
summary: Great tape ruler, works smoothly and flawlessly

reviewText: Do not purchase for a 1/2 inch or less bit, as end holding bit is slightly larger than 1/2 inch

I have been impressed with the quality and performance of all the foursevens flashlights that I own (four of them now).  Good light, nice package.  Had to dock one star though because this could be US made, but it isnt.
summary: Love it but not US made

reviewText: This moose is possibly the best tool on the market for large, flat surfaces.  Use it for table tops and counter tops.  It works especially well for flattening self-edges for plastic laminate work.At over fifteen pounds, it's too heavy for delicate work or small projects, but get it on a large area and it floats effortlessly across the surface.The new whisper series feature is a treat and the dust bag works very well.  All in all this tool gives the most bang for the buck in it's class.  But do yourself a favor-buy a couple of little sanders to keep big boy company.
summary: Outstanding,  but not for everybody or every job.

reviewText: Just received this and it seems great. I don't know how they can make it for $5, but I just ordered 3 more to put with my shooting gear and have in vehicles.
summary: How do they make this for $5?

reviewText: As good of a mini flash and as brightest as you can find at this level.. a very good price too..

At first the Kemelon Self Lock was great, took a little getting us to tough but it was great.  Now, after several projects, the tape is creeping and there is no way to lock it down any tighter.  If you need a tape measure that locks reliably look elsewhere.
summary: Starts to creep after a while

reviewText: Just finished building a vacuum cart with a Dust Deputy on it and I couldn't believe the performance. I cleaned out the shop vac and put a new filter element in it. I then proceeded to clean up the mess I made building the cart. When I was done I looked in the vacuum NOTHING, it was all in the bucket. I sent a couple of plastic bags down the hose and you can see exactly how this thing works. The only negative things are the cost and the flimsy plastic in the cyclone. You really don't need the deluxe kit unless you plan to strap it to your shop vac, just buy the cyclone and bolt to a Home Depot bucket. Very happy with the air quality.

Living in the country, I need a light bright enough at night to give me a shot at critters 50 to 100 yards away. This light, on bright, gives me that ability. After buying 5 other brands that wouldn't work, I am glad that I found this light!

Cool power meter. Works great. Does what it says.This model doesn't have a battery, so it shuts off and loses its memory when you unplug it or if the power goes out. If you want battery backup power, you can pay an extra ten bucks or so for the P4460. That model can also do the cost math for you if you input your cost per kWh. I think those are the only real differences between the two.
summary: Cool meter. Great for electricity misers and electronics nerds.

reviewText: First off, the purchase and shipping of this product couldn't have gone better - no problems at all.The dust deputy itself works very well, but I have had to add some support to the top of the cyclone, because it is not very stable and unless you attach it to your shop vacuum, then it easily falls over when the shopvac hose is attached.  The top heavy hose also makes the cyclone bend back and forward, which could weaken the top of the dustbin lid over time.  I have sorted this by adding a support to the top of the cyclone.I also needed to purchase adapters to get my shop vac hoses to fit the cyclone.  Oneida do supply a set of these as an extra option.  Maybe they should include them in the kit.

To make something out of what appears to be a hard plastic type of material, then mount it on something that does random orbits and except it to last is like mixing oil and water.Got tired of replacing these pads, the cost adds up quick, figured there had to be a better way. Came up with a method that works very good so thought I would share the idea.What I did was to get a small piece of metal, for me I used what is called a Simpson Strong Tie. This is a piece of rectangular metal with many holes in it.  Is used in construction to hold boards together by nailing the plate across the joint. Found these to be both cheap and tough enough to last and thin enough not to cause problems.Simply cut it to fit the circular base, small enough not to block the vacuum holes. Marked and drilled holes just large enough for the mounting screws. Using JB Weld, attached this cut out to the hook and loop base. When the epoxy was set up good enough, mounted the pad back onto the sander letting it sit 24 hours before using.The metal will make the pad last a long time and will not egg shape like the plastic does.Works very well!!
This set came quickly and efficiently, and meets up to my specifications while making short work and clean surfaces when I do my tile work, have no complaints with this at all.

This light is great for lighting up a dark doorway or a dark set of stairs. It's not quite bright enough to match a regular outdoor spotlight, but it suits my needs. The four star rating is based on the fact that it is not as bright as i expected and it turns off rather quickly when no motion is detected (to preserve batteries I suppose). If it were a little brighter or had adjustable 'time off' settings, I'd give it five stars.

I am very happy to see this new led technologly in a easy to use general purpose flashlight. I was looking at the E21 but decided on the E25 because it had another brightness level. Anything over 150 lumens with a bright white light is a little too much for everyday use. I only use the high setting when outdoors searching for something or maybe in a personal defense situation. Most of the time medium is just fine. For up close work low does a great job and will also work for everything else if the batteries are low. Yes, it's that bright. This thing is very versatile. Easy to find batteries. Long run time. Switch on the head for holding at waist level versus shoulder level. It's long and heavy enough to hold and feel with gloves on yet small enough to slip in a pocket. The light beam is a great mix between the hot spot and flood which works well for close up and far away making it perfect for an all purpose light. This is my new favorite lite. My mini mag led is now in the toolbox where it will still get plenty of use. A bit of warning: This thing is, as someone else put it "stupid bright" so be mindful around children. Not a toy.

The saw itself is great. It's powerful, accurate, and a joy to use. Changing blades is easy and the bevel and height adjustment controls are straightforward. Also, the dust chute is a nice feature, and the saw has a space where you can run the cord through on the side to keep it out of the way.Two minor gripes:1) The case, thought adequate in size for the saw itself, leaves little room for any accessories.2) Speaking of accessories, it would have been nice if the dust bag was included with the saw. If you buy the saw, get the dustbag. Mine works quite well.

They are cheapo in that they will do a job but not last very long.  I only needed them for a aluminum pipe that is a quarter thick and they did the job flawlessly but after the job they were almost like rubbing plain metal against the aluminum.  If your looking for a long lasting set this isn't the right set for you but if you just have one job and need a good file to do it then these are the best on Amazon.

This is a very attractive torchiere style lamp that fits in well with other antique bronze pieces in my living room.  The glass shades arrived intact and are very nice looking with faint swirls around the circumference.  Overall, this lamp looks much more expensive than it really is.  it is well weighted and not tippy.  The reading lamp is mounted on a gooseneck pole so it can be adjusted in any direction a person would find suitable.Not sure why a few others complained it was difficult to put together because I had it up and running in about 10 minutes.  The pole sections fit together tightly and there is NO wobble as with some other inexpensive halogen torchiers I've had in the past.  A tool is included for first loosening then tightening the nut that keeps the smaller shade in place.  The reading lamp uses a candelabra-base bulb (a very bright 40-watt incandescent bulb is included while the primary, standard-base  bulb is not.  I prefer "soft sunlight" bulbs so had to order one to fit the reading lamp portion.There is a descrepancy in the description relating to the light switch(s).  The description indicates there are two rotary switches, one for the reading lamp and another 3-way switch for the main lamp.  I've sent a note to Amazon to correct the description as there is just a single 4-way switch.  First position is reading lamp on, 2nd is main lamp on, 3rd is both lamps on, and 4th is off.  I actually prefer the 4-way since I will be using cfl daylight bulbs which are neither 3-way or dimmable.My one and only design complaint does relate to the switch.  It is located just under the large shade and is too high to be reached while seated.  I need to select which setting I want prior to sitting down.  Small point and just a minor inconvenience and I will not deduct a star for it.I am extremely happy that this is not a halogen torchier which can get very, very hot during operation.  As with some other "incandescent-style" torchiers the bulb does not lay sideways but the base allows it to stand straight up thus allowing for higher wattage cfl bulbs.  Regardless of what you use, be sure to stay at or under the recommended wattage.I'm looking forward to getting many years of service from this beautiful lamp.

The only thing I am using it for is the Watts readings. Handles up to the full 15Amp circuit rating of 1875Watts. I have tested from motors, 1500watt electric pans, 42 inch LCD TV, computers, etc. Works great.My only gripe is the LCD screen. Easy enough to read with enough light in front of it. But would have been really nice to have a backlight option for darker viewing. But really this is not anything to give it anything less than 5 stars. Works perfectly.
summary: works just like everyone says, love it.

reviewText: The reviews I read were correct.  This stuff is so easy to use, even for a Grandmother. Clean up is a breeze. I highly recommend this adhesive. I've had it 2 days and have found many uses for it.

I saw an ad on TV for the "turbo snake" that got me hunting down something similar here on Amazon.  First up, don't buy the turbo snake from its online site, or on the phone.  Like all these pitchman products they slaughter you with the S&H, and you can do much better here on Amazon.  The turbo snake, like this product and many other variations on Amazon are basically a thick flexible nylon or plastic strip around 18" long that have some kind of teeth at the end designed to grab and extract the hair and gunk that gets caught in the trap of bathroom sinks and tubs. Most of the products you will see here on Amazon,(including the turbo snake) claim they are for one application only. (Something they fail to mention at all in their infomercial). Be advised this is a gray area.  ALL the products of this type can be used more than once if you have a strong stomach, or are just plain cheap.  The reason why drain cleaners such as these tell you to toss it out after each use is because the prickly system of teeth employed at the business end that is responsible for grabbing the hair and gunk is very hard to clean. The teeth tend to hold on to its yucky prize most tenaciously. You will be forced to use your fingers diligently to dislodge the crap, which a lot of folks will cringe at. And in the course of the cleaning you may get carried away and break a few of the sensitive teeth, thus making it a little less efficient each time.  Still however, if you're willing to do this, and or feel that a little disgusting chore comes about easier than $$$, you can accomplish it and use each of these tools at least a couple of more times.  The other reason why products such as these tell you to throw them away is because after each use the flexible rod gets bent and twisted a little, thus a tad harder to operate.  Not impossible or greatly damaged, but a little misshapen.  Certainly not does it get so bent out of shape after one application that it becomes useless to be sure.  One has to decide for oneself if they want to use this tool once and buy in multiple units, or perform the disgusting deed.  As for the tools effectiveness, let me say first off that I have owned 3 different versions of this type of unclogger and have found them all to be of great use in getting to the clog and effectively extracting the crap.  There is only a very small or moderate difference in all of them.  Mainly in the design of the teeth. All of these tools are designed for clogs at the trap, and very close to the sink or tub. That means they are unfortunately a little short, around 18 to 24 inches, and designed only to turn the corner of a bend in the sink and that's it.  If you suspect your clog is a little deeper, you will either have to purchase a longer snake, or call a dreaded professional.  Other than that, this product, and all of them I have tried like them are both very effective, AND reusable if you are willing and accept the terms described beforehand.  I cannot recommend any one over the other since all of them seem to be equally effective despite the small differences in design.  My only recommendation would be that if you are going to be one that passes up on the squeamish cleaning and use once, buy several of them at a time and make the shipping charge worth it.  Trust me, these little tools work much better and are far easier than removing a trap underneath a sink or tub to get at a clog.  Which for me, always and relentlessly no matter how careful I am or how much I tighten it, means they leak forever more...

I have sensitive skin and wear a lot of disposable gloves. That way, if a drop of cleaning solution or an allergen touches my gloves, then I don't have to deal with an itchy rash that will flake and bleed for weeks. I know that many other people have life-protecting reasons to wear disposable gloves, but since I can tell if something touched me instantly without exposing me to something deadly, I figure I am a good person to try them out.For many chores, I usually need to "double up" on gloves, as they are often so thin and delicate. Not these.  Even without doubling, they are plenty thick for any task I can think of, although they are slightly less flexible and have less "feel" than thinner gloves. If I'm washing a floor or assembling something greasy, I need not worry about feeling every little notch and scratch on a piece. If you absolutely must feel every detail on every bit you're touching, then these gloves probably won't be for you.The "one size fits most" is probably meant to apply to men, and I am not a man. Furthermore, I have tiny hands so these were huge on me. To check size, I enlisted my favorite husband, who normally wears an XL in Men's gloves. They fit him nicely, with room to spare, and no tugging to make them fit. He said, "They feel fine." (Which is high praise for him)If you need gloves that can stand up and don't have to have sensitivity to feel the year on a penny, these are terrific. If you don't want black gloves, too bad. These are the manly black gloves that look like the ones tattooists use. If you're looking for pastel purple gloves, sorry, you have to go elsewhere. :-)
summary: Glovely and Sturdy, , but I wear them, too.

reviewText: If you get your saw blade alighned correctly this blade is the best I have ever used. Ripping or cross cut it looks and feels as though had run the piece of wood through the jointer. It is smooth and easy to move through the saw. I recomend this blade for any woodworker.

a note from a "bulls**t" building engineer who runs 20 high-rise buildings. A total of 5,000+ apartments, condos, and town houses.it will take hair out of the drain within 17". Beyond 17", you will have to snake, use drain opener liquid, or Water Ramp. Zip-it works best in tub drain because your hair usually falls in the tub. Aren't they?-New houses: 95% tub/drains are clogged because of hair. Zip-it should work fine. Best solution is to shave all of your hair off. LOL!!-Old houses/buildings :95% tub/drain are clogged because of grease & all junks down there (far beyond the wall). Zip-it WILL NOT do its job effectively. Snaking the drain ( with Power Drain Clearing Drum Auger) or use Kinetic Water Ramp works best.and please drop $3 Tub Basket Strainer in your tub!! It would help a lot!!

This is a very nice blade. It cuts like butter and the quality is there. You can tell by the size of the carbide. I will use this for a long time is it was worth the higher price. The way I look at it, I rather pay now and have a great blade than try to do the job with a mediocre one and end up paying for another one once I am not satisfied with the result.

This flashlight is extremely bright, however be aware that there is not that much of a difference in lumens at a certain point.  Yes this is brighter than most, however if you told me it was 400 lumens instead of 1000 I would believe it.  I have flashlights that are 200 lumens and this is brighter, but not by as much as you might think.  That is NOT a criticism, but just the reality of the "lumen wars".This COAST flashlight is extremely well made and sturdy, all metal construction.  Think a 2D cell MagLight for size comparison.Now, once criticism: why in the world did they not make this thing take two D cell batteries instead of 9 AA batteries???  That really bugs me, however at least it doesn't require stupidly expensive CR2's or 123's or whatever.  I use rechargeable AA batteries and the money saved over those crazy expensive specialty batteries is a huge advantage.Lastly, one very nice feature of this light is that when you have it in the widest beam position, the light is 100 percent evenly distributed - it is very nice to have it on that setting when needing light to perform a repair on something, or a power outage, etc.  You can set it on the far side of a large room and light up the room like a traditional house lamp with a 150 watt bulb.Yes I would buy another one of this model if I needed another full size flashlight, great value for the quality and performance.
summary: Great flashlight, but a couple things I have noticed

reviewText: I constantly have to clean my hair out of the shower drain or we get a back-up so I thought this tool would be handy to have.I like it, it works pretty good and does pull my hair up.  The geek in me thinks it is fun to use too.

We had to push pretty hard with a pen before we could put a hole in these gloves. We tried ripping them (without the benefit of a hole already in them) and we couldn't get them to rip no matter how hard we stretched them, pushed them and twisted them.  Once we put a hole in it, they ripped easily, but otherwise, these gloves are tough!They are very soft and thin, fitting like a second skin.  They are thick enough that you won't have to worry about grease, oil, or paint getting through them.  They just barely cover the entire hand an palm. They do not cover wrists, at least not on our hands.  A 50-pack would probably be a life-time supply for us, as we only need to work on our tractor once or twice a year.These gloves will "get 'er done!"
summary: pretty tough, yet thin! Good for greasy work!

reviewText: I wanted to run my home theater cabling inside the walls and over the ceiling, which required some type of finished terminals for the speaker ends.  This bracket was ideal to cut into the various locations in the ceiling and walls, then add a single gang plate for the jacks, thus allowing me with a short run from the speakers using banana plugs.  There isn't much need for a single gang box since the entire installation is low voltage.  Anyone possessing rudimentary carpentry skills should be able to do the job fairly readily.  I recommend that you cut the holes just a little undersized, then trim to fit taking care to ensure that the tops and bottoms are parallel and square with the two sides of each bracket.  It helps to be certain that the holes are well marked before making the cuts with a good drywall saw so as to avoid oddly shaped holes and out of plumb work.  Of course, you can patch it up afterward, however that takes time.  I might mention that I looked at mounting brackets at my local hardware/lumber mass merchandiser when I did the installation and found their solutions to be about 4 times the cost and inferior in quality and utility.  (They just happen to have orange as one of their corporate colors.)  It did take a few days for UPS ground to deliver, however it takes a while to do all the prep work and get the cable runs in place anyway, so you'll likely be just about ready for them when they arrive.  Good product and the seller was responsive.
summary: Life is better with this product

reviewText: We already have one of these pumps running in our sump pit, I liked it because it's quiet and apparently reliable (4 years and counting). I brought a second unit via amazon - figured i'd double my money and have a backup unit placed maybe 2" higher in the pit, if one pump dies or can't keep up, the 2nd kicks in when the water rises.Again, the pump works fine, good and robust - shame the filter/inlet housing on the base is only made from ABS plastic - if you dropped this while installing it, not sure how it would hold up... With this in mind, it was shipped in it's flimsy single layer cardboard box, i'm amazed it arrived intact.

best and most versatile random orbital sander i own.  though diminutive (approximately  3 1/2" pads plus similarly sized delta pad), it packs a wallop when turned loose on wood.  I only use the brilliant adhesives, so i can only comment on them: they take off material as fast as sanders much larger.  I recommend without reservation.  The *only* downside is the price, but one gets what one pays for.  Note, it comes in a Festool Systainer box which is well designed and provides space for extra pads and adhesives.For those who are unfamiliar with Festool sanders, the design is quite unusual when compared to sanders from big box stores: the adhesives attach to intermediate "cushions" via velcro-like attachment, which in turn attach to the sanding pad via velcro together with a centering snap.  this is a must with Festool, because of the costs involved (you're not going to find these parts at wally world, folks.  so when you chew up the intermediate cushions on the delta pad, you only replace the cushion for $14 rather than the whole pad for $50.I'm too cheap to buy the Festool vacuum that attaches to Festools, so i bought the 1 1/4" attachment hose for the shopvac - which works fine with the Fein 921072K13 Step Adaptor ($6.32 @ Amazon).  This is the only adaptor that I'd recommend!The abrasive media is $50/100 sheets, so consumables will drive up the price even further.  RO 90DX videos abound on the Internet, so I'd recommend giving them a look before buying if you're price-conscious
I have been using a $50 Craftsman saw for many years.  This is far better.  The saw is steady in your hand, and does not "wander" down the cut.
summary: This is a real circular saw

reviewText: It's a really nice and well constructed box. Holds the cord in tact. The rubber seal on the end seals the cord fairly tight. You have to push in it to form a tight seal. One of the reviewer says the hold is too small. I think it's design this way to have tight seal. Easy to open and close with the lid snaps right in. I got two of them.
Couldn't find this locally. So nought it at the zon. Great blade for its intended purpose. And you can sharpen it if you have the skill and know how.
shipped as promised and has not let me down yet.fluke leads work great on the meter and have checked it for accuracy and seems to be very accurate

This meter is built well and the probes that come with it are as well. It works great also you should NOTE that it has 'duh' led's that light up a circle around the correct plugs based on which mode you are using.The only con after some use is it seems to have issues with the multi-switch and some times I need to turn it on and off a few times to get it actually turned on. This is the reason for a minus one star.

The action on this dimmer is pretty bad. It turns on easily with an easy flick up. However, when trying to turn it off, you need to apply significantly more pressure...so you can't just easily flick it up and down, on and off. It's a minor annoyance, but I don't want to be mildly irritated every time I turn off my light.I've had a lot of dimmers like this in the past, but never really had this issue. Seems like an easy issue for them to fix too...not sure why they can't have the same action turning it off as they do turning it on.Returning it for a different dimmer.
summary: Poor slide action when turning off

reviewText: these are very sturdy. no wiggle from the section that it joined on pliers. also they have great handles with enough length for good leverage.

I'VE LOOKED THIS OVER PRETTY GOOD. THIS THING IS NICE. EXCELLENT FINISH.  EXCELLENT MACHINING.VERY BRIGHT WITH JUST ONE AA CELL. LED IS WHITE WITH ONLY A FAINT BLUE TINGE. BODY IS A THREE PIECE DESIGN. DON'T EXPECT IT TO BE WATER-PROOF. PUT ONE IN YOUR COAT POCKET AND LIGHT YOUR WAY!THE SWITCH IS UNDER A SOFT COVER. TIME WILL TELL IF IT LASTS. THIS IS USUALLY THE WEAK LINK...

good mirror, nail file, bottle opener, flat blade screwdriver, tweezers, plastic toothpick. knife is very sharp and bigger than I thought, perfectly fits in wallet. very good and useful thing. I recommend it.

I used to carry around a little spyderco knife but it has a fatal flaw: it's too expensive and I can never get it back to factory sharpness.  Sharpening knives is a total hassle--I've spent too much time doing it and it never comes out as good as I want.  Anyway I used to carry around a spyderco but for simple things like opening packages or cutting anything that's not soft, I wouldn't want to use it for fear of dulling the blade.  I got frustrated with the dilemma after a while and wished there was something like my utility knives that I use to cut anything and everything without worrying about it.  Then I found this product.  What a great idea!  I now use this for an every-day carry knife.Features of this product that I like:===============================* Nice big interchangeable blade.  I use it any time I want to cut something...anything.  Doesn't have to be a high-quality target.  I don't worry about dulling it because the blade and easily and cheaply be swapped.* Good quality blade comes with it.  It's quite sharp and it's very thick...much thicker than the blades you would pick up if you just went to a hardware store and grabbed the first set you found.  I've read reviewers that said it doesn't work as well once you put in the "standard thickness" blades.  I'm fine with getting the thick stuff because it's strong against lateral stresses--more like a regular pocket knife.  You could use this knife to, for example, whittle.  I'm not sure I'd use a regular knife for whittling because it would dull too fast.  I wouldn't use a regular utility blade to whittle because it would bend too easily.* Locking mechanism works great.  It stays open and won't close until you push the locking mechanism aside.  That won't happen by accident, it's easy to do, and unlocking it doesn't endanger the fingers thanks to the little finger guard they have there.* Build quality is quite good.  It's heavy, shiny, and smooth.  The resistance to opening is appropriate.  That is, it's easy to open when you want to but the blade doesn't just fall open in your pocket or elsewhere.  There's a real light click when you open it and then smooth operation until you get it fully open.  I don't open blades with a single hand, so I don't sympathize with people who want really easy-opening.  That would be dangerous.* This tool is about as small as it can reasonably get and accommodate the blades it uses.  I have heard someone say the pointy end of the blade pokes out beyond the handle.  I haven't seen that...must be a different brand of blade that person was using.* When the knife is closed, the blade doesn't come in contact with the handle anywhere, so it's not getting dull or developing notches.* Fit in the hand is good.  I mean, it compares well with a pocket knife.  I don't put my finger on the little metal thing that holds the blade in.  I think if I did, I would find this uncomfortable to hold.  As it is, it's real nice.  Mind you, it's not the kind of ergonomics that I would require if I were cutting things all day.  But remember, this is a replacement for a pocketknife (seldom used) not a utility knife (used all day by some people).  I would never cut carpet or shingles or something with this.  I wouldn't even use it if my job were to open boxes all day.  This is for occasional use.  Use it in place of a pocket knife.Couple of things that could be better:================================* I don't understand why knives like this have clips.  I always carry it low in the pocket and the clip is just in the way.  The clip comes off very easily (though it is destroyed in the process).  Simply bend the clip out then push it in a little.  There's a little hook on the inside of the handle where the clip attaches and once the clip is bent it pops right out.  I have removed and disposed of my clip.* Underneath the clip the level of the handle and of the knife-holding mechanism isn't quite flat.  It doesn't affect anything but aesthetically I would prefer if it were flat.  Minimal is good but it has to all match up.* This knife is made of surprisingly thick and heavy metal.  It weighs a lot in the pocket...as much as larger knives of other brands.  Maybe that's because of the all-steel construction.  Anyway, it's heavier than I'd like.  Maybe they wanted to make it lighter but the resulting knife wouldn't have enough strength or something.* I would have liked to have had a hole drilled somewhere so I could put it on a lanyard or even keychain.  It's a bit heavy for that, but overall I think that would be a more likely use than the clip it comes with.  I have looked around for a place that I could safely drill and use but there really isn't one in this design.  Maybe if the main hinge had a hole in it or something.Closing Comments==================I kind of alluded to this a little bit above: This is a pocket knife.  Not a replacement for a Stanley utility knife or competitor.  It does a great job being minimal in the pocket and working in a pinch for occasional light or heavy duty.  Everyone I have seen who have given this a bad review did so because they wanted to use it professionally, cutting drywall or carpet or something.  For those uses you want a full-sized utility knife with much better ergonomics.  Also those full sized ones allow the blade to come out only partially, if you want to make shallow cuts.  And they carry spares and stuff.  There are lots of things a utility knife should have that this does not.  I do not consider that a problem.  This is a pocket knife.  There are few or no things that a pocketknife has that this lacks.I recommend this to anyone who currently carries a pocketknife around and sometimes doesn't use it because they don't want to dull the blade.
I was actually shocked at how little effort I had to use to go through copper wire as thick as my index finger. There was virtually no resistance to my squeeze.
summary: Cuts through thick cables like butter

reviewText: Just got this light - I really only bought it to get to $25 Super Saver Shipping. I garden and do some mosaic stuff, so I thought it looked neat.I really like it, though! It's pretty tall and the glass part looks nice and is large enough to stand out, but not huge. Probably a little smaller than a softball or a little bigger than a large xmas ball.I didn't turn mine on to charge until around noon today and it is on tonight (not sure how long it will stay lit, though). The light is fairly bright and it looks really pretty. It doesn't illuminate a ton (mostly just for looks), but with a few, it could light up a pathway. The glass pieces used are clear. The solar panel piece doesn't look awful in the daylight, either.The only thing I don't love is the colors: red, yellow, and green. Not the color combo I would have picked, but it is the one in the picture, so I knew basically what I was getting. I wish it was a bit more multicolored or you could choose from more options (I don't want the clear "color changing" version). This would make a great gift for a gardener!

Very good flashlight for the price if you have the batteries. Has the old style bulb, not a LED, but puts out a bright wide beam. The adjustable head allows you to use it hands free and aim the beam where you need it. Very happy with the performance.

This looked like a great option to avoid the Made in China problems with quality. My Made in China Husky cord from Home Depot was junk. This is better, but had a handling or shipping problem with a cut on the outside insulator which I taped up and hopefully will be good.

I was tired of not having random stuff I needed, this is the solution. For any around-the-house jobs I can't foresee being without what I need anymore. (forgive that sentence's grammar, but I'm keeping it.) For the things I already had, it is nice to have backups. Backup screwdrivers, allen wrenches, etc. A variety of standard sized bit heads. Hammer. Tape measure. Pliers, a level, and a box cutter. sockets.The case is solid and items fit securely in their spots. Several items were dislodged during shipping, but that occurred during excessive tossing and jostling and hub-bub. Upon reinsertion, I've lightly tossed the unit onto my floor and everything remains secure. Any common personal use should be no issue.
Great price for this premium brand. It's the third one I've purchased in the last year. Builder plus not available in stores.
I enjoy this beautiful fan which moves air very well. Installation went well with no problems

Like most Gerber products, this is a good looking tool. The outer finish is smooth but not slippery, and has a dull finish typical for stainless steel. The hinge moves easily. The knife is made of stainless steel and appears to be of good construction. A non-removable clip is attached for use on your pocket or as a money clip.Opening the knife does take two hands and there is no convenient place to really grip the blade holder when opening, so you do have to pinch the blade holder tightly when opening. Just be a little careful when doing that.I do like that this tool uses standard utility knife razor blades as I have loads of them around the workshop, including carpet hooks and serrated blades. The included utility blade is indeed razor sharp. Blade replacement requires a screwdriver or small coin to remove the holding screw. When open, about 3/4 of the blade is exposed, giving a cutting edge of 1-1/2 inches. The hinge looks like it is removable with a spanner-type driver, but I'm not going there unless the hinge somehow gets hung up.The tool fits nicely in my hand, and the blade finger guard is nicely placed. The blade liner lock works fine. Small enough to be a nice EDC. Other specs as noted in the Amazon description seem to be right.A pretty good deal for the price (which has increase $3 since I purchased it).Nits: (1) The blade holder should have a small thumb indent on at least one side to make it easier to open. The metal there seems to be more than thick enough to accommodate that. (2) blade replacement requires removal of a screw on the blade holder. The screw is not captured and needs to be completely removed in order to replace the blade. Small and easy to lose. (3) the liner lock on my tool gives a little double click before locking in place. Initially I thought the knife was locked upon hearing the first click but it wasn't. So make sure it's really locked in placed before using.

The package shown really should be changed because it is that of a cord that is rated 15AMP and 1875 watts and this cord is rated 13 amps and 1625 watts. That being said, I found that out in the reviews, thank goodness, before I ordered one. The 13 AMP 1625 watt cord which supports up to a 3/4 HP electric motor is more than enough cord for most, including me. This add says it is medium duty but it does not say that on the packaging of the cord I got. It just says it is for indoor or outdoor use. It is what I needed however and at a good price and I did not have to go get it.

I design dollhouses as a hobby. This saw is just what I needed to get into tight spaces.  My husband just used it to cut thin plastic PVC. There was no tearing.  A handy saw to have in your toolbox and at your craft table.  Would recommend

These are very pretty strung in and out of the bushes.  They're easy to bend and shape, so very little is needed to get them to stay in position.  The only reason I knock them a star is because the solar panel looks so small in the picture when in reality, it is pretty big, much larger than the ring of lights.The solar panel attaches to a post that you stab into the ground.Sample provided

This light is a decent light for the money.  I really like my Duracell flashlights that cost three for twenty dollars at Costco but these Fordex lights are good enough to put into an emergency kit.  If you put the Eveready lithium batteries (non-rechargable type) in them, then they should last ten years in storage.  If you store them for years without use, you might have to use a pencil eraser to clean the battery ends and the contacts in the flashlight upon getting them out of storage.  The pattern of the light is a bit weird--you can see the rectangular outline of the led chip with a narrow focus.  I bought four of these as stocking stuffers for Christmas--I'll put the long lasting batteries in them.
summary: Decent but not the best, good for some uses

reviewText: this seems fairly decent but not well executed - needs some sort of retainerit doesn't stay in place when you move the saw (have a handfull of small bungees handy)alignment isn't critical to it's use, but it would be nice if there were some way to adjust it!
summary: good idea but slightly sketchy execution
