The quality of the tape is very good. We never owned any tekton products before but wanted to give it a try as the price is low compared to the leading brands and we are glad we did. We ordered other tekton items as well and they are as good as the top brand products.

I keep the battery on the charger at all times so it never goes dead (and so it lasts for years).  Unlike my old Dewalt drill when fastening the drill bits down, you have to use two hands (one hand to hold the black part, and the other hand to twist the silver part) to tighten down drill bits; The problem is often times drill bits will not be tight enough and slip; and then I have to stop and re-tighten the drill bits; That can be annoying.  I never had that problem with my old Dewalt drill, but my old Dewalt drill was $240 [a lot more expensive].  Overall I am really happy with this drill; It's very powerful and professional.  I haven't used any attachments so I can't comment on that.
summary: Bits Sometimes Slip So I Have To Re-Tighten The Bit Down

reviewText: As I said for the 6 inch wrench, this is a very useful tool and it is made in the USA.

Received the stand very quickly after oredring.  Assembled easily.  Remember to install the storage location for the allen wrench!!  Put the axle bolts with the head out instead of in.  But the ease with which the stands sets up and takes down is very handy.  Makes using the table saw all the more handy.  I put my DeWalt table saw on it.  I can now put it up, cut what pieces I need, work all day with it, whatever and put it down for storage to be able to get the cars in the garage very quickly.  Very satisfied with the stand.

I am a general contractor and wear knee pads much of the time, during projects.  The cheap ones work satisfactorily, for a short while and then become a liability, rather than a protective tool.  The Dewalt kneepads fit well and are designed to stay in place, regardless of the task.  I would heartily recommend them to those of you who need good knee protection on those extended home improvement projects.

Love this pouch for working in the attic or similarly small areas.  Holds just about everything you will need.  Add a couple zippered bags to clip on for wire nuts, screws, cable clamps, etc, and it's perfect.
summary: Great for projects in small spaces

reviewText: This unit works in many modes, but for me the most useful is when taking a shower.  I can manually turn on the shower exhaust fan, then when the unit senses that the humidity is low enough, it turns off the fan automatically.  I thought the sensor worked well for sensing humidity and turning off accordingly.  Mine is mounted about 6 feet from the shower & works well in the auto on/off mode or manual on/auto off.The installation instructions are clear and concise.  Also, several adjustments can be made:-Humidity level for turning on/off the fan-Time (minimum time that the fan will remain on after turned on by any method)-Sensitivity (low, medium, high)-Air Cycle Mode which can have the fan turn on/off for a set period of time.  This is a nice feature for tight houses that don't have an air exchanger & need stale air ventilation.One thing I didn't think of before I got this controller, was this unit works great for controlling  shower/bathing humidity.  However sometimes, ummmm…bathroom air issues aren't always "humidity".  This unit has a timer function (ranging from 10 to 45 minutes), so keep that in mind for non-humid issues.
summary: Works great for bathroom humidity - but not all bathroom air issues are "humidity"

reviewText: This little gizmo is now in my car glove compartment, along with the Emergency Perfume, mascara, hairbrush and moisturizer.  I don't know if I will ever need it, but there is a feeling of security just knowing it's there. I don't camp and I don't go places that are dangerous, but you never know. And I have a lousy sense of direction. Once while heading for a shoe sale I ended up in some quarry where there were big red signs about dynamiting and a lot of angry men in hard hats came running at me.The Friendly Swede Carabiner has a 3 inch bundle wrapped in braided paracord. The whole package is small and virtually weightless, but there is a bunch of good stuff inside.  I know because I went an unraveled the darn thing.  You should trust the Friendly Swede. Once you unwrap that paracord, you can't rebraid it. I keep mine in a tiny leather pouch now...not much bigger, but not nearly as cool.What you get for your $15 is a lot. Starting that paracord ...nine feet of it and potentially very helpful if you remember what Bear Grylis taught us about building a shelter out of sticks and  leaves, bundling our belongings, or finding dry wood and making little floats that help us when crossing a stream or lake, that sort of thing. However It  doesn’t look terribly strong and I would not use drag myself up or down a mountain or anything like that. And given my fear of heights, if there are mountains in front of me, I’m staying put anyway.The ‘grenade’ also contains two separate fishing lines with hooks, sinkers and bobs for each.  Not fancy, but I don’t think a fish would care…although those of us who do go fishing know that those little rascals can make themselves scare when we really want them.  You get a nice hunk of tin foil, which can be used as a heat reflector, to wrap your leftover fish, turn into a solar still (Bear Grylis explained it all…not much water, but better than none...and if you didn’t watch him or Les Stroud or the rather sexy Mike Hawk and wife, you should rent the tapes or stay indoors.The kit also contains an alcohol swab for cleansing stuff like wounds and a needle for those who don’t have the foresight to have a sewing kit. The instructions say this can be used for suturing wounds, but if we are camping and you have foolishly torn yourself open and expect me to sew you back together, it's not gonna work.  I’d pretend I was looking for water and just leave you.  And there's a chance I would have sucked the alcohol out of the pad when I discovered we were lost.  On the other hand, I would not go all Donner Party on you either so look at the bright side.There is quite a bit of wire included as well…for making snares to trap small animals.  I don’t know if I could make a snare that would fool even that one rabbit that the other rabbits point at, but at least it’s there.  Most important is the fire starter. Yes, you can actually make sparks with it. They even provide some tinder. Les Stroud made it very clear that the stick rubbing thing ain't gonna happen, so this is crucial. Fire keeps away big animals, makes you easier to spot, and keeps you warm.  I never remember to include matches in my first aid kit, so this is a very good thing. You also get a tiny but very sharp knife...enough for cooking purposes, I suppose, and cleaning the fish, that sort of thing. And another thing my survival materials did not have.All in all, the kit seems well thought out. I'd give one to those outdoorsy types who like to camp, or to anyone who lives or travels through underdeveloped areas.  For me, the "grenade" is going to sit in my glove compartment, forgotten, along with the reminder about my 2014 car registration (It's a smog year...who can bother?).  But if I ever find myself down at the Silver Queen Quarry instead of the Glendale Mall again, I'll feel a little bit better.  Although I have not tried the product, it certainly looks practical and provides the essentials.  Good things in a small package, so five stars.
summary: Lipstick? Check. Perfume? Check. Survival Grenade? Double Check.

reviewText: Nice looking and sturdy satin nickel towel bar for my powder room.  I've just redone my bathrooms and needed new satin nickel bath hardware - towel rings, towel bars, light fixtures and a grab bar. The Moen items I chose are very nice looking and reasonably priced. Recommended.

These little lights are great for lighting a path down the hallway.  At night, they automatically turn on.The first thing I noticed is how bright they are -- not the type of night lights I'd want in a bedroom.  When I'm next to them, I see the light reflected off the floor.  From a distance, I feel like I can see the bulbs shining.  I do wish they'd angle down just a tad more.The night lights have been reliable.  I never have to worry about groping my way to a light switch.  I can see enough to get there.  They are good for anyone who needs small bright path lights.This product was provided for review by Orksun.
I use this belt to hold my holster and 5 lb hammer. It distributes the weight very well without discomfort.

I purchased this  belt bc of the 5 " padding to help my sore back, the thick padding feels great ... I have a 29" waist and this belt fits me perfectly ( with room to spare_)... smaller waists will also fit... Overall this belt is very comfortable and seems durable ( only had it one month so we will see)...
summary: 5" of padding makes my back feel better

reviewText: I originally ordered a 130 version but when I got it, it was dented on the bottom (not bad but since it was new i wanted it in good shape) so I returned it.  I upgraded to the 140 for the replacement which was more sturdy.  It took only 3 days to get the replacement -- that was FAST.  And the 140 version was much sturdier and I recommend it.

I have to say, this has come in very handy for inflating car tires. I have one that tends to leak, but nobody has been able to find anything wrong with it, so I wind up filling it up about once a month. It's so nice to be able to use my very own inflator at home, no coins required ;)We've also been using ours for inflating bicycle tires and some of our heavy-duty pool inflatables. Operation of this is not 100 percent intuitive and if you don't use it often, you may forget how to perform all of the operations, so maintaining possession of the instruction manual is critical. I would recommend storing them together.All-in-all, I'm very pleased with this inflator and although we aren't campers, I'm positive that campers would absolutely love having one of these.

The bolt cutters actually work better than they appear that they will work.  The handles do not seem to be heavy enough to apply the required pressure to cut a bolt or lock.  But so far they have withstood the test.  It may take a couple of tries to actually cut all the way through, since the bolt or lock must be properly positioned to make a clean cut.  Otherwise I am happy with this tool since it is something I use only infrequently.

Made from plastic; internal mechanism is interesting, but needs a metal housing.  Also, the temperature sensor doesn't seem to work well.  While running cold water, still switches from green to red and flashing red (indicating way too hot water)....  Some improvements need to be made here, from the single unit I ordered.

Nice looking and sturdy satin nickel towel rings for my powder room. I've just redone my bathrooms and needed new satin nickel bath hardware - towel rings, towel bars, light fixtures and a grab bar. The Moen items I chose are very nice looking and reasonably priced. Recommended
summary: Moen Inspiration Bath Hardware - good looking and a good value

reviewText: Perfect for those jobs where only a few tools and a tape are needed.  Seems to be well made.  I've been using it for a few months and it's holding up well.

After reading helpful reviews from amazon, I finally decided to purchase this jointer from Sears' Craftsman model.  I noticed immdiately that the weight was reduced to 85 pounds.  I consider this to be an improvement because its previous weight of 104 pounds is a burden if you intend to move it around your small shop.  85 pounds I think is the appropriate weight for  this tool and it still feels rock steady.  Also, I was happy to see that this model is now has a smooth finish which added good looks on it.  I was blessed enough to get it on sale for $199 plus tax (regular price is $249.99).  To add to that, Sears accepted as a payment an unused tool worth $100 that I returned to them I already written off as wasted.  Assembly was a snap.  The fence perfectly sits 90 degrees from the table.  The motor feels it has enough power to handle any hardwood available but it is really noisy.  You will need earmuff to protect your ears to add weight on the goggles you are already wearing.  It is even noisier when you run a wood on it.  One drawback of this tool is that it has short infeed/outfeed table.  You will need a roller stand with the same height as the outfeed table to recieve long boards you intend to plane.Overall assessment, this tool will perform its purpose and is perfect for woodworkers with small space.  Knowing how to use this tool properly will duplicate the work of bigger jointers.  You will just need practice and a little bit of patience to accomplish the job.  I am happy with this purchase.

What can I say....they're nails and either do the job or malfunction.  I bought from Amazon because the quantity offered was less than the thousands of nails required for purchase at local stores.  As a homeowner, rather than professional carpenter, I don't need huge quantities.
summary: Performs as expected at a lower price than your local hardware store.

reviewerName: J. Nowicki "The Boss and  Mrs. B."
reviewText: The Palmgren 92101 HipShot 12-Volt Ni-Cad Tankless Cordless Shoulder Strap Compressor is 'absolutely awesome' according to our son-in-law. He is the jack of all trades in his family and ours so he needed something portable to use with his air tools. It was on sale for under fifty dollars so I bought one for myself to use at our cabin and one as a Christmas gift for him. He has just now had an opportunity to use it and was very pleased with it. I used myDremel 290-01 1.15 Amp 7,200 Stroke Per Minute Engraver includes Letter and Number Templateto brand both our sets. According to him it is ideal for his needs. I haven't used mine yet but, when I do, I will update my review. ~ The Boss

Utilitarian and practical, the Ottlite is just what's needed when you want a bright light in your workspace.  The gray color and clunky shape make it a sort of Cinderella of lamps, but once you turn it on and you get that clear white illumination, you won't care about looks.I use it at my desk. My eyesight isn't perfect. I'm a little nearsighted, need reading glasses for fine print occasionally, and suffer from permanent eyestrain.  In the morning, I can read almost anything but after a few hours of staring at the computer screen, out come the reading glasses. By five p.m., I'm peering through the magnifying glass if the print is small.  Turns out, proper illumination makes a big diffeerence.  I just read the ingredients on a bottle of sunscreen using just my reading glasses, and this print is tiny.  My job requires this kind of close up reading and the OttLite just made life a little easier.  The flexible neck means you can position it perfectly above your workspace so there are no shadows.  And even though it's not very pretty, it sort of disappers into the background when not in use, just like a good Cinderella should.This is a good choice for anyone who sews or does crafts, and it would make a great addition to a workshop. Wherever you need a flood of clear white light, wherever you need to pay attention to the fine print and the details, you need the Ottlight. Five big bright stars.
Don't know why I expected these to fit in the miter track on my saw.  If that's what you want, these are it.  They will fit in the tracks on your saw's fence, but way too small for the miter track.
This product works great for the purpose I had intended it to. Both the 4" hose and the 2 1/2" hoses fit on it perfectly.
You can never have too many knobs once you have moved to a T-track system! These knobs are very well priced and are of good quality.
summary: You can never have too many knobs once you have moved to a T-track system!

reviewText: I had hoped it would be "heavier" but it wasn't.On the good side it is a nice size and worked wellin the existing basement bathroom.I have seen other such racks at local stores forapproximately the same price.
A little plastic adapter that does what it should.  Buy it if you need it.  Be aware the measurements are the outside diameter of the adapter, so you can't slip a 2-1/2 or 4" OD fitting onto it.

This is a high quality set of guides for the money. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars is I have no idea what the adapter plate fits. It does not fit any of my routers which include a Dewalt DW625 (This router came with its own plate that fits these guides), A Porter cable 690LR (The guides fit the standard base plate that came with the router), and a Triton TRA001 which has no adapter unless you buy the Triton one. I will make my own baseplate that will fit these guides for the Triton.Before I purchased, I could never find a list of supported routers, not even on their website. The box had a list of these and I will include them in this review for others benefit.B&D; - All ModelsDeWalt - DW610, DW614, DW615, DW624, DW625Elu - 2720, 2721, 3328Freud - FT2000E, FT2000Hitachi - TR8, TR12, M12SA, M12VPorter Cable - All ModelsSkil - 1870, 1875These will also work with any base that supports 1-3/16" dia. center hole.
I chose for his magnificent Presentation good price and the material that is made, and adjusted to my router craftsman

This unit charges faster and does two at a time for seamless weedeating.  I think it charges better too.  My batteries last longer than they did with the charger that came with my  B & D trimmer.  With this setup I can trim until I'm tired of trimming instead of the battery telling me it's time to quit.

I've had a pair of these since the early 90s and I replaced them for the heck of it. The heads are replaceable, but even after using it for years of tough jobs, they last forever. I recommend these based on years of experience, using them almost daily when bigger, heavier mallets just get in the way (I don't need a 2" Deadblow mallet just to secure a paint can, for example.) I bought the 40mm version. You won't be disappointed.
summary: Tougher than it looks, and lasts forever

reviewText: Nice hammer the brass is welcome for firearms work and price is right. Would recommend this to others and the 1lb weight is just right for completing small jobs
I have a cabinet shop and have used most brands of power tools.  Bosch consistently is in a class by itself.  Everything about this drill is perfect!
summary: Bosch still maintains it's quality and inovation edge

reviewText: In spite of the amount of so-so reviews, I purchased this table. It was delivered in top condition by Fedex. There were no instructions other than a giant pix of the fence assy. Using the picture it was fairly easy to assemble it if your careful to sort out the screws. Took me about 30 minutes to assemble it. It is rock solid and the fence assembly is smooth and accurate. Using the footnote to zero it wasnt necessary as it was dead on out of the box. The aluminum insert plate as others have indicated is not predrilled for the Freud routers, or any others. I had purchased the FT1702VCEKP router kit that  came with a pre-drilled aluminum table insert, so I didnt need to use the one from the table box. One annoying thing is the table had no (3) screws to fasten the fixed base to the insert I mean, come on Freud, charge an extra 10 cents and include the damn screws. Luckily the router kit I purchased contained the 3 screws I needed, otherwise I would have had to hump all over town trying to find 3 damn screws. Freud needs to get real with their constant shortcomings and trying to save "pennies". This  causes inconvenience and aggravation for the  customer. The table is rock solid with a great fence. Regardless of the Freud Ads "YOU CANT FOLD THE TABLE UNLESS YOU REMOVE THE ROUTER BASE". Impossible !!

I installed it, changed the battery, and tested in regularly. But in a year it started giving "battery low" signal beeps, and no amount of changing battery would help. Apparently the unit has a set life of one year and won't last beyond that. Quite a pity.Go a replacement from Walmart at lower price, and that has already last twice as long.
A rock solid 18" bar, with excellent finish, and nice chisel tips.  I've had a chance to put mine through its paces, and everything has held up nicely.

It's not a great tactical holder, but for the price you can't beat it and it is durable enough.  It can be a little tough to get the light out of the holder, so I wouldn't depend on it for any tactical or competition situations.After using this for a while. I am downgrading it.  The Velcro is starting to tear away from the belt keeper and the design allows the light to slide sideways in the holder, nearly causing it to drop out of the carrier.  if the elastic when further down the holder, this wouldn't be an issue.  I am going to have to find a better carrier for my light.

This is a great concept. We use this daily. Tonight it came down and one corner has left a nice bruise on my middle left toe.What I think happen is..., sInce the part that connects to the waterline is plastic and the connecting piece to the body of the head is metal, it worked its way loose over time, with the heat around the ball that holds the pressure to hold the head at an angle. I reconnected everything and the lights still work well. I hope this helps.Just check it every so often.
summary: I was using this product and.......

reviewText: I am not a big fan of Black & Decker tools. My view is that they design and market for occasional home do it yourselfers not serious tool lovers. Their prices are attractive though. I do own several Black and Decker tools I can't be without. One is a stick battery Dremel like tool I have owned for donkeys years as the Scots say. Another is a stick battery operated Scrub Buster. Thank goodness I can still find these stick batteries.Being a senior woman with diminishing physical abilities I needed a garden and shop saw with more strength than my hands can muster. One son cautioned me against buying a chain saw for the garden. Probably wise on his part. As is my norm I searched Amazon for a solution. The Navigator Saw came up with many fabulous reviews so I ordered one. It works a treat! I have used my saw in the garden with success and in the house to remove two room dividers. It perfectly but not wildly allows me to keep handy using these older limbs. I was afraid it would be too aggressive for me or hard to handle. Not so at all. It is a good weight and simply does the job without kickback, jerks or negative issuesThanks Black and Decker!!
summary: Yahoo!  This is a great tool.

reviewText: I bought it to illuminate a 1000 gallons aquarium and it suddenly stopped working after 3 weeks.  And bought it 4 months ago....  It was perfect while it lasted.

Been using my Dust collector for aver a half year now. Direct conection to my tablesaw and wow it can pull the air. Second opening is great for clean up. Now of course with clean up watch for larger objects, even if you are several inches away you may suck them up. I did this and it got lodged in the blower fan. The overload switch popped and the machine shut down. Removed the piece and pressed reset not a problem.. Very well made, very well thaught.

She's very cute!  Her wings are easy to put on, and the little crackle glow ball works great.  It changes colors slowly and adds a bit of magick to my garden.  She runs every night for several hours- about 5 hours after dark.  I have the solar plate in a very sunny location.  I put her on a flat rock so she sticks up just a little big more.  I'm very pleased with her.
I purchased this to make a kitchen island, we had been looking for a while before finding this piece of maple, it was the right size and thickness, it has a food safe finish that met our needs

This is a solid and sturdy flashlight.  I don't have much experience with LED lights but when comparing this to a conventional flashlight the LED can not focus the light as good.  The LED spreads a white light over a broader area but you can not focus the LED light to get really bright in a certain area. Other than that it is a great flashlight.  The red LED's are great for night time also, probably too bright for any astronomy work but good for general use.

I bought this for a chalkboard on a door. I wanted it magnetic but read horrible reviews on how the magnetic primer did not work so i put this on a piece of sheet metal that I then attached to the door. I did a coat of primer on the metal then sanded. I then followed up with 3 coats of chalk board paint and it worked flawlessly. I do suggest conditioning the chalkboard after it has dried for 3 days by rubbing chalk all over the board and the wiping it away with a damp cloth. It makes the board work even better. I highly recommend this product!

This appears to be the exact same tool as the PS32 except for the (lack of) chuck.  That makes this tool a little shorter and similarly useful.  As a stand-alone tool, I prefer the PS32 because I generally don't like drilling with quick change drill bits, as they are more expensive and less common.  That makes this tool most useful for driving, but if you're looking for a tool just for driving, then I recommend the PS40/41/(42 to be released?) impact driver, which brings more power to the table (the only downside to the impact driver is that you should not drill with it).My M.O. is to double-fist it with the drill/impact diver; the two of them can handle almost anything except heavy masonry work, in which case I break out the corded Bosch hammer drill.That makes this tool's perfect niche as the extra driver hidden away on each floor close at reach for small tasks that come up.  It can handle large tasks just like the PS32, but if the task is large, you may have to run to the tool storage area for some other tools anyway.The new 2 amp-hour batteries bring >50% more life to the tool between charging (he 1.3amp-hour batteries always seemed adequate; in the above scenario, I'd use my PS20 on occasion, and charge just once a year or so) while only being 1-2mm longer.  The LED light now stays on for a few seconds after drilling, the battery gauge is new compared to the PS20, and the included, optional belt clip and bit holders are much appreciated new features.This tool has improved in every way over the PS20, and I love it.  I'd recommend it to anyone with the caveat that in many cases you may prefer other drilling/driving tools in the Bosch 12v product line.
summary: Improving on the Best - Consider Others in the Lineup

reviewText: My plant seems to like it.  I use this at work and it is funny.  People always tease me that I'm growing pot in my cube.  It is barely enough for my one small plant though in terms of light output.  I have to put it very close to the plant but that is ok but this thing doesn't get very hot at all.

The fit and finish is of high quality and now using the holster on a job saves a lot of time. It is just one of those essential items that makes life easier. This holster would have been perfect if it had a clip for the waist band instead of requiring one to wear a belt to use it.
summary: Great combo using it with the Bosch 12v drill

reviewText: We do most of our own home projects and repairs so it's important to have tools that work for both my husband and for me. The Bosch 18V 1/2-inch Drill/Driver is powerful, yet lightweight and compact. It is comfortable to hold and easy to handle. The battery on the bottom balances the weight of the drill so it does not feel top heavy.Our current project is repairing and adding on to our backyard deck. When we originally built the deck we had to use an electric drill because our old NiMH battery drill didn't have enough power. The new Bosch drill had no trouble - it packs a lot of power in low gear for driving the screws into the deck.The drill comes with two Li-Ion batteries and a quick charger. I'm thrilled with the LI batteries. They recharge in only a few hours and they hold their charge when the drill is not in use (unlike our old drill that used NiMH batteries which would often be dead in the case just when I needed to use it). There is a battery level indicator on the battery so you know when it is running low.While we are mainly using this drill for household projects, it has the features and versatility a professional would want: Brushless motor, advanced electronics, dura shield housing designed to withstand 10 ft. drops, LED light to illuminate the work space, belt clip and bit holder, and the drill comes with L-BOXX-2 carrying case with a tool insert tray. The L-BOXX cases stack together and are good for travel to a job site.Overall a versatile, compact drill.
summary: Versatile drill that will please both the professional and the home user

reviewText: Did the trick with both my impact wrench my breaker bar on two water heater anode rod replacement jobs yesterday.

While crossing a dark sidewalk in Tucson a few nights ago, we had our first rattlesnake encounter.  Snake rattled before we could step on it so both parties got away with just a scare.  Decided that we needed small flashlights that we could carry when we go out nights.  These are perfect.  Very lightweight and there is a small wrist strap attached so you can carry bags and still have some light. These throw out a lot of light!  Better than some of our larger flashlights.  I am going to get a small velcro strap so the light can be fixed on lower arm.  Good for cars seeing us walking at night and leaves hands mostly free (maybe Dorcy can make a flashlight-wrist band combination some day).

I bought this for a Salvadorean co-worker who has yet to know the wonders of Amazon.com. It holds his Milwaukee 12V impact driver just fine, it hangs well on his belt, and it's nice and compact. The latch is a little useless but if you need it, I'm sure it's great.Almost gave the product 4 stars because my co-worker now walks around like a Mexican bandito.

The Vera2 is a great solution for the moderately savvy user to automate their home. There's no subscription or other ongoing fees, and it doesn't require a PC. As other reviews have said, the documentation is a bit light, but with Google's help there's enough out there to get you up and running. The fact that you can get emails and text messages sent to you when events happen (motion detected, water detected, etc.) for free without a subscription is a HUGE plus in my opinion. I use a Blackberry to access it remotely. While it's not the ideal user interface, it gets the job done. I can adjust the lights, thermostat, or arm/disarm a motion sensor from my phone. I also use a WiFi connected iPad to control things while at home. Z-wave is a great way to automate your home and Vera2 is the ideal solution for those who don't want to pay a monthly fee. I've contacted their support a couple times and they've been great at getting back to me with the answer. I highly recommend Vera2 for anyone with some patience and a bit of tech know-how.

Installed it about 2 months ago, winter here so not great daylight, but it works well all night. I don't understand the bad reviews about not much light, its a solar LED light. plenty enough light to find the right key and open a door without tripping over the garden hose you forgot to put up. Lights up about a 10 - 12 foot area. I wouldn't try to read a newspaper with it, though you could prob read the first page before your eyes start to hurt. It does stay on in dim mode from dusk till dawn, enough to see if somebody or something is wandering around near it. Mine is mounted about 7' high above a shed door, it gos bright when I get within about 4'.

Purchased for a family member who works at a hospital - it's a good gift - several people at her work have commented on it.Good buy, not too bright, uses AAA batteries, and a nice solid stainless feel.Edit 9/10/2012I have discovered a problem with this device. Do not replace the batteries from the light. What can happen is the LED's pin can be twisted when screwing on the light, this then shorts both LED pins to the case - eg: 0V potential across the LED - no light. Instead replace the batteries from the end - the clip side. This should prevent these problems from occurring again.Still a great light.

Like some of the other reviewers have mentioned, if you are expecting these to be the same quality as Snap-On, Blackhawk, Stahlwille, etc. then these will not meet those expectations.  However, these are fantastic for low torque applications - I would say anything up to 30nm, or about 24 ft-lbs, would be fine.  More torque force than that, and I am going to move to 1/2 or 3/4 inch drives (I wouldn't subject my Stahlwille 3/8 drives to high torque applications, either).  I have found these extensions to be awesome for those hard to reach places where I need to reach, but can't get in there with a hand.  I use mine often and have no issues with quality.
summary: Tekton Extra Long Extension Bar Set

reviewText: I have built several cabinets using pocket hole screw technology. If you haven't tried pocket hole technology yet, make the switch, it works really well, but you need the special clamps. If you do a fair amount of woodworking it's well worth the investment.Note: when joining two pieces of wood with pocket hole screws, it pulls them in really tight, so you need to make sure the ends are SQUARE, else the screws will pull the joint crooked. You may want to investigate the technology before purchasing screws. There are several different screw types depending on the types of wood being joined. Soft, hard, or ply woods. I love the technology, since I have purchased the full kit and several added clamps.

Five stars from me - I bought this to help setup my table saw - works great doing that. But now that I have had it for a while I'm finding many more uses for this little gadget - and so will you. Some guys complain that the battery doesn't last long - I just remove the battery after use before I put it in a drawer - I do the same with the calipers, so no big deal.Price is right for the many uses you'll discover for this angle gauge.

MJSI HYR270 Shaky installation and no savings.I bought 3 of these MJSI HYR270.  It took some pushing down adjusting and replacing cable ties but got them to stay somewhat secure. The little cable tie against the overflow tube is a poor design.I Did a test for 6 months and there were no savings.  First the low flush: I found that the low flush is adjustable and seems to save water. The problem is that the water you think you save in the flushing is being wasted in the fill of the toilet bowl. There is no adjustment as to how much water goes into the bowl which causes excess water to continue to flow until the tank is full.Second The full flush: Here there is very little adjustment and waists more water than the regular flapper since I can not adjust more than the little bit that the unit allows.  This one is big time waster because it uses the entire water in the tank to flush. My old flapper was better!Controls:  The push button works. Definitely not like pushing a button on a radio. You have to push with some force. Especially the low flush since the button is smaller than the full flush.  My kids used it and had no problems, but had to tell them to use their thumb to push the button in.  I don't like how the buttons operate because using it like this puts unnecessary pressure in the bolts holding the tank to the toilet.Reliability: I bought 3 units. One unit in the master bathroom would leak and needed constant monitoring and adjusting.  A second unit was in the half bath and was the most used. It seemed like it worked. A third unit was in the kids bathroom and seemed to work, but I heard it leaking a few times also, but eventually got it to work.Update:Removed all 3 units. I could not trust them. Too much tinkering to get it to work. Water can destroy your walls if your toilet overflows.  I purchased one of the Fluidmaster S2DBL units (expensive in comparison). This one was more work to install. The tank needs to come out and replace the center overflow tube assembly.  I didn't replace the fill valve since mine was fine. I had to cut 1" from the new overflow tube to get the correct height as in the instructions tell you.  Adjustments were great since I could adjust everything. Low flush, full flush and how much water in the tank and the the bowl too. The best part is that my house guests notice no difference with using the toilet. Down is a normal flush.I bought a second unit after 2 months and will buy a 3rd later also.  You get what you pay for and it is very true here as well.
summary: No water savings at all on 3 toilets

reviewText: I researched  TON of smart home systems out there and tried a few before I found this one. They are the BEST out there if you want to have FULL CONTROL of your home without having to pay monthly service fees to someone like Alarm.comI have lights, locks, cameras, thermostats, water heaters, blinds/shades, pool cover, splash pad, alarm, garage doors, sprinkler system and everything going through this system. I can access it on the internet, my phone, locally on computers, and it works with EVERYTHING Zwave. I have things on schedules to automatically turn on my water heater in the morning and turn it down at night. It controls my thermostat on a schedule. It controls my sprinklers on schedule with conditions depending on the weather. It is simply the best out there hands down and I've never had any issue with it. Had it in one home for over a year without any problems. Just put it in a second home a few months ago and my cabin last week. Can control ALL of them on my Android phone and my wife can do the same with her iPhone. Great product. Great support. Love it.
summary: Best smart home system out there!

reviewText: I am a member of a wood shop in the community.  They had dowel fixtures but my needs were not compatible.  I bought the Wolfcraft fixture because it was unconventional and $20+ cheaper than the others.  It has a lot of parts than need some getting used to and some issues that need experience to work with.  I needed a way to drill holes aligned to marks on the wood (like a bisket cutter) so I had to mark hole centers on the fixture.  Now, I have to use the fixture on thicker wood than it was made for and drill holes based on centering on a transfer punch from a dowel centering pin.  This fixture is versatile enough to accomplish this by using it backwards. A little imagination makes this a versatile tool.

In the past I joined boards via dowels using simple methods that I dreamed up basically on my own.While most of these worked out OK I found that they would usually take substantial time.  So recently I became curious about what might be available in the way of commercial doweling jigs.  In researching what was available I came across a series of Wolfcraft instructional videos (they are easily found on the net). The result was that I bought two doweling jigs ... the "Dowel Pro" and the "Dowel Quick".  The Dowel Pro is a jig that the work is brought to ... while the Dowel Quick is a jig that one takes to the work (similar to the comparison of a circular hand saw and a table saw).  Both jigs are well priced ... and they both work.The Dowel Quick jig not only aligns holes in end boards it also centers the dowel holes in end boards.  The Dowel Pro does not center holes in end boards ... instead it only aligns holes in end boards (normally the holes will be off center).I think the Dowel Pro could be improved by providing two identical components.  The only down side to that would be that it would likely cost a bit more.Wolfcraft evidently also sells what they call the Dowelmaster ... which is basically just an improved model of the Dowel Quick.  I think it costs a bit more but it allows a much more convenient handling of the fence.  Assuming the cost wasn't too much more I would have bought the Dowelmaster but I couldn't find it for sale in anything but metric units.In any case I'm perfectly happy to have the Dowel Pro.
summary: A short review of the Wolfcraft 3751405 Dowel Pro Doweling Jig

reviewText: Found this product to be worth the money.  Does what it is supposed to do with no problem at all.

reviewText: I use this daily to keep my makeup brushes sanitary.  I have very sensitive skin and break out if my brushes are not kept very clean.  This works really, really well along with a microfiber cloth for dabbing.Also, since it's for electronics, I was able to clean and revitalize an iphone 4 home button that was no longer responsive-bonus!

I bought this for cleaning my phone while replacing the broken glass, and I have found many other uses. Cleaning? no problem Cut yourself? no problem Sticky stuff on something? no problem. Seriously, it is a great solvent to have lying around
The problem I have is the location of the power switch, very easy to accidently turn it off. Also, case is of poor quality zipper handles broke in a short time.
I keep this between my Kitchen and Backyard. I hope it works. I paid $20 for this and I have seen the same model at Lowes & Home Depot for the same price.

Can't say enough good about this well designed system.  I got it with the table and built my own cabinet into it.  The top is slick (literally, the stock slides right over it w/o resistance).  The fence works very well and the fence slide has a great mm/SAE ruler that is adjustable so you can set the fence with a variety of bit diameters.  The table steel is plenty stable, not that cheap angle stuff you get at the hardware store.  Not cheap, but I got it to keep my fingers.  Don't get it without the feather board (get two for the horizontal table top and two for the fence.  Oddly, the dust collector seems to work quite well.  If you can't let it sit in one place then get the wheels, it's pretty heavy and ungainly (one of the reasons it's so stable, I suppose).
summary: This thing is the dog's bark

good quality charger at an affordable price,

The extent to which this V-belt improved my table saw's performance is significant, and much higher than expected.  When people say that the vibration is reduced with this belt - they mean it is eliminated!  At least in my case with a Jet 10" contractor's table saw.  The blade seems to get up to speed much faster, has ZERO vibration while running, cuts smoother, is MUCH quieter, and shuts down much faster than it ever did with the OEM belt.  This is by far the 2nd best upgrade I have made to my table saw, next to the blade - A Forrest Woodworker II.

Fastest shipping, great packaging, super bright, white, light. Blindingly bright.No complaints at all. This is a total steal. I resell these, and just placed an order that I will resell for $50.00/ea to a very happy customer. Buy. 100% buy from this seller.

I used to think that only professionals would benefit from high quality tools. I'm glad I was wrong. I purchased this set because I was tired of the cheap Made in China ones. They work great the first few times, but the metal used to construct the cheap sets is not adequate and the tips would either strip or bend.. I can get a set of percision screwdrivers for $3.00, but they're not worth the headache to me.This set is solidly constructed. The case that it comes with seems a bit cheap, but it's still better than any other case for precision screwdrivers out there.

This ratchet works really well for confined spaces. I've had it for a year or so now and have used it occasionally. I really like that it has a smooth high tooth count action and that if can get into tight spots and ratchet really well. It's also cool that you can put bits on the other end of it.

Unless you need super perfect readings for legal reasons, there's no longer any need to shell out a c-note for a good digital sound meter. This thing is darn near as accurate as any top of the line meter, and at 20 bucks it's a steal.Sound meters aren't that complicated: a simple little mic picks up the sound pressure and then shows it on the display. Analog is inexact because the peaks are so transient, thus digital is a superb upgrade. You can measure exact peaks, save them, and find ranges and other fun stuff with this meter, which is the size of a thin, flat 12 oz plastic bottle or so. It's very light, the battery easy to install, and the only cheap thing is that the plastic screen is laid in and warps a tiny bit. But for most uses, so what? Sound meters are used for brief studies, and rarely for all day or even hour at a time uses.I was offered this as a sample, and expected it to be half-assed, but it's actually a very solid unit that works well and is built quite sturdily. For 20 clams it's a truly fine deal.PS To any musicians out there: if you ever get noise complaints, simply get one of these and a video camera and film yourself or a friend using it in the room and then outside; the police will appreciate not having to come out all the time. Most communities have an 80 db limit at your property limit: you'll be surprised how high that really is, and that maybe your complaining neighbors just wish they'd learned how to play too! And for any guitarist who gets assailed by band members for playing too loud: most bangin' rock drummers will be peaking out above 110, even near 120, measured right in front of the kit, whereas I've dimed Deluxes and Plexi half-stacks and not hit quite that level. Then again, drums are transient...but that and bass are what travel most. It's nice to have a meter to prove you have the God-given RIGHT to crank out those Jimi and Floyd and Zeppelin riffs at the proper volume!And on that note (B sharp, see?), please wear earplugs, folks. The best use of a sound meter is to know when you need them, and I highly recommend using ear protection for anything over 85 or so. My hearing is still excellent and I've been in front of cranked amps for over 30 years, so it's not the volume, but the protection you use. That's what he said...Protect your ears at all costs! Tinnitus is no fun, and your hearing (and music) is a gift beyond measure. Please respect and cherish it.
summary: Accurate and a great deal at 20 bucks

reviewText: Bought one at an auto parts store, and found it so useful that I ordered three more (identical except for color) from Amazon, Now I can afford to leave them in multiple locations so one's always handy.
summary: If one's good, how much better are three?

reviewText: great little remote, i use it for the scooter and bikes so i'm not carrying keys and stuff. Easy to program.

The DB Power sound level meter is an unassuming device.  The design gives the impression of a cheap product that might be found in Harbor Freight.  However, it is surprisingly simple to use and does the job well.  There aren't many controls, but what is there will probably cover your needs.  It measures from 40 to 130 dB and is flexible enough (A and C weighting, fast and slow response) for standard OSHA testing.  The only unintuitive feature is recording, which can keep track of the maximum and minimum values.If you are going to use this in a more rigorous setting, calibration with a standard calibrator is possible and a tripod mount is there if needed.Overall, this is a great bargain.  It is not as durable as the much more expensive device that I am used to, but it is great for situations where the sound meter might get broken or will only be used periodically.Thank you to the seller for sending a review unit.
Nice tool. Been able to confirm the accuracy of the angle of the my Table saw blade . good tool not encounter any problem with it.
Did what I needed when changing a radiator for a pretty decent price.  Not much more I would ask.  Amazon likes more words.

reviewText: I have really enjoyed these little step lights, they do need a full day of charging to last the night but they do a great job of staying on until early in the morn on partial charge. They look very nice and mount easily and simple to work. A++

Great item. Love using it. Inexpensive novelty lighting. Actually very convenient little remote. Sure it is line of sight and has to be pointed right at the lamp to work .. and yes you have to be pretty close to the lamp for the remote to work. Big deal. Check the price folks. LED colors and patterns are fun to watch and nice at setting a mood. Add ambience to the room. Not intended to be the major lighting source for any room. It is a novelty light and should not be expected to be anything else. We love it!

reviewText: I must have looked at a dozen saws but this one kept coming to the top of the list.  While I think it could have come a bit more assembled, I have no complaints about the quality and the function.  It is nice and quiet and cuts great.

Yes I am 100% certain this was the cause of my sore throat. At first I was so happy that I no longer needed to buy bottle water. After 3-4 days of use, I had a really sore throat. It was only when I was at work and drinking the water there that my sore throat went away. I thought it was something that just came at night but then I realized I had it on the weekends too. After thinking about when I didn't have it, I thought maybe it was the water filter. Then I started using the filter from my refrigerator, and I didn't have any issues. About 3-4 days later I drank a bunch of this water that was in my water boiler. I forgot I used the filtered water in the water boiler (it's one of those that holds water and keeps it at 98 degrees Celsius) and after drinking couple cups of tea with this water, my sore throat was back. I stopped drinking this water and that same night i felt much better. I had a lot of mucus in my throat when I had this sore throat and it was very irritating. I'm assuming that it didn't filter something in my water that caused my sore throat but I'll never know for sure. I returned it to amazon for a full refund.
summary: Tasted fine but gave me an extremely sore throat.

reviewText: I'm still trying to figure out how these are any better than my lineman's pliers.  Yes, the end is thinner, and this helped me clear what could have become a birds nest of wire as I was loading up a new spool.  But the cutting edge doesn't seem as sharp, and I'm kind of wondering if the needle nose pliers I already have wouldn't be just as good.  Orange handles are nice, except all of my tools seem to be starting to turn orange and it's losing it's effect.  Not a bad item to fill out an order, but if you're a handyman with other tools nearby I'm not sure I'd bother with them.

I like the base. I have a hitachi m12v mounted to it. No flex whatsoever in the plate. It is very rigid and does not bow. The included hardware is good, but I did not care much for the nylon raisers. I bought #10 24-thread , machine screws to replace these. Just a preference, not mandatory. Comes with a start pin for table routing smaller piece with no fence.The snap in rings are strong and rigid. They snap in real tight. I found that if you use your router bit wrench you can pop them out real easy without maring them by just sliding the blunt rounded tip of the end of the wrench in and using the opposite side of the ring to snap it out. Works really smooth.You can not fab one for cheaper using the same materials...its ano brainer to get it-Jason
magic little devise it works as it should, just make sure you epoxy the magnets to its base cause mine were being left stuck to my sawblades!

We just recovered from a broken waterline and if I had give more thought to using something like this earlier we would have saved a lot of money and the inconvenience of what we were put through.These work wonderful,  are very sensitive to the very smallest drop of water and will sound out a loud sound similar to a smoke detector with a slight variance.  They say the battery will last 2 years, but I plan on installing new ones every year.For us they are great and my only regret is that I did not have them before the water line break.
