reviewText: Works fantastic. Small size and no batteries.  The magnets are very strong which helps find the dry wall nails easily.

I purchased the RH328VC to drill holes in concrete walls, my garage/workshop walls are 8ft high concrete. This looks like it will do the job and be useful for drilling large holes in lumber as well. It's a quality tool, and comes with a decent case which I think is essential, and I don't believe in paying $50+ extra for one. It is heavy (8.25lbs) so I can't see myself using it on a ceiling.I also purchased a HA3JAW keyless chuck to use with large regular shank drill bits at thirty five, this adds another 0.75lbs. When latched into the SDS chuck it has about 1/2" of forward back movement. Apparently this IS normal for an SDS shank chuck or drill bit-"The drill bit is not held solidly in the chuck, but can slide back and forth like a piston. The hammer of the drill acts to accelerate only the drill bit itself, and not the large mass of the chuck, which makes hammer drilling with an SDS shank drill bit much more productive than with other types of shank". This probably means that the optional HA3JAW keyless chuck should only be used in drill mode, even if you have round shank masonry drill bits.The RH328VC case has storage for small parts, drills, etc and also a generous area for coiling up the power cable. The case appears to be an improved design -the one that came with my Bosch 3/8" drill is worn out -the "living" hinges and the latches are all broken on that (the drill still works fine though). This case has seperate hinges and latches. I'm not that familiar with SDS but originally it was named by Bosch 'The SDS bit was developed by Bosch in 1975 and the name comes from the German "Steck - Dreh - Sitz" (Insert - Twist - Stay)'.Both the RH328VC and the HA3JAW, are Made in Germany.
Does the job,I don't have to lean out of the bed anymore...The plug does require clearence for the plug from the lamp, something to remember.

Drilling into old (extremely hard) concrete for Tapcon anchors)My DeWalt simply was not doing the job, this thing  along with SDS Bosch bits drilled into concrete like butter.If you are drilling holes in old (very hard) concrete then consider this as a tool to do the job.
summary: Drills into concrete like butter (with the right bit)

reviewText: Personally, I do like this speaker. Using it has some pros and some cons. What I do like about this speaker is: The color changing aspect, while not necessary, is cool. You can't see the changing in the daytime, but at night it's pretty cool. This Vibe LED Bluetooth speaker pairs up quick and easy with my Galaxy so I can listen to Sirius Radio-it's super simple to use and charge-tho the plugs are not the tightest and can fall out.I like to listen to Old Time Radio on Sirius radio so the sound for this purpose is perfect. I have a couple of small portable speakers that are Bluetooth and sound much better and clearer than this speaker so if you like a quality speaker for tunes, this isn't the greatest. For portability, I personally would bring along a speaker that would fit easily into a backpack or purse - this speaker is fairly large and great for a bedside table-I wouldn't trust to lug this around with the canvas speaker and plastic lighted top-tho it does seem to be pretty sturdy. You could put it out if you have a pool or take it anywhere but it's sizeable though.For my night table and Sirius radio, this works great and I do like it. In comparison to some smaller speakers I own, the sound doesn't equal and is less in quality than my other little Bluetooth speakers.I'd say for a kid's room, this would be great but wouldn't hold up to a lot of shenanigans and would be best stationery on a bedside table or desk where you can enjoy the color changing light. The sound is decent but there are others out there if you are really looking for killer sound from a portable speaker. This hooks to Bluetooth with ease and works well paired with my Galaxy phone and it has a pretty long lasting battery.** I am not sure why, but this speaker has stopped working as it was in the beginning. It's not holding charge and no longer pairing well with my phone. In order to use it anymore, I have to fiddle with it and coax it to work. I am not sure what happened to it. I didn't drop it and don't heavily use it.

I'm really enjoying this speaker. It is a fantastic gift to yourself or for anyone. The speaker has a truly easy setup: Put batteries in and charge, sync to your bluetooth on your phone, select song, begin playing. Love it! It's not as small as I thought it would be but it's light weight and makes a lovely/modern desk or table ornament. Also, the light/color changing effect is very pretty and calming. (especially recommended as a night light for children and you can play soothing music for them). The sound is glorious and I truly enjoy showing it off to friends then hogging up get-togethers with MY music. Highly recommended.
summary: 5+++++ Stars!!!! Easy to use and fantastic sounds and lightshow.

reviewText: This is a nice cover for the new rectangular light switches and receptacles. It is very reasonably priced and works with all standard sized units.
Our child likes this seat a lot more than other potty seats. It makes her feel that she is more of a big girl using the big girl potty. You also don't have to have that messy clean-up.
summary: Gets the job done without being messy

reviewText: Without a doubt the best safety glasses I ever bought.  In addition to being a nice looking (secondary when wearing safety glasses), this pair is ultra-comfortable. When absorbed by my favorite pastime, namely landscaping, whether trimming lawn edges, felling and cutting up trees, theses glasses do not fog up, nor does dirt get on the inside of the glasses as a result of the foam lining encircling the lenses.  In comparison to a considerable collection of previously worn safety glasses, these win top prize hands down.  All the more, given a more than respectable price.  This pair makes wearing safety glasses a joy rather than a must.
summary: Makes wearing safety glasses a pleasure rather than a must!

reviewText: This light is the perfect size to carry clipped in a pocket. I like to carry it in the 5th pocket of my jeans next to my leatherman sidekick with my main EDC knife in my main pocket and I never notice it's there. It's saved my butt a couple times too needing to find things in the dark or the last time I locked myself out of my truck. Bright enough for most utility tasks, solid construction, sturdy pocket clip and a simple single mode operation via a tailcap switch. For me this is a perfect EDC utility light.

I often come across batteries at home and at work that are out of the package, no one knows if it's still good or not. I think who ever is drinking the last of the OJ or milk and putting the empty carton back into the fridge is responsible for these stray batteries. ;)Seriously though, I think we've all done this - change out batteries in electronic devices if the item isn't working up to snuff, and if you find the problem isn't the battery you now have a good battery out of the package and very often find it later, not sure, can't recall if it's good. You're faced with throwing it out and possibly wasting money on a good battery, keeping it in a junk drawer or it ends up rolling around on your desk for months before you get so sick of seeing it you just toss it in the garbage can.Because I hate wasting money I test any stray battery just in case. But testing it with the traditional battery tester can be time consuming and annoying, and for some of us it's also difficult. Most of us keep battery testers in the garage or basement, tucked away in a box of tools. And even if the tester is near by and easy to get to, traditional battery testers can be hard to use - especially if you have dexterity problems or a child in your lap. This tester allows you to slide the battery in and just squeeze to test. That's it. Very simple and easy.My husband bought this tester for me because I fumbled around so much with his regular battery voltage tester that has wires and clips. I have dexterity problems due to arm injuries but I find this easy to use. He also had another motive - he wanted me to stay out of his tool box, wanted me to have a tester of my own.Like the other reviewers, I took away one star because the indicator was a bit hard to read. I had to put on my reading glasses to be sure. I'd pay extra to have this with both the color graph index and a digital numeric read out.But still, I would in fact recommend this for basic household and office use, not just if you have dexterity issues, but also if you're someone who always has their hands full (like with kids) it's much quicker and easier to use than the traditional kind with wires and clips. It's also great for use by children.I keep mine in a drawer where I keep all my computer, camera, and electronics accessories, battery chargers, adapters, etc. We still keep the traditional battery tester with wires in with my husband's tools, because that kind works on just about any battery.I recommend this for mom's, care givers, office workers, kids - anyone who has items that run on AAA, AA, 9V, C, or D batteries. Have it handy in your home office or family room (not in a tool box) or where ever you keep your batteries. And be sure to show your kids how to use it so they don't waste money by throwing away batteries that are still good.One last thought. In an emergency, if you need to check batteries for a flashlight for example, this is much quicker and simpler than traditional battery testers. In an emergency you don't want to waste time with wires and the need for the pin point accuracy of touching clips and wires to the battery and tester.UPDATE:This is a perfectly good review yet two people have recently voted it as not helpful, these are the same two people who don't like my negative review of the very dangerous so called "Art of Cure" teething necklace and are voting down my other reviews just for spite. They don't realize I can tell they are doing this, and so can Amazon. In the future those who abuse the voting system may be banned from Amazon? Let's hope so. It's a shame people are so nasty and spiteful when reviews should be used to help others.
summary: Great for office workers, home office, busy moms, people with dexterity problems, children, and the elderly

reviewText: It is a great item.  Sensor can sense far away....exceeded my expectation on the range. Battery powered is not bad and easy to replace.  easy to mount on the wall...Just bought another whtie color for back yard.  Lights is ok bright, but enough to cover the stairs and front yard.  It helps me watch the bicycle that I locked on my front yard fense...When thief comes again, he would have to steal it under this beams light....  :(  got stole once before with no light.  So this one will help. LOL
summary: Mr Beams MB360 Wireless LED Spotlight with Motion Sensor and Photocell...

reviewText: there was nothing per-say wrong with this product, but pay attention to the quantities before ordering. I wanted to hang a whole bunch of pictures, and I was out of the pieces I needed really quickly with this kit. I realized afterwards that i would have been better off buying a more expensive kit with more in it--theres not much wire at all, for example. i think this is a good product if you just have a few pictures 2 hang as a little starter set, but if you are trying to do a lot u might want to upsize a bit.
This item keeps your plug in cords away from beds, wall boxes, bureaus, and anything else that could put strain on the plug end of of any wired device.  Great item!
Sturdy, good light output, touch switch is nice . I bought one and after I used it I bought another one. Five thumbs up!

I ordered this as a 'filler' to meet the $35 Free Shipping threshhold.  Since then I've been using it as intermediate layers in CA finishes for wood barrel pens and glueing tubes in acrylic.  It's been working great for me.
Its cheap and it works.  I have a video of my testing before installing my solid wood flooring in case any warranty issues pop up.
summary: If you need it, buy it

reviewText: I got it and it worked fine for a hour or so while recharging the batteries. I didn't do any extensive work, just cutting a plywood board. Then one battery died completely! It was still chargeable but dead with the tool. The other battery still worked. When I contacted Rockwell customer support they told me they can't change the battery on general warranty and they could just send me another one based on their lifetime battery warranty where I had to pay handling and shipping. So I returned the item to Amazon. I don't care if Rockwell shots them self  in the foot because just sending me a new battery without charging me for shipping/handling would likely be cheaper for them. We'll see if the replacement package has also problems or not. The tool itself is nice for the price and it comes with a lot of blades, two batteries and charger. So for the price it is a good value if it all works with the batteries included. The speed dial is maybe a little soft and can get changed unintentionally and the mounting system might be a bit sturdier and easier to handle, but for the price those are just small flaws and don't get in the way of the deal. The batteries need to be recharged frequently, but I expected this and the charger just needs half an hour to recharge a battery. So for the current pricing I'd say this is still a good deal. Other companies like Fein, Bosch and so on might be a tad better, but they cost a whole lot more. Just for a little cutting here and sanding there the Rockwell is just fine. Rockwell sells the same system for twice the price with a universal mount system, but I think it will not be needed. With this kit here there comes also a universal mount adapter. So you can also mount other blades from other companies with it. I subtracted the two stars just because of the faulty battery and the reaction of the customer support. Because if you buy a tool and one battery dies within an hour it would have been nice if they jumped over their shadow and just send me a new battery free of any charge. Much easier for me than to send the whole package back and to wait some days for the new package till I can hopefully continue with my work.Update:I received now my replacement kit and it works. Kudos to Amazon and the replacement/return process! Both batteries work fine and also the tool. So I upgraded my star rating from 3 to 4. There is still the service issue and quality control is obviously not perfect. Anyways, it's a nice toolkit and worth the price!
summary: Quality control and service issues, but tool worth the price

reviewText: We got a great deal on this through Amazon.It's a neat little scroll saw that functions well. It's also made to separate and use as a coping saw, but I have not tried that.My favorite part is the ease in which I can change blades. My vision is not great anymore, and I was able to do this with relative ease.I have an older regular Dremel that is high quality as well. I don't use these tools a lot, but they can be the perfect device when you need them.This is really for small projects, but it seems well constructed (especially the dremel tool itself) and seems like it will last.This tool is a lot of fun.

It's ok.  The blade is pretty good.  The screws that hold the clip on came out already and I can't tighten them back. Using the carabiner as a bottle opener is a little  awkward. I find that it doesn't work so great.
summary: Probably worth the money but not great

reviewText: Works SOOOOO much better than the "hit or miss" normal stud finders.  If this thing sticks on the wall, there's a stud there.  Boom.

So far I purchased 2 lights and neither one lasted very long. They work great for awhile and then they start going on and off after the first activation. They will do this for about three to four times and then shut off until the next activation. And then its the same problem. I've move them, I've went up and down with them and made sure there was nothing in the area to activate them. Nothing seems to work. They're not even worth returning for the price of postage and partial late cost.

at first i was disappointed in the flimsy nature of the product. i figured it should be intuitive and easy to use. not so. it seemed the product was broken as it would not work. so i had to make a long distance call at my expense. there after three attempts, someone told me they had a problem with the product they had not anticipated. they were correcting it by including instructions. so the person told me the 'secret' of how to make this foolish thing work. i followed the cumbersome instructions and got it to -just sort of work. but it is a very awkard procedure and even then sometimes it does work and then again it will just not. this item sure is not worth the money, not worth the hassle, and not worth having to make a toll call. all it is good for i think is as a straight edge...foregoing any plans to have it clamp easily to wood and guide a saw. never would i have bought this ahd i seen it beforehand.
summary: hard to use; does it work??? not by my experience

reviewText: This Black & Decker drill / driver is very nice and I liked the autosense technology that stops when a screw is flush with the surface.  I tested this B&D; drill driver on a number of 1 5/8 inch screws for a wood fence and it drove them in quite well and stopped when they were flush.  I used the phillips bit attached to the bottom of the drill and I didn't have any problems with the bit jumping off the screw heads.  I used the flat bit on some larger wood screws where I had drilled a small hole and the B&D; drilled them in flush also.  The flat bit jumped off the screw head sometimes, which may mean that I should have used a larger bit.  Switching the B&D; over to the drill mode, I drilled some 13/32 inch holes in 2x4's and it performed quite well.  That was the largest drill bit that I could get into the 3/8's inch chuck.  The drill is a 0 to 800 rpm variable speed.The only issue that I had with this B&D; drill & driver is that the forward / reverse switch is right above the trigger, and sometimes when I gripped the drill with work gloves on, my finger would bump the switch into the center (off) or into reverse.It's nice that the 20V lithium battery is also usable in my Black & Decker weedeater, the LST420.  (However the 20V battery for this drill is 1.5 amp hours and the 20V batteries for the weedeater are 2 amp hours.)
summary: This Black & Decker drill / driver is very nice with the autosense feature. The battery is interchangeable with my B&D weedeater

reviewText: These cutters are of very high quality and allow you to do precision work. the quality is top notch and should last a very long time!

The Crucial tool, when closed, feels and looks like a knife.  The pliers are adequate, the carabiner, knife, and flat head driver all work well and seem to be of good construction.  The "cross driver" does work as a phillips driver if one is careful:  It can be easy to strip screws with this, I tend to use heavy pressure and turn slowly.  If it starts to slip it is not going to work and I go no further.  Besides the cross driver, it is a very good and handy tool that is clipped in my pocket daily.  ***UPDATE***  7/28/10  The pliers have broken after a couple of months of light duty use.  There is a tab (tensioner) on the back of the handle that puts pressure on the pliers to make them work.  It just broke today when I was opening it.  I noticed this is made in China, not the same quality as my old Gerber Multi tool.  I will have to send it back for a warranty as the pliers will now not work.  After this happening and realizing how thin the broken part in question is, I have to knock it down to 3 stars and would say that I would not take this into the woods on a camping trip or other foray far from civilization.  Average quality and good workmanship.***UPDATE*** 8/25/10  I returned my tool for repair and they sent me a new one.  9 day turnaround.  Great service on the warranty!!!  No RMA needed, just sent to them with a return address.
summary: Nice Everday Multi Tool/Broke after a couple of months/Quick Warranty Service

reviewText: The picture in amazon has a switch plate. The packaging has what looks like a switch plate but is just a picture surrounding the knob. If you'll forgive me -bait and switch. The back of the package says not recommended for Hunter original series fans, they recommend the hunter 22691, 27189 and 27187 for those
summary: Switch plate not included and not for Hunter classic fans

reviewText: I like that it has a "handle" to grab it by. The last one I had ended up failing because the cord ended up losing the seal probably do to how it was mounted.
. It made my mouse move smoother on my desktop, which is the reason I bought it. I am not going to write any more reviews, since Amazon DEMANDS a certain number of words.

I am not a knife expert, but i do own several knives and this is one of my favorites.The assisted opening action is smooth and it has a good blade, that holds an edge.  It has steel liners, giving it a high quality feel, but also some added weight.  The fire safe opening takes a little to get used to.  Great knife for a great price.

I'm confused about the difference on the prices here on Amazon.  One is $130 and the other $210 yet they look the same to me.  When I did my search the $130 one didn't come up so I bought it for the $130 price at another place.This sander works quite well.  The top is a little large for smaller hands but you can get used to it.  It doesn't come even with a single sanding disk.  I tried to convert a 5 hole disk since I have a ton of them but have just ordered the Mirca 8 hole assortment.  The quick shutoff is really wonderful compared to the old ros sanders.

I feel like it could use a bit more variety in what they give you. Or at least have other sets you can choose from. It basically covers you on all the allen key sizes. Flat heads and phillips. There is also some square bits in there.The case and everything is very slim which is nice if you pack it in with the sheath that you leatherman fits into. All the bits fit snug, over time though i have found the bits to be looser and can slip out if your not careful.

The MiterV120 is Incra's latest entry into their awesome Miter Gauge line. The precision is incredibly accurate, and once adjusted for perfect 0 degrees, you won't think twice about setting an angle in the stops ever again.  The slide is micro-adjustable to fit whatever slot you are using it in without any play or wobble.I have Incra's Miter5000 sled system, and the MiterExpress. I use the V120 with the Express sled, and on my bandsaw for absolute angle measurements that are always accurate to the Nth degree.Incra's Customer Support is second to none in my experience. (I own a LOT of Incra products).  If you need assistance, they are there and will spend whatever time is necessary to answer your issues or questions.Well worth the money and HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
summary: The latest miter guage from Incra... and probably the BEST ever!

reviewText: Not much to say. They seem to work fine. I blew through all 300 of the 1" brads tonight and had 1 jam on my Hitachi nailer. I'd say that's a pretty good ratio. The jam, though, was a big one where it seemed the next few nails weren't quite lined up right. I don't know if that's because of the gun or the nails, but in any case, 4 stars it is. Recommended.
summary: Pretty good, not sure you'll find better

reviewText: I was hesitant of a battery powered motion light. This works great.Auto shut off during daylight, nice and bright when activated at night. Been out in the weather for about a month now with no issues and still using the same batteries. Seems as bright as ever. There was no setup at all. Just put batteries and hang it up. Goes out after about a minute if there is no more motion.

The good:  Have bits on hand to tighten or loosen just about any screw you might encounter.  The holder is well-made and durable and it securely contains the bits.  The bits themselves seem to be made of sturdy metal that doesn't break under pressure.The bad:  You can fit only one of the two holders in the leatherman sheath at once.The ugly:Overall:  If you have a leatherman that takes these bits, this is entirely worth the money you would spend on itNotes:  The first time I ordered this, I was sent an empty package.  Amazon very quickly sent a replacement with no difficulty.Michael

reviewText: Nothing compares to this stuff. At all. I use it for everything from wiretucking to mounting my wireless antenna to my wall in my garage. Incredible tape.

reviewerName: P. Repage "FT Dad, Doctor & PT photographer"
reviewText: Seems to be a well made product, would buy again as a gift for someone else who wanted / needed this product.Have to see if it stands the test of time... :-)
summary: great stickers; they don't mar the walls, can change the locale as desired

reviewText: Purchased this lock in conjunction with the Nexia Home Bridge and a couple of the door/window sensors. The lock itself is very well constructed and operates completely within expectations. Where the performance begins to wain, is when it has to communicate with the bridge as part of the Nexia Home Intelligence service. Whether it is the lock's fault or the bridge's fault, the communication and response to commands is unreliable and often misrepresents itself via the Nexia mobile app. I do however love the added functionality of the auto-leave option, built in tamper alarm, coded entry and everything else the lock itself offers, and that is why I've kept it. I just wish the remote control and remote reporting reliability was better.
summary: As a lock, works well. As an internet-connected device, it needs work.

reviewText: After enduring the lousy performance of my Bosch-supplied miter gauge (Model 4100 table saw)and being disappointed with my picture-frame miters, I decided to move on up. What a difference! This INCRA gauge is solid, exact and easy to install. Best of all I like the adjustable "slide", which you can adjust so that there is zero "wiggle" in the slot. I would probably have to buy a $4000 table saw to realize the super-high accuracy of the gauge, but I am willing to settle for beautiful miters. Also, I don't have to get out my square every time I turn my miter gauge back to 90 degrees!Basically, the only major adjustment you have to make is to ensure that your saw blade is parallel to the miter slot on the saw. Using the gauge is dead-simple, and the included instructions are clear and to the point. INCRA provides extra hardware to install your wood fence (i.e. to backup your cuts near the blade), and throws in a few extra pieces to boot!Most of the time, when you get stuff made in those "overseas" sweat-shops, you quickly see where they cut corners or barely made specs. INCRA, on the other hand, is made right here in the US of A, and I definitely got the feeling it was made by someone who might want to use the fence themselves. You get what you pay for, boys and girls, and if you are someone who cares about accuracy, spring for the extra bucks and you will never regret it.
summary: Don't settle for less than this

reviewText: In a nutshell: Best all around quality, Best design, Best features, Best quick release bit holder. I use quick load bit holders on my 12v Milwaulkee Impact drivers. The small quick release on the impact drivers are small, difficult to grasp, and have to pull collar out in order to push the bit in.  Awkward!!  But this Wera quick release loader eliminates binding & makes rapidly changing bits an absolute breeze!This Wera tool is phenomenal & not only easily handles 1/4 shanks, but also the short 1 inch long straight shank bits (e.g. phillips, blade, star, square, etc.) with ease. Previously I used the DEWALT DW2505 Rapid Load Holder but I found it was too long (3inches) and awkward.  This Wera is easier to grasp & eject, more precise holding bit alignment and 33% closer to the work for better accuracy, top quality, and smother operation all the way around than the China made Dewalt DW2505.It ejects everything very smoothly. And the magnet is designed to not over power the bit so that the bit slips out perfectly when released. No 'back holding' or tugging to remove the bit. This bit does it all and in a much more convenient, less bulky shorter 2in length vs 3in for the Dewalt.The Dewalt wobbles more and encourages bit walk due to it's longer length & looser tolerances. The Dewalt is also harder to control vs the shorter compact length of the Wera.  Precise, under control, and easier to pop off the bit for the next one this Wera has increased my drilling speed, comfort & efficiency. It has eliminated a hassle and made things fun again.Wera is German made and the quality shows. It's an easy one handed operation,...Push in a new bit to automatically lock,... Pull back the collar to release and eject.  I have an injury to my thumb and find the Wera collar is much easier on my joints to load /eject vs the Dewalt collar. I will be purchasing more of the Wera K Rapidaptors'.Hands down, this Quick Release Wera is in a class by itself.  All of the 5 star reviews were correct. It's a pleasure to recommend a great product that deserves 5 stars with the good feeling that my purchase is helping support a free, democratic country.
summary: I was Skeptical but it Won me over,...Less Bulky, EAsier Operation vs Dewalt (China) Rapid Loader DW2505

reviewText: I bought the Dremel CKDR-02 Ultimate 3-Tool Combo Kit with 15 Accessories and Storage Bag last year ($150 on an Amazon deal around Black Friday) and have gotten way more use out of the pieces than I would have ever dreamed.  This is the "big brother" of the Saw-Max SM20, which came in my set.  Not only is it heavier, but it uses larger blades.  I have had a few instances when the small blade on the Saw-Max necessitated my flipping the item over and sawing though the back.  For one project I needed to cut sheetrock and wall studs.  I started with the Saw-Max to cut the sheetrock and make sure there were no wires in the area, then used the Multi-Max MM20 to cut the stud.  The Saw-Max's maximum depth is 3/4".  It does have markings on the side that tell you what depth the blade is set for.  The Ultra-Saw does not.  The Ultra-Saw, with the included flush blade, would have allowed me to cut part of the stud, but I still would probably have reached for the Multi-Max to finish it.If you are a professional or a heavy user, you probably would be better off with a standard Skil saw.  For my uses (installation of a wall electric fireplace, replacing wood trim, cutting stone and metal mosaic tile, etc.) the lighter Saw-Max was great.  I do like the bigger blade and more power of the Ultra-Saw, but it is offset by the additional weight.  If I were to buy a Dremel saw right now I would probably buy this over the Saw-Max just because it does have the wider blade.  However, I think the 3-tool combo is the best way to go as it gives the options of using the Multi-Max and Dremel 3000.  Oh, and buy extra blades.  They don't last terribly long and they are much cheaper on Amazon.
These nails work great with my new Dewalt D51276K nail gun and, so far, have not jammed up at all.
summary: Great nails for the Dwalt D51276 nail gun!

reviewText: I keep having to buy these, because they keep being stolen from me.  So it is a common favorite of many people...I generally prefer fixed blade drivers, but when you are far from the toolbox, having a driver that can be reconfigured with bits stored in the handle is a nice bonus.  Unlike some of the cheap ratcheting drivers, this one can hold up to heavier duty use.  I have yet to damage one of these.I also have had the Craftsman version of this tool, and they both seem to perform equally well.  Klein is generally higher quality than Craftsman, but I can't really see much difference for this particular tool.**UPDATE**I have ordered these in the past and was happy with what I got.  However I just ordered two more, and this time I received two Vaco versions of this tool.  The Vaco seem to be of nearly the same quality that I was expecting.  However the magnet is weaker than the Klein version.  I think that instead of a rare-earth magnet, Vaco uses a more ordinary Alnico magnet, so the magnet is weaker, and you are more likely to drop a screw or have the bit come out.  I've dinged the seller review on this issue, I won't change the 5 star review of the item, since the Klein is still a good tool, my problem is with the seller.
summary: This is the most commonly stolen tool in my toolbox

reviewText: with the up, down, here's a hole, there's a hole yard we have, these were my best investment recently.  we could not use the ladder without them, at least not safely.  they sit firmly and have an easily used wide adjustment range.
I have these on my porch posts as you enter the front door , sensor is underneath so they only go on when you within about 3-4 feet... will be buying a few more for my barn and shop.
reasonable price...especially in the 10 pack...if your like me putting together a dust collector for the garage these are the way to go

I'm a cabinet maker and being frustrated with the the battery operated ones gave up on stud finders a couple years ago. I was checking out a project and the customer pulled out one of these to show me the crazy placement of studs in a wall, I couldn't believe it -- magnets, what a great idea. I bought 2. The only drawback I've found is if the screw or nail that the magnet finds is off the stud or just biting the side of the stud, other than that, buy one.

I put this in a fixture to replace a compact fluorescent light (CFL) and when I turned this bulb on I had to double-check and make sure it wasn't a CFL also... it turns on instantly and the color temperature is a nice warm white like the best CFL's.  It does not need to "warm up" but instead provides full intensity of light as soon as it's turned on.  As the box says, it is not dimmable and if you put it in a dimmer fixture (even an electronic dimmer) it will flash like a strobe.  The main disadvantage of this bulb is that the bottom half of the bulb is covered by a white plastic so the light really only shines out of the top, like a flood light.  I think this bulb would work best in applications where it is mounted facing down  or to the side.  I did not see any warnings about shortened bulb life when facing down but that is a possibility.I compare this to the Creed LED lights which Amazon also sells and the Creed come out on top.  For the same price, they are dimmable, have a good color tone, a nice rubberized coating over the bulb that helps prevent breakage, and are also instant-on.  Because the Creed bulbs provide omni-directional light they more closely approximate the old incandescent bulbs that so many of us are replacing.Overall a good, solid bulb for specific applications where directional light is needed and dimming is not required.Hope this helps in your bulb shopping!
summary: Great light color, instant on, NOT dimmable, directional light

reviewText: Last year I missed the Deal of the Day last year when this ladder was offered.  I was disappointed, as I really wanted it.  So when I saw it this year, there was No hesitation.  Yes, it is more expensive that the knock offs that one can purchase in the Big Box stores until the Deal of the Day.  I’ve used the Little Giant and the knock offs and finds this ladder to be better constructed and easier to use. This ladder and its competitors have most of the same features but when you add in the work platform at this price, there is no comparison! I do not have a lot of storage space, so this ladder replaced my 6’ and 8’ step ladders as well as my 20’ extension ladders.  Sold all 3 and the revenue paid for more than  the cost of this one!
I have one mounted on my shed in the back yard to deter people from snooping and it works great. I also have one in my garage that kicks on as I drive in. These are great and work like a charm!

This modern chandelier will fit right in with my eclectic decorating style.  Constructed from a heavy metal, it provides lots of light. I agree with the reviewer who disliked the shades on the hanging lamps.  I, too, think they could have been styled better to go with the chandelier itself; however, with the lights turned on, the darkish shades lighten up and do not detract substantially from the overall effect.I am not an electrician, so I'm having a certified electrician install the chandelier.  That said, I cannot comment on the difficulty or ease of installation.Overall, this could be a good fit for specific decorating styles.Four Stars!
summary: Modern or Eclectic -- This Chandelier Will Do Nicely

reviewText: I've seen pros using an identical cutter, and this one has held up well so far, so I expect it to last at least as long as my previous one (which was over 15 years).  I lost the other before it wore out, so it still had some life left.  It cuts steel, copper, aluminum, hard nylon, and probably glass.
summary: It cuts small tubing - what more do you want?

reviewText: Had been having trouble for a while with the old Ni-Cd batteriesand had been nursing them along.  Sorry now I waited so long.Great batteries and charger. Fast, long-lasting.  Great.
summary: Why did I wait so long?

reviewText: I  bought one of these, tried it out and bought four more!  Some of those LED light strips are too bright and these  efficient dimmers work just great!  The dimming range is from waaay down to full.  I put a KILL A WATT  meter on the input of the 120VAC to 12vdc power supply and  ran the dimmer through its full range.  At the bottom end of the dimming range, the LED strip was using only 2Watts of power.  At full brightness it was about 24Watts.If you live out in the woods and have to run all your lights off batteries and/or solar, this is part of the way to go!  Say goodbye to the CFL "curly bulbs".I put an AM radio tuned to a weak station nearby and the dimmer added a  noticeable annoying whine to the broadcast.  Moving the radio away made that pretty much go away.Some of the Chinese sellers advise DO NOT run 12volt LED devices directly off a car battery because it can be  way above 12 volts which will quickly burn out  devices not designed for such over-voltage.  12.2 volts is  safe.  I put  little "fast blow" glass fuses rated for a little over the (measured)  current draw of the strip(s)  in series for each circuit just to be safe.  Better to have a fuse blow rather than a fire or having to replace a strip if something shorts.
summary: 12 volt LED DIMMER IS A GOOD THING  !

reviewText: I used this drill bit set a couple of times and really don't like them at all.  The bits grab into the wood way too fast making a very rugged hole.  I used them today drilling holes in treated, outdoor lumber and the bits would grab, get stuck, forcing me to constantly reverse the drill and back out.  Even with soft pressure, they want to force themselves into the wood way too fast jerking the drill out of your hand.  The holes were all chewed up and ragged, just awful!  I can't imagine using these bits in metal!!!
summary: Dewalt pilot point drill bits way to aggressive!

reviewText: This product works well for its basic purpose -- providing a flexible mechanism to drill or drive fasteners around corners or in hard to reach locations.  Unfortunately, when only a bit of load is applied (such as when driving a screw or other fastener), the head of the tool breaks off of the shaft.  I had several of these self-destruct in this way, so this appears to be a fundamental limitation of this tool.  Bottom line, this is probably ok for drilling, but don't expect to use this to drive screws or other fasteners.
summary: Works well for drilling, but breaks under load

reviewText: Great tool but a ho hum box. The box is about the only fault I find with it. Works great with my Dewalt DrillDriver.

This DUAL Charger is by far the BEST ever if you're using a lot of cordless.Its easier carrying one dual charger than two singles ones.... Also, it protects your batteries very well.  Its the BEST you can buy... the only thing that is VERY Discouraging is the cost.... for around $90 its a little expensive.  Maybe if it was more affordable they would sell better and more of.But I use it all the time - I have to have it !!!!

Although I feel that the jigsaw body is too heavy, most people won't be able to hold it steady with just 1 hand.Sander:- very easy to use, just hook up a piece of sand paper, and punch a few holes to collect the dust,- Has an attached vacuum bag that collects the dust- It's very well design, that it's easy to hold and sand things with.Jigsaw:- pretty powerful motor that gives you a lot of cutting power- the blade that comes with it are not so great, but usable. You will need to get other blades for more detail work to cut.- The jigsaw body is quite heavy, I'm having a hard time hold on to it with just 1 hand

These bar work well, but they are a little clunky and feel cheap compared to other products.  I ended up returning these and going with something a little more low profile for under my cabinets. I Programmed it in less than 10 seconds, and it works PERFECTLY !!Kudos to Amazon and ASP Doors !!  I Highly Recommend Both !!

The light is bright and the sensor works, so that's great.  But the whole thing is plastic and how long will this last outdoors in either hot or cold weather? And rain?  I love the device but it wouldnt surprise me if it has a 2 year lifespan. We have it installed under a deep overhang so it rarely gets wet: hopefully it will last.

reviewText: If you don't stress them too much these things are great for the occasional tiedown that one might need in the garage or in the car/truck. I will order a couple more pairs for myself. The locking mechanism depends a lot on the friction against the cord, and it felt pretty secure when I set it in place. But I did have to wonder how it will fare if the cord rolls around and instead of using the tension to maintain the lock the cords would end up being pulled apart. As I said, it should be fine for lighter loads, but for something more substantial a good old fashioned manual locking system would probably serve better.

reviewText: These are amazingly easy to program, reliable, and have long battery life.  The price on Amazon is as good as it is anywhere else.
This is my third one.  A great product, no problems.  I just hope no more relatives move in and take up my garage.
Easy to set up. Good replacement for a single door garage. The others with more buttons are more expensive so this is perfect.

Most bungee cords are made to act as a tie down for various things when transporting. Unfortunately, they are generally not strong enough to use for anything that a strap will do better. That having been said... this new bungee is designed for a more suited purpose. The cord is wrapped around anything that needs to be held together and then very easily fits into a devise which holds it tight. It is very easy to grip and release. It doesn't have hooks like the traditional bungee has at each end. I have found various uses for this ProGrip bungee. They include: quickly fastening a exercise mat for storage when finished, keeping a sleeping bag or bed roll together, collecting and carrying the sticks that accumulate in the yard after a bit of wind, tying up tent poles or stakes, and quickly tying together garden implements when not in use. The ProGrip is stronger than the average bungee and appears as if it will last.

Think of these as folding needle-nose.  The fit and finish is not great.  The tools are too soft for handling clutch situations.  The knife blade could be made of higher quality steel.  It is too heavy for what it offers.  Good to keep in the car or tackle-box, but definitely not a daily carry.

Fixing a printed circuit board can be a pain when you have to unsolder an electrical component.  You have to get the old solder off the component and the PC board so you can fit the new component into place.  You also want to do it quickly and cleanly so you don't use too much heat and possibly damage the PC board pad.This desoldering braid is ideal as it is pure oxygen free copper and you simply hold it against the PC board solder joint and touch it with your soldering iron.  The heated copper braid wicks the solder into it and out of the component lead hole.  The component can usually easily be lifted out of the hole and off the board.  If you need to you can retouch up the PC board to make sure that the component lead hole is clear of solder for the replacement part.With a roll of this and $12 worth of capacitors I fixed my wife's 46 inch LCD TV that the electronics store wanted $1,000 to repair.  Sorry Geek Squad!  This is a handy tool if you work on electronics or fix computers.  When you need it, it is worth its weight in gold!I highly recommend it!
summary: Best solution for removing bad components from printed circuit boards!

reviewText: I got this in the mail quick I started using it.these fluke multimeter are good I use then for working on cars and I like this fluke meter. I'll recommend this for any first time user since it has the auto switch.

Anyways, somebody put this in the wrong category (Toys) section to be exact.But anyways, this tip is great for precision soldering, such as PCB's (Printed Circuit Boards).Buy if if you need more than that standard tip your soldering iron usually comes with.You won't regret it, does its job well and outstandingly precise.Would recommend.
summary: Silly Amazon,This is not a toy :P

reviewText: Our garage door can not be seen without walking outside, so when accidental triggering of the remote happens, the door stayed up until we went outside to check the door.  Incredibly easy to install, and very reliable, and a standard battery.  I wish the remotes had recessed buttons!  Just carrying the remote in my pocket with the car keys triggers the opener.  Terrific product because it actually works!

This is a great addition to anyone who has garage, its no way connected to your installed unit, but can notify you by a red or green light indicating if its open or closed. Great for homes with 2 or more floors, all you need to do is attach the sensor somewhere on your garage door, place the base unit where it easily seen and thats it, green closed, red open, what a great idea.
These are high quality, self drilling screws. They work well with the Kreg pocket hole jigs, and are also useful in other applications where a self-drilling screw is needed.

The Workmate WM425 is an excellent movable work table, but Black & Decker has managed to make it very likely that you'll find it damaged upon opening if you buy one.The problem is that the WM425 was designed to be shipped partly disassembled, but is now being shipped almost completely put together.  There are plastic blocks that act as large nuts to receive the bolts that hold the bamboo plywood planks to the metal framework.  The bottom part of each block has a narrow section that fits in a slot in the metal framework, and "wings" below the slot that push against the sides of the slot to resist the occasional upward force on the plank.  In normal use these plastic wings don't have to withstand a lot of force because gravity is keeping the planks in place.  When folded up and shipped in an unpadded cardboard carton, the frequent sideways forces from the truck starting and stopping will cause the heavy planks to rip the plastic wings off.  Each of the two sliding planks in my WM425 arrived with a broken plastic block.The instruction sheet that comes with the unit tells how to assemble the WM425 from separate parts.  Since these parts are almost all already in place, the conflicting instructions are confusing.  And Black & Decker seems to be in denial that the units are sent already assembled, because the customer service person proclaimed vigorously that the instructions matched the shipped units.  I had to mail in the broken plastic blocks to get replacements; this took about three weeks.---Once you get a working WM425 you'll have a very nice folding work table with a couple of limitations.  The table is fairly heavy, so folding and unfolding is a bit cumbersome.  For twice-a-weekend frequency it's OK; you probably wouldn't want to fold the table up hourly.  The second limitation is the clamping system, which slips after you apply moderate force.  I haven't found anything that required more gripping force than I needed, yet.I'm building a router table that uses the WM425 as a base.  With the middle plank removed there's adequate clearance for even a large router, and the other two planks will clamp onto cleats on the underside of the removable table top to keep everything very stable.  When I don't need the router table it'll pop off the WM425 and hang from a wall hook, and the WM425 will fold to free up garage space.Summary: Very nice folding work table which will support heavy materials and clamp fairly large pieces for you to work on.  But it's NOT RECOMMENDED for mail order.
summary: Excellent product, but not designed to ship safely

reviewText: The spring loaded pliers are very handy, however, as some other reviewers have mentioned, it seems to create some "slop" in the main hinge.  It's not terrible, but it's unusual for anyone who has owned and used an original Leatherman.The scissors are very handy, but the wire cutters don't touch completely, and there is a belt clip instead of the hard leather pouch you may be used to.All other functions are up to the Leatherman quality you know and trust. At this price point, it's an irresistible purchase just to keep a very handy tool in your glovebox or kitchen drawer.

I bought the porter cable 4 tool combo set from lowes but I really wanted an impact driver to with it. Amazon had it for a good price so I bought it no hesitation. I always bring this with me for what ever projects I'm doing. It has a lot of torque and drives in 3" screws no problem. Can't go wrong here.

I used this to cut wood - especially pieces of paint stirrers. It is also excellent for cutting photos and pictures exactly when working on my scrapbook hobby. The informational booklet, tucked in the zippered storage case, was very helpful telling which blade should be for which product. The case is very sturdy and well organized.

*** update Nov  7 2013 *** I liked it so much I order two more pairs of bulbs.  One item of concern since then: on one bulb, 12 LEDs have gone dark (out of 50 or 60 total?). The bulb is still bright and if this is the only issue, I'm happy.  A limited failure within the first two months of operation does make one wonder about long term reliability, though.  I've de-rated my review from 5 to 4 stars.*** original review ***So far still going strong and is much brighter than the tubes it replaced.  If you have a dingy space (like our laundry room) that uses this fixture, we think you'll be very happy with the results.
summary: Bright and (mostly) reliable - I love it!

reviewText: While it says it works for mostly insects, I was more concerned with ants as they are my primary problem. I used it to treat the perimeter around the house. Usually by the start of summer ants find their way in to the home. I mixed according to the directions and put it around the foundation, including base of windows and doors. It's been several weeks and I have not seen any ants in the house. I would like to try this in the yard and other areas to see if I could get rid of some grubs and other pests. Overall I'm happy with the cost and effectiveness of the Spectracide.
I rate this 5 starts because this is by far the best sander I've ever used. Does the job very well. I recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a sander :)

It says it kills 260 bugs BY CONTACT.  It says that it is ok to use on lawns, vegetables, various bushes, ect.  It does note though, on the bottle, that if you use it on tomatoes, for example, that you need to use it 5 days before harvest.I don't use a lot of chemicals on my garden or in my yard, but I am not totally committed to organic either.  I just like to use a little bit when I have to, when natural methods fail me.  I normally use sevin dust, which leaves everything white until it washes off.This year, something was eating my hibiscus.  The only other problem I've had has been snails, but that was easily solved with beer in a bowl.  I could not tell WHAT was eating my hibiscus, but whatever it was was eating it to death.  I had to save it.This bottle treats a HUGE yard, but I just wanted to use it for spot treatment.  It says 3 tablespoons per 1 gallon of water treats 300 square feet.  I simply mixed up 1.5 tablespoons in 1/2 gallon of water and put it in 2 quart spray containers so I have one for my yard and one for the greenhouse.  It was REALLY EASY.It is clear - so if you do this, know it is a good idea to mark the bottles!  Else it would be easy to mistake it for water.My hibiscus is looking great.  I have to keep my chickens away from sprayed plants for 24 hours.  It was no problem but I will limit using it where they roam a lot.  It will be very handy in the green house.It has worked well.  I've stopped losing leaves off my old maids and the hibiscus is now rebounding.I did not test it on my whole lawn, so I can't comment on that.  Generally my few hens keep most of lawn bug free, my problem areas are always where they aren't allowed.  This is nice to have for that, and the price is amazing.  Geez, this one bottle will last me forever the way I use it.

Do read the label, it calls out certain species of ants. You'll notice most all of the negative reviews mention it not working on their ants. Could be the issue...Anyway, you mix this up and spray it with your hand sprayer and it kills a long list of insects on contact. As with all pesticides, you need to use moderation and only spray if necessary, but triazicide seems to work best on the mosquitoes here in Wisconsin.
summary: Hate to have to spray, but this stuff works

reviewText: I have moved several times in my life and I depend on this Scotch brand tape to keep my boxes sealed tight. The back of a moving truck (or storage facility) can be dry, humid, dusty, too hot or too cold. I never know what the conditions will be. I count on this tape to keep my belongings tightly sealed, and safely packed, and it does the job. One more thing. I am a bit fearful/paranoid that my boxes may be opened and contents stolen en route. BUT, this tape sticks so tightly to the boxes, I would be able to tell if someone had pulled it off and tried to reseal it!  Peace of mind. That's what I get with this Scotch moving tape.
summary: You can tell if boxes were tampered with. Tape sticks tightly.

reviewText: I love this stand. I highly recommend getting the 35" Work Center height as it is the most comfortable ergonomically. The portability is the key feature of this stand. The instructions note the maximum placement of the legs is five feet, but I found it to be extremely stable beyond that.  The use of a 2x6 is de riguer for maximum support.  Where this Work Center excels is in installing exterior siding. You can fully support long siding pieces with an equally long 2x cross member. For added utility pick up an extra Trojan sawhorse set to make a sawhorse pair when you aren't using the Work Center.
summary: The Best Valued Miter Saw Stand

reviewText: I followed the instructions and tried several different types of knives.  Never could get any to sharpen at all.  Not happy with this product.

I usually buy those small blowing heaters and cannot get the room warm at all. I finally bought this one and wow does it keeps things nice and toasty. It's quiet and a small foot print in the room. I really enjoy this one. Does not blow on me yet warms the room much faster and far superior to the others, in my opinion. It keeps the room at a stable warmth and no worries about fire hazards that I can see. Nice looking in the black. Nice quality too. You'll forget it's even "on" as it's that quiet but you'll notice that the rooms somehow stay at an even warmth level. I'm very pleased and it came nicely packaged and on time. I would buy again!!

reviewText: We are currently in the process of getting ready to move into a house. We have several boxes that need to be taped up. Scotch packaging tape does the job well for paper based packaging (cardboard, envelopes, etc). The price for four rolls was a great deal on here, much better than full retail!

There is absolutely no need to spend more money on any other soldering iron. This one heats up extremely quickly and hits the temperature that you set it to dead on.  Absolutely amazing build quality too.

I wish I had two of these last year when I started building an addition on my house.  I bought one and quickly found I need two more (a second one for me and one for my wife!)  I have spent years balancing tools on ladder  rungs and holstering them in nylon bags.  (Has anyone else wasted the  battery when the trigger turns on while walking around or climbing a  ladder?)  I have Dewalt cordless tools and they clip in real well, but I  did spread the opening about 1/8" to get them out a little easier.  I  have a 2" tool belt and the clip has never popped off on me.I  have found my productivity has increased in the few precious hours I have  to pursue my home improvement projects each week.  My knees and arms don't  get as tired from tucking power tools between and under them while I dig  for another screw.  No more fumble & bumble in my yard!  Everyone ought  to have one for each hip.

reviewText: The downside is that it is quite heavy, though that can be a advantage to keeping the saw stable when starting a cut.  The aluminum base seems very rigid and gives confidence on keeping the cut on course.  Nice hard case with space for a few additional blades though you have to be careful stowing the cord to keep it away from the blade.  Hard case is much better than the bags supplied with my other DeWalt purchases.  Warning - no fence is included - you have to buy the over-priced $20 DW3278 fence separately.

As many people know an LED flashlight is much brighter than a standard flashlight. And this flashlight is no different. But the bonus in this flashlight is that it has a very high lumens rate vs price. It is 1 inch in width and fits most light attachments for rifles, pistols, shotguns, etc. Simple push button on the end. I purchased another light awhile back with a pressure switch for my wanna be tacticool rifle. After using it, I figured out that it is really uneccessary and am now switching it to one of these.

I decided to pick this up instead of the Fein due to the tool-less blade change mechanism, as opposed to the pin style that the Fine uses. My coworker has a Fein and i have to say the Bosch is definitely quieter than and vibrates much less. Overall its a great tool and would definitely buy again.

WOrks great for small to medium knives and sharpens my leatherman multitools effectively. The housing is somewhat cheap feeling and probably isn't the most durable thing in the world but for something to just keep in a tacklebox or camping bag it will get the job done.

reviewText: These bulbs were used to replace halogen units in a three-way switch setup.  The bulbs do work with a simple on-off switch, but do not work with the high-low-off setting.  Their light is not quite up to par with halogen, but acceptable.  These ship from China, which means longer wait times.

The laser seems to work okay but the shaft of my Dewalt miter saw is smaller than the hole in the laser guide. It should have came with bushings to adjust the fit but instead it came with extra batteries. I'm using it regardless as when I tighten the bolt it still tightens the blade but I'd feel better if it fit tightly. 3 stars.

You probably don't give much thought to your faucets until they leak or fail completely. Then, the last thing on your mind is how lovely those broken pieces look in the bottom of the sink.But thanks to elegant and sturdy design, the American Standard Green Tea Two Handle Centerset Faucet will probably never fail--which means you can lavish your attention on this product's gorgeous design and finish.Compared to many of the other faucets in this price range, American Standard Green Tea is simply stunning in terms of design, build quality, and price. It's one of those products you might pay a little more for--like an IPod--but everytime you use it or look at it, you appreciate why you spent the money.

I have been building custom cabinetry for well ver 30 years.  I have tried and used so many different slides.  I started using these back in in 2001.  I tried them fist on my own built-in in my own home.  Last thing I needed was a a component failure in a clients home.  These are still working just fine and get used every day.  One set of drawers in the unit each hold 300 CD's in cases.  If I had to guess a conservative guess, that's probably about 50 pounds, plus the drawer and dividers themselves, adding maybe another 15 pounds.  They work just fine.  All of the wiring for the entertainment system is hidden behind the unit.  Every once in a while I have to remove the drawers to access the wires.  I have done that maybe a dozen or so times in the ten years the unit's been there.  Again, no problem.  Even without emptying the drawers.They are installed in my kitchen as well for the pots and pans pull-outs.  Still working just fine.  They are now in countless homes and I have not had on customer complaint ever.  I have long since stopped buying the $15, 20, 30 slides.
summary: These are as good as a more expensive slide.

reviewText: I'm really at 4.5 stars for this light - the reason is that the body of the light is a little odd for mounting. Other than that it's a solid, VERY bright LED light. I know some are not happy with the 3-hour run-time. I feel that if you want the extra 40 lumens for a weapon mounted light, or simply for dazzling it's certainly worth it. This light lasts three times longer than an incandescent of the same brightness!Easy to use, very much like the tailcap switch. Press for momentary on - click for steady on - a definite improvement over my Surefire G2s.Certainly recommended for all uses - bright, compact, solid!

They do not put out as much light as the halogen bulbs, but the light quality seems to be better and the brightness is acceptable.  These also don't get anywhere near as hot as the halogen bulbs. States that it was easy to get her pulse while running shorter distances; however when doing the marathon and her fingers started swelling she was unable to get her heart rate.The display is easy to read even when moving.The heart rate monitor can be turned of when not working out.Over nice watch though a bit on the bulky side.

reviewText: Overall, this flashlight is good, though I expected a higher quality product for the price.ProsVery brightGood weightVariety of modesEasy to switch between modesNice looking flashlightConsThe construction seems cheaper then I expected for this priceBatteries drain quicklyPriceIf you are looking for a bright flashlight with plenty of modes, this is a good buy. This TaoTronics Elune TT-DL01 Dimmable LED Desk Lamp is a very effective and powerful lamp. The LEDs can be adjusted easily with the touch buttons and are very easy to control. Installed this LED light on my brand new DW718 miter saw before even cutting a board. For such a simple concept this LED miter saw light is fantastic. Best money I have ever spent and so easy to install. Like previous reviews I can't find fault with anything on this miter saw must have. This is a great product.  I use it in my shop because I can narrow the beam to a very small area for looking into things such as engines.

TCP LED light bulbs are great performers on a number of fronts.  They turn on instantly and immediately reach full brightness, no matter what the temperature.  The bulbs are quite bright but use very little power.  The color temperature is a pleasing warm color with no hint of blue and no discernable flicker.  They provide an even light distribution to the side of the bulb which makes them usable in shaded light fixtures (you don't get a stark line of light and dark like you do with some LED bulbs that only shine in one direction).These bulbs very closely mimic the shape of a classic incandescent light bulb ("A19").  If it matters  to you, they are probably the most lightweight LED bulb that I've used.There are 6 bulbs in this package.The price on these is pretty great as of the time of this writing (7/14).  The bulbs are rated to last more than 22 years but the warranty is only for three.So far I'm loving these and wouldn't think twice about getting more.

I bought this four-way key so I would be sure and get the right size for my faucet.  I figured that between the four of them, one size would have to fit.  I was wrong.  The two small sizes are too small, and the two large sizes are too large.  You'd think American plumbing would be pretty standardized by now, but apparently it isn't.  It's too late to return the item, so I'll just write it off as a bad buy.  But quite honestly, I don't know what I would have done differently.  I don't have a clue as to how to measure the size of my faucet.  So I guess it will be just me and my pliers from here on out!  (P.S. -- I gave the product three stars because I assume the manufacturer made it properly.  I just made a mistake by believing that a four-way key would fit pretty much any standard domestic faucet.)
summary: Four Sizes, and All of Them Are Wrong!

reviewText: If you are used to using a bidet at home you'll be a little disappointed with this one.  It's not as efficient because the spray is not as intent as your home model.  Also, it seems that $17.00 is a bit pricey for nothing more than a plastic spray bottle from Japan.  Just buy a squeeze bottle at Walmart---you'll have the same thing & you'll save a few bucks.
Clip comes in handy and the cranks have held up to kids using them to keep the boogeyman away for over 6 months.
