reviewText: the directions for assembly are a bit hard going, but once you realize the set-up it becomes more straightforward.  Make certain the screws that hold the template against the circular saw are firmly holding or it will slip during the vibration of turning it on in mid-cut!  I've used this piece to quickly and accurately cut on the right and the left of large 4'x8' sections with great results - it's cheap buy, but it does the job with quick set-up and accurate cutting.

Product surpasses all expectations! Works well, puts out an amazing amount of light, controls are accessible and accurate.Can't ask for a better security floodlight. Worked well on the very first night!

reviewerName: Roger A. Knopf "makes sawdust in spare time"
reviewText: I have been using Kreg jigs for many years now, and have this item's predecessor.  While I could not live without it, a few things always bugged me - and they all got fixed in this version.  It was enough that purchasing it was a no-brainer.The biggest improvement is the built-in offset lip with markings for all typical lumber sizes.  In the old one I had to actually screw the lip that is used to align to the edge of the board on using two screws - and if I was using 2x material, add a spacer using different size screws - and if I was using anything else I had to measure and line it up manually.  Good if I was doing a lot of boards, but a real pain for one or two and worse if I was switching back and forth!  With this new model, just press in on the tab and slide the gray guide forward until it snaps into place at the mark for the size board I am using.Second, with the lip in place, the Kreg clamp I was using was trapped in the jig and if I wanted to use it for something else, or just put it away, I had to unscrew the lip.  Done away with in the new model, there is a spot sized for the clamp that is proud of the jig.  Very easy.Third, this comes in a nice little case that holds everything but the clamp.  My other was part of a set of Kreg jigs so when I wanted to throw it into the toolbag to go to a work site, I had to put all the parts in, and some would eventually go missing.  Now I can put the case into the toolbag, very handy.Fourth, the jig from the old set that showed where to set the drill stop required me to lift the drill out of it in order to get the stop on, and of course it would sometimes slip when I tightened it so I have to recheck and sometimes adjust.  Honestly it was such a pain that I got an extra bit and stop just so I could leave one set for 3/4" material and one for 2x material.  In the new model the jig is part of the case AND holds the bit at each end, leaving space for the stop so I can tighten it without moving the bit.Clearly Kreg is listening to their customers and making very handy and sensible improvements while maintaining their high quality.  Like I said, buying this one even though the old one still works was a no-brainer.  Now I'll just set up the old one for 2x material and leave it.
It carries a D cell flashlight well. What more can be said.

Installing this device may require an electrician because the hookup is inside the electrical panel. Having just installed this device, I'm really impressed by the quality and capability of this instrument. Unlike some of the other energy monitors with which you must plug an appliance into individually, this one monitors the entire house. It even has software available that plots usage in many different formats on your computer. The price is very reasonable for what it does.I put this in a place often frequented and it's a great reminder to turn off devices when I notice the power I'm using is getting a little high. For instance I have a 6000 watt heater in my garage and this tells me when I've inadvertently left it on.
summary: Surprised there aren't more of these available...

reviewText: I was expecting a more rapid flicker, but the glow only moves about every 1-4 seconds.  Still, it looks cool.
summary: Not as much flicker as I'd like, but still a nice effect

reviewText: For cutting plywood too large for a tablesaw and with a good straight edge for running the guide fence there is no better tool. I used various kinds of long clamps, both homemade and manufactured, for years to cut plywood strips. The set up time with clamps is long to get any accuracy. It's also easy to set a clamped fence on the wrong side of the pencil line getting a piece that is either too wide or too narrow. Another problem with clamped fences. Is the fact that the built in circular saw guides are at different widths from the saw blade, depending on whether cutting from the left or the right side. I use the Kreg rip cut tool to make reliably accurate slices from horizontal sheet goods that rest on a homemade portable box frame table. Set up for different blades and widths is very fast. By keeping a dedicated saw attached to the Kreg tool I'm able to cut different widths in seconds. The only design flaw I noticed is the length of the fence. It should be two or three inches longer to keep the fence firmly against the cut off piece as the saw exits the cut. I fixed a straight piece of wood to the plastic guide fence to extend its length.

I'm no contractor, but I knew I wanted something better than the one-piece plastic miter box I had. I was able to pick this up at Lowes for $35. I then proceeded to use it to cut moldings for a couple of rooms in my house. I found this device to work perfectly. I was even able to use my left hand forefinger to support the blade guide a slight amount and get as smooth and light a saw cut as I wanted. Within a short time I was making smooth accurate cuts, better cuts than I have ever gotten with a simple box and back saw.Cosmetically, the aluminum base casting has some cracks it but it seems perfectly strong enough. It cuts accurately, and has a number of preset angles which it can cut. Degrees are clearly marked for you to identify any angle you wish (not sure if it clamps at those angles though).Some of the other reviewers seem to be contractors or something. I think this is a fine value for people who don't want to spend $100+ on the professional grade models.

Finally, a quality set, while unfortunately it is made in china, it is very high quality. even the super fine bits fit well. I purchased this originally so I could get a torx bit small enough for my buck vantage knife, but after messing with it I plan on buying at least 2 more, because I know I will lose some bits at some point in time. and for the price, why not? I love the case too, when you click the open button the bits swivel into an up facing position, it is kind of fun for me to just open and close it watching the bits move. I know, goofy but it is fun. overall, buy one, or three, it is a great deal.

Bought this to refinish the wood floors in my house.  Obviously, you can't refinish the whole floor with this, so I used it all around the edges and rented a floor sander to do the majority of the square footage.  The dust filter really works!

I got this in Dec 08 and, at the time, the Amazon Prime shipping was available.  It isn't now, I'm not sure why.  Perhaps Princeton has a newer version out.THE REVIEW:There are a lot of cheaper headlamps you can pick up at a lowes or home depot and get a good solid value for.  However, if you step up to the 30 plus dollar range (the price I paid), you step into another world of product.  Paying the extra you will get a concrete and noticeable difference in quality in and brightness.This light has 50 lumens at max brightness, 3 brightness levels, is waterproof, and just holding it, you can tell the quality of the product.  You simply don't get near this with a cheaper headlamp (I know, I own a few).  When you are in great need for a flash light, it is well worth it to have a solid, well made and brighter product in hand (or rather, on your head in this case).This particular light is also recommended by a number of folks at "candlepowerforums", a website of people obsessed with flash lights of all kinds.I've already made use of this for some soldering work and digging in a dark basement work... I am very pleased with this light.

This item does just what is says it will. It enables you to use Imperial blades with your porter-cable multi-tool. The imperial storm blades are much tougher than porter-cable and you can cut through a deck screw without destroying the blade.

This is my second TI035 Timer, and it works as it should.  Easy to install, and setup.  I picked this model, because I wanted to use CF bulbs, in an outside post light.  The timer is in my attached garage, and in the Detroit area, it gets well below the manufacture's temp range.  I installed it in the shared wall, between the house and garage.  So far, so good.

These are made in Czech Republic which is probably better than most Taiwan>China tools we see a lot of nowadays. I'm a firm believer of hand tools must be of high quality.I've seen many bit sets and they are mostly cheap sets from your major retailer. This is the first bit set where I can feel and see quality. This is a must have set for an on-the-go DIY'er. It was a great addition to my car's tool bag.Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase.

A nice low cost small and light plug adapter. Worked perfectly converting my US plugs so I could use an Australia (or New Zealand) outlet. NOTE: This is a plug adapter ONLY,,,it does NOT convert power from 220 to 110. Having said this, all of my small electronics (shaver, iPad, laptop, etc.) accept 120-240 volts, so it was perfect for my needs.
For the unbeatable price and it size, the ratcheting mechanism is well above standards from what I expected. I keep this in my pocket as I work on Aircraft panels throughout my work shift.

This is quite a bright light for such a little fellow.  Definitely a handy item to attach to one's key chain,, and can even be used to find something lost on the ground, or to find one's way in a dark room.  It is possible for the light to unscrew and the batteries to fall out in one's pocket.  However, the tightness of screwing it on and off helps to alivaite this potentionial problem.  Also, I check it once in a while and thus far, it has held perfectly with the testing of it by screwing to turn it on and then off being unnecessary;  However, I like to make sure. LOL.
These are some nice clamps. Like someone else has noted, don't mistake these for clamps that pull corners together. These merely hold them in alignment. For that purpose you can't beat them.

These Bondhus balldriver wrenches have been familiar to me for maybe 30 years now.  Through normal attrition, I recently found myself missing common sizes in my tool set.  I went to the orange big box to acquire replacements, but only found store-brand wrenches.  Being desperate, I bought them.  Bad move!  The quality isn't there.  The drivers didn't properly fit the screw sockets, in some cases having to be driven in with a hammer.So I bought this combination metric/imperial set from Amazon.  Some things don't change.  Bondhus still makes excellent tools.  They have an excellent rust-resistant finish.  They fit the screw sockets perfectly.  The ball ends allow socket entry from an angle.  The steel is extremely resistant to abuse (go ahead - use that cheater bar).And finally, at $18, this is a steal.  The big box wrenches are a couple bucks less, but are nowhere near this quality.  I think you will be pleased.
These are high quality and will bend instead of crack.  Works great and would buy again.  Don't waste time on bad tools.

I have so many allen wrenches with a ton of multiples, and my old sets were each missing one or two sizes.  I was getting tired of searching through a pile of wrenches only to realize after a minute that at 50 I could not longer read the sizes on the side of most the them.  The sizes on the plastic holders are easy to read... now I just have to make sure I put them back each time.

After falling in love (again) with my full-size Stanley ratcheting screwdriver (see my other reviews), I felt that I needed a slightly smaller one in my tool chest for those harder to access areas. The choice to go with Stanley again was hardly a choice at all. This little guy performs just like its FatMax big brother...only much smaller. Ratcheting mechanism is flawless and the whole thing fits perfectly in my hand. Love that in-handle bit storage, too. At this price you just can't miss on this item.
summary: Huge ratcheting power in a tiny package

reviewText: This flash light throws more light than any of the smaller LED flash lights that I have. Now that we have these flash lights, my wife won't use anything else. They do burn through batteries a little quicker than the smaller model, but they put out triple the light.
summary: Very bright LED based flash light.

reviewText: This product arrived on-time and undamaged, but the beam focus does NOT work at all.  Also, the light is not very bright.  A couple of positive notes:  the product was sent in an adequate size box and it was sent WITH batteries.  But for the product itself, there are better choices.  Also, there is a 'chemical' smell to the flashlight.  Not sure what that might be from, since the flashlight is metal; maybe it is from the paint finish.
summary: It works, but not that great

reviewText: I've owned several cordless drills in the past; Hitachi, Panasonic, Milwaukee, and others, but never an impact driver.  What a difference!  If you drive wood screws much at all this is the tool of choice.  Light, well balanced and powerful.  The impact action keeps the bit from camming out the driver or the screw head and it's easy to sink 6" screws into wood without a pilot hole.  I bought a set of drill bits to use with this chuck and the instant bit changes are wonderful.  I've also used it as a mechanic's tool, which works pretty good, but it is too bulky to get into a lot of spots.  A good selection of extensions and universals is most helpful here.  The Li-ion battery is worth the extra money as it's light and powerful and quick to charge.  Just don't let them run down all the way; the instructions say to change them out as soon as you notice a drop in power which is different than the old Ni-cads.  Well worth the money, especially if you get the CPO deal like I did.  (Pre-owned, factory reconditioned.)

The price of this faucet is worth it. Amazon offers this cheaper than comparable faucets from big name stores. Installation is easier than removing the Delta faucet it replaced. Looks nice with an elegant quality that matches our sink and kitchen appliance. Now we have more room to wash not only our plates but also the massive pots used for cooking. Handle can be a bit  small compared with other faucets but no complains here. The sprayhead has 2 buttons, one to pause water and the other button to select between the drip or spray modes. Unlike other faucets, this doesn't go back to the drip mode after stopping the water. It maintains your current setting unless you change it again. No idea on the durability yet as I just installed them a few days ago. For now, we really love this faucet.

My A/C has not worked for years.  I though the Freon was gone from compressor/condenser.  We just used the current thermostat for the heater, however, my wife felt that the old thermostat was no longer working correctly reading the temperature and therefore, possibly using up too much gas.  So just to make her feel better, I bought this manual thermostat, because we have so many settings and can never find how to properly adjust it, that we are constantly having to override the settings.  Once I installed it, which only took about 25-minutes, we discovered that this bad thermostat was also the culprit that kept the A/C from working.  So guess what, the A/C now works too.  Can't believe I did not suspect the thermostat.

Have used mine for years now. Minimal maintenance. This guy can take a lick too. I've dropped it a couple times, picked it up and went back to work. Great for fencing and indoor framing without a need for a compressor. Still using the original battery. Even though the housing is plastic; This is not a toy...

This may be a bold statement but I read all the reviews and not one reviewer noted the real reason why someone should buy Li-Ion batteries...for any tool. It is SHELF LIFE. The only reason I see to buy these is to put the tool away for a year and still have it work when you need it.  Otherwise don't spend the money..you can buy two packs for the price of one Li pack so why buy it.  I like using a pro tool but I do not use it often.  My two standard pacs lasted 5 years but I only used them once a year...they only lasted 5 charges!!!  I use corded tools most of the time but once in a while I need cordless.  I want it to work when I need it and not require charging...I also do not want to buy new battery packs unless they have been used for their normal life charge re/charge.One more thing about LI-ION packs that apply to anything like cell phones and laptops.  Want to shorten their life...leave them in the charger.  Cell phone batteries last long because they charge overnight and get used all day OUT OF THE CHARGER. Also, if you are not using a LI-ION device and plan to leave it on the shelf DO NOT STORE THEM FULLY CHARGED AND STORE THEM IN A COOL PLACE OUT OF THE DEVICE.  They might last 10 years that way.  I do not know why chargers are not smart enough to discharge a LI-ION battery if left in a charger more than overnight to 60% but I suspect that would anger most people who would not understand why.  Every battery technology has it's place and there is no one that is best for everything.Don't buy LI batteries for anything you use daily and then not use for a few days...stick with NiMH.  Got a laptop but use it mostly plugged in?  Get the battery out of it after running it halfway down.  Ever wonder why laptop battery run time gets so short and they only last 6 months before they last only 30min?  It is because they are in the laptop charging all the time.Hope this helps some of you in your decision.%
summary: What all the other commenters are missing....the reason for Li-Ion

reviewerName: Hobbyist "Chemistry for fun, Computers for mo...
reviewText: This was so cheap that I could finally get a second charger to handle Lithium batteries, at the price of the chargers for NiCd.

Not a lot to say, it's a strong piece of metal that breaks things. Does what it says on the tin. Mine was yellow too, I rather liked it even if the paint does come off easily.At this price though (~$15), I felt it was a fantastic deal, and I can't really find anything to complain about so that's all the stars.

I can't say enough about how great this Sawzall feels and the low vibration ....a real quick blade change system designed for guys who use these tools all day.....nice balance and plenty of power...blows away my Dewalt which died after only 2 years.....(don't buy Dewalt).....highly reccomend this Saw...!!....Makita also offers really great deals on their Combo Kits.

Not anywhere near as powerful or accurate as bigger more expensive saws. However, it is fantastic if you just need something for a small job and rental is a hassle you want to avoid. Kind of like harbor freight tools, get it for one job and every job it completes after that is just gravy. Mine tackled the bathroom remodel beautifully except for the occasional bog down on the blade and I think it will last through a kitchen remodel. At least I hope it will.The only real con is the fence is aggravating, but to be expected for the price.
Drill is ok, the batteries are the standard 18 v , a good value for what I paid for it,
i have 3 of these and totally love them! the batteries last a long time and the drill is pretty powerful as well.definitely recommended for the price!

reviewText: I was pleased with the outdoor range of this laser.  It performed accurately right out of the box.  I would give it five stars but haven't had enough time with it yet.
my mistake for buying into the dremal hype. this was not a heavy duty tool. the bit broke in the first 15 mins i had it.
It's a piece of plastic.  How can you review a piece of plastic.  It does what it is suppose to do.

I keep this on my person at all times when gardening and landscaping, and even in my workshop where I house my killer set of tools I turn to this regularly.  I received one as a groomsman's gift and then accidentally buried it, never to be found, during a landscaping project.  I bought myself another as my other multi-tools all shared the same failing: you had to open the tool to get the knife blade out.  That is crucial, because you use the knife blade the most and the pliers second most, and with this one you can access the blade without opening the tool--and the pliers are automatically at your disposal when you open the tool.  SO convenient.  Makes a great gift also.
There are times when I need a bigger soldering iron to do some heavier soldering, and this big boy does a great job.  It gets hot enough to handle the toughest jobs without any problems.

LIKE ANY "OLD-SCHOOL," TESTOSTERONE-DRIVEN, ALPHA-MALE WHO IDENTIFIES WITH CHARACTERS LIKE "TIM, 'THE TOOL-MAN,' TAYLOR (TOOL-TIME), I JUST HAD TO HAVE THESE "RUGGED" BLAST-GATES IN MY DUST-COLLECTION SYSTEM.... AND I DO.HOWEVER, I AM ALSO AN "OLD-SCHOOL TIGHTWAD" AND COULD NOT AFFORD TO OUTFIT MY ENTIRE SYSTEM WITH THESE "HEAVY DUTY' BLAST GATES.SO.... I WAS "FORCED" TO ALSO PURCHASE THE "PLASTIC" BLAST-GATES TO SAVE MONEYJet JW1007 4-Inch BlastgateAS THESE PLASTIC GATES ARE NEARLY 1/3 THE COST OF THE ALUMINUM GATES.I INCORPORATED THEM INTO MY SYSTEM OUT OF NECESSITY, AS A TEMPORARY "FIX," UNTIL I COULD AFFORD TO REPLACE THEM. MY INTENTION WAS TO REPLACE THEM WITH THE "MANLY-BLAST-GATES" AS SOON AS FINANCES PERMITTED.FOR MY APPLICATION, THE ALUMINUM BLAST-GATES ARE TERRIBLE AND THE PLASTIC BLAST-GATES ARE FANTASTIC.MOST OF MY "DUST" IS METAL-SHAVINGS AND GLASS-BEAD. THE ALUMINUM GATES ARE VERY HARD TO OPEN AND CLOSE, AS THE GATE DOES NOT WANT TO "GLIDE" IN ITS TRACK (PROBABLY DUE TO DUST "JAMMING" THE SPACE BETWEEN THE GATE AND THE RAILS).THE PLASTIC BLAST-GATES GLIDE EFFORTLESSLY AND DO NOT SEEM TO BE AFFECTED BY "MY DUST" AT ALL.***THIS HARSH REVIEW "MAY NOT APPLY" IF YOU ARE EXCLUSIVELY CREATING WOOD-DUST IN A WOOD-SHOP*** I WOULD RECOMMEND CHECKING OTHER REVIEWS FROM WOOD-SHOP DUST-COLLECTION SYSTEMS.I AM NOW PREPARING TO SWITCH OUT THE ALUMINUM BLAST-GATES WITH THE PLASTIC GATES. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE PLASTIC BLAST-GATESJet JW1007 4-Inch Blastgate. I HAVE HAD THEM NOW FOR ABOUT A YEAR. THEY WORK SMOOTHLY AND ARE JUST AS RUGGED AS THE ALUMINUM GATES. I HAVE HAD NO BREAKAGE OR MALFUNCTION AND THE GATES WORK VERY WELL WITH A GOOD SEAL.

The rating I'm giving has really nothing to do with the function/utility of this mount. I'm  rating  it as 2 star based on the fact that 2 times this item was delivered with the foot of the pole broken. I returned it a second time and did not order  a new on.  I think the pole feet may be to fragile.
I have used different brands and this is by far the best shelf drilling jig ever, built in drill bushings guarantee a good clean hole every time.

I first thought this was a bit of an expensive, frivolous tool. Then I watched the instructional video and I was sold when they stripped the shielding off of romex with a single click. This seems like a fairly well made tool, better than the old one my dad used to have. It doesn't always work however, unlike the video. Sometimes I have to click it over a wire a couple of time to get it to grab, and sometimes it strips only part. I find it works a little better with the wire bent and curved "down" a bit. There are no real instructions, which isn't really an issue, but I still have no idea how the little "tension" knob is supposed to work as it doesn't appear to make any difference when adjusted.Overall, if you do a lot of wire stripping this can be a very useful tool. I am currently rewiring my entire home from knob-and-tube to completely up to code, so this wire stripper has been a great help. If you only have an occasional wiring job, however, these may be frustrating enough to stick with a more basic stripper instead.
The only problem I've had is getting the blades out of the dispenser. You have to be careful or like me your going to cut yourself. Other than that they are sharp and handy to take along.

Great tool!  Great EDC addition!  I carry this thing daily without being totally distracted by weight or size (like carrying the larger versions).  Has all the tools that I use on a daily basis and is very durable.  I recommend this tool to everyone, you need one of these!

It's pipe...seriously what is there to know.  You're a woodworker and you need flex tubing its great stuff.  Be REALLY careful around the ends where the wire pokes out as I opened up my hand pretty good grabbing the exposed pointy wire while swapping the hose from the table saw to the jointer.  Otherwise, its good and does the job.
summary: Good stuff, just watch the ends for pointy ouch time

reviewText: I gave my complete prior Lansky sharpener set to a friend in the Venezuela jungles and got the new diamond set for me.  What a big difference this set is over the old stones.  Sharpens my blades very fast and I'm delighted with it. I highly recommend it.
summary: The BEST sharpener I've ever owned

reviewText: I've tried more than a few multi-tools.  Leatherman's tools are generally of superior quality, but most of the models seem too big for my pocket.  I did try the "Squirt", but that's too tiny.  I find the Juice to be the right compromise between pocket-ability and actual usefulness.  (I've satisfied my desire for the Swiss Army Knives' toothpick & tweezer by adding a small SAK ("Jetsetter") on my key chain, with the Juice in my other pocket.  So equipped, I'm ready for most anything!)The Juice pliers are a bit uncomfortable to use as delivered.  I've added adhesive rubbery non-skid material to the outside surfaces to soften the edges while enhancing the grip.  (Leatherman: are you paying attention?)
summary: Finally -- exactly what I was looking for!

reviewText: I recently replaced the water closet components in my older Kohler toilet with the MJSI HYR-460 rebuild kit. I experienced several adjustment problems during installation to insure that the water level in the closet was adequate to complete the #1 and #2 flushes. I emailed Colleen Schuster at MJSI and received detailed instructions by email to solve all flush problems ASAP. Number 1 flush still requires a longer push period but works great along with #2. I am purchasing several additional units for all my water closets and would recommend calling or emailing Colleen if you need help with any or all adjustments. My first installation has been in service for over two months and is working with one flush per use. The second unit is also functioning well, Colleen Schuster also provided a conventional appearing flush handle and a small instruction placard card for my bathroom so guests know how to use the units. Colleen Schuster has been a great resource to go along with a great product.
summary: Nothing but the finest Toilet Rebuild Kit

reviewText: This battery really has some balls.  Time will tell whether it will last . Its still to new to tell about its longevity

I just spent half a day sanding drywall with this thing, and I have to say, it delivered as promised.  I understand what others are saying, it doesn't look like you're getting much for your half a C-note, but what are the alternatives?  The hose looks cheap, but it is very flexible and sprung back when I invariably stepped on it.  It's kind of noisy, but I'd rather wear ear muffs than get covered in dust all day.  And I'm sure it must be better for your shop vac than sucking dust directly all day.If I were a professional mudder, I'm sure I would go for the three- or four hundred dollar set up, but for the once-in a whiler, this is about right.  The bottom line is I got more done in less time (spent less time choking on dust) and clean up was about 10 percent of what it is when the dust is allowed to run free.  You still have to supply the muscle, but at least you're less disgusted when your done (though still tired).
I didn't realize just how dull my old jab saw was until this arrived.  This made in ceiling speaker installation so much easier.  Couldn't be happier.

I have a set of these saw horses and find them very handy.  They are super light weight and easy to set up.  I kept a hollow core closet door so I can set-up a decent work area in a couple of minutes.  These are excellent compared to the miserable B&D Workmate stands that always leave me cursing because the stupid foot pads that keep falling off (and the effort it requires to set them up)
these glasses are very comfortable and really nice to use in bright light conditions. the bi-focal does not bother sight in normal conditions

I wanted 1 decora in the middle, but couldn't find it, so got this, but returned when I found what I wanted at local hardware store.  The return was worth less than shipping, so I was instructed to keep this.  Thanks for great service.

I have had this drill for awhile now and the only downside of this drill is the chuck. I don't know if it's the one I got but other drills that I have used have not had an issues. It would release the bit when I stopped or in reverse, so it is frustrating when you need to back up. Battery charge time is short and it also doesn't hold the charge as long as a regular battery. It is lighter then a regular battery.

I have used these jaws considerably and have enjoyed them, but the one screw connection is a bit weak. A screw snapped a few days ago without much pressure being applied in tightenting down on a piece that I was working on. 2 screws would be much nicer but for what they do I have enjoyed using them and will continue to do so.

I use this corner tool rack for storage of brooms, mops, Swiffers and other cleaning tools as well as shovels, rakes and other outdoor gardening tools.  It holds allot and my only complaint is that it's assembly requires nothing to hold it together....the pieces only slide into each other.....and it's difficult to move if you decide you'd rather have it in another space.  Everything must be taken out if you want to move it.

This is an excellent driver if you find yourself in tight spots, well not you but, your hand and you are trying to turn a nut or screw. Example, a few lifetimes ago, I installed upgraded radios to replace OE units. Back in that day no thought was given or provision made for anyone to replace it or take it out for repair. We ground tools down and otherwise modified things to work. And the car makers just realized this and now started making special tools.This was late sixties , today they make tools to fit the part.Today most often I am working on all kinds of things and having a very short stubby with a good grip is great let alone one with nut drivers. This is the smallest stubby I have found and having something like this can make a job and the day, go smooth.When I see this hanging on my workbench pegboard I think , once again Klein has does something  to make our jobs and lives easier. This is 30% or a little more, smaller than Crescent or Craftsman flat or phillip drivers. I think I have seen a small stubby in the Wera line as well.
summary: I bought this for Klein quality, but mostly for it's size ...

reviewText: I have owned Gerber products for many decades, and after my Multi-Plier was stolen from my truck on Thanksgiving morning, I wanted to replace it.Though I didn't want to believe it, every other negative review seems to be correct. I don't fault Gerber (now a subdivision of Fiskars) for the black coating coming off on my hands - it happens, but it didn't bother me. But if Gerber is going to use the word 'legendary' to describe their knives, the blade had better worth the moniker.It wasn't.True to others' experience, the edge on the blade on my Multi-Plier was stamped instead of ground. Dull right out of the box, the serrations were ready to break off under the slightest stress.I ordered the additional bits to go with this tool, and while the magnet in the adapter held the bits well enough, the adapter would not stay on the Multi-Plier! If all your work will be overhead with this tool, maybe it's the right one for you, but the moment you dip that adapter and bit below horizontal, it will slide off.I sent this sucker back and got the Leatherman Charge TTi Titanium instead.

I like this High Beam Flashlight compared to my Maglite,same powered by 2AA battery but this one is better.PROS:-Its 5.5in.H, good grip, nice metal grade-White bright lite compare to yellow-Looks like high price tactical flashlight-Only powered by 2 double A batteries-Strap and belt clip included and a nylon belt caseCons: No black color and the strap ring is not well fittedDurability and batt.life still a question...

I put these bulbs in a manually switched on and off night light. The lights did not work in my photocell night lights.  I am very happy with the brightness, light color, and the minimal use of electricity.  I have these in several rooms in the house.  I can walk from room to room at night without turning on the lights.  I suspect that if I avoid turning on the regular lights in one room for a couple of minutes a few times per week, then these bulbs will pay for themselves.

What a great tool!  Fits snug in it's sheath, which has loops for either placing on a belt, or with a molle unit - the top velcro holds well, but would not trust securing to a molle system on the outside of a pack.  I wouldn't want to lose this puppy!  The needlepliers/wire cutter slides out of the handles and locks firmly into place - releases with touch of button and slide into handles. Multiple size screwdriver heads; saw and knife/saw combo are VERY sharp and seem like it will cut several inch thick branches with minimal effort. Scissors are small, sharp - what you would expect from a multi-tool scissor - you won't be able to cut anything large with them, but fine for the smaller scissor needs. LOVE the file on this tool! Will help to file down any sharp edges on metal, etc. when out and about. Got this for my BOB, but got a Maxpedition Fatty Pocket organizer pack, and it fits PERFECT in it's sheath in a sleave of the pack, so will be great to carry assortments of tools that will be easily at my disposal! VERY pleased! Also, the black coating does not rub off - very good quality and worth the cost.
summary: Diesel is Perfect for my needs!

reviewText: This pack of soap stones was great for me.  I don't use them very often, so this will last a lifetime if they don't become too brittle in old age.  The dispenser is okay, though the stones slip in it some.  They write on metal, plastic, rubber, etc. which is handy.  The best for cutting and welding metal.

I purchased the 950 as a second 18V Dewalt cordless to support my work in homebuilding/remodeling and furniture making. I already have another 18V Dewalt and this gave me the added hammer drive feature plus a second drill/driver. I have had the older one for some 6 years. It is a work horse although a bit heavy when you use it for extended periods especially overhead. The new 950 is a work horse as well and is made a bit sturdier with the metal drive train. It too is heavy. Neither drill/driver disappoints in terms of power. I have 4 batteries and only the non XRP batteries wane in heavy use. By the way I just learned that I can use the new Lithium batteries with either drill driver. I think this is a great design consideration on the part of Dewalt! Certainly this will lighten the unit in use. I will have to wait and see regarding balance when I purchase the Li ION batteries.The 950 has one LED to light the way and it is a handy feature but I do notice that in some areas the shadow the head casts makes the light somewhat less effective.I had an unpleasant experience with the first 950 I ordered. I was using it to install a storm door, i.e. light duty.I had freshly charged batteries and within just a few screw installs it would not operate upon trigger actuation. The LED would light but the drill motor did not turn in the low speed setting. I found that switching to the second or third speed setting would allow normal operation, even if I switched back to the lowest speed. Needless to say I sent it back. A new one arrived very quickly and seems to be OK although I did experience the same event once more (one time).So why did I rate this as a 4 star you say? Primarily because it is a workhorse and I expect it to hold up as my other unit does. I find the hammer drill feature to be the answer to driving deck lags and drilling into concrete for TapCons. I also like the fact that I can swap in/out Li ION batteries and finally the price was right.
This little device was purchased to work on guns bows and eyeglasses works great.  I like the idea that all the different tips fit right in the hollow handle to keep everything together.

This unit is, in one word, amazing.  We can now look at our phones and tell if the doors are up or down.  We can also use the app to open or close the garage doors from anywhere.  For those of you who are looking, the coolest safety feature is built in.  If you close your door remotely, the opener flashes lights and sounds an alarm to let those nearby know that the door is coming down.

OTC makes great tools. This adapter is no different. A high quality item, this piece does exactly what it was intened to do. Had to utilize this tool to change the tranny fluid on my 02 exploder. No other way to do it, this part is a must (impossible without it). Great price, fast shipping.
Works as expected. Its a level what more would you expect. Package was perfect and color is light pink.Highly recommend it.
A really great level that seems very accurate thus far. Perfect addition to any tool kit. I am very happy with this purchase.

Lightweight, powerful and indispensable. I have about 12 Dewalt 18 volt tools.  After buying the impact driver, it is now my favorite. You won't be using your much heavier 1/2 inch drill nearly as much.  The tool does smell a little when new as others have stated but it goes away.  Assume it is just part of break in.  I have now built multiple decks with it and many other projects.  I don't know how I got along without it.  Recommend getting the 3 piece extension socket set to make it even more valuable tool.You won't be sorry.  .

I use this as much as I can because I hate to switch wrenches and re-adjust alot. I work with gear that can use 4 sizes of nuts/bolts on a single small assembly. Only problems are that this is not as strong, of course, as a single mold combo wrench and it does not go into the tight areas that my most expensive equipment has a lot of. It is great for my standard maintenance on manual equipment and panels.
summary: Not perfect, but very quick and useful.

reviewText: I use this impact driver not only for running in screws, etc. on wood working projects, but also for light duty disassembling of old farm machinery I am working on.  It has a surprising amount of torque for this purpose in addition to driving in screws and bolts.
summary: sure makes a lot of jobs easier.

reviewText: The sole advantage of this adjustable open end wrench is the convenience of a button instead of rotating a traditional mechanism. It makes things quicker, but you need to rely on a battery and it doesn't tighten snugly with the press of a button. You can adjust things the rest of the way by hand, but there goes the advantage of a single handed adjustment from the handle.A better alternative is a quick adjustable wrench with a slide mechanism. Although I haven't used theCrescent Rapid Slide Adjustable Wrenchor theKobalt Quick Adjustable Wrench, there are a number of wrenches that are virtually identical to the Kobalt but with different brand names and colors, and they do what the Black and Decker was hoping to do. They allow you adjust the size of the wrench quickly and smoothly, position it snugly with the push of a finger, and get all the torque you would get with a traditional adjustable open end wrench. The one I have has a different brand name, but it far superior to the B&D; in function and execution.The Black and Decker wrench works, but it's more of a gimmick than a valuable addition to your tool chest.

No-frills drill. Features keyless chuck, which is great if you need to frequently swap bits, but occasionally the bit will spin. The bit holder location is poor because you end up stabbing yourself repeatedly. I ended up removing the bit.

Great driver, but not an impact wrench.  This is a great impact driver.  It has a nice little light on the front so you can see what you are doing and it comes with a phillips head that snaps onto the base.It is NOT an impact wrench.  It will not remove lug bolts from your car.  Expect it to tighten to around 60 Lb-ft of torque.
summary: Great impact driver (for screws), not an impact wrench (for auto lug nuts)

reviewText: The first heater lasted a year.  The power switch died as an open.  The element itself is OK.While it worked, it was ideal for keeping feet warm sitting at a desk.Eventually, I will find a replacement switch, but the utility of the heater is so great that I am ordering a replacement.
summary: Does what is expected - for a while

reviewText: Nice product.  I like how the belt is flexable and glides over the steel of a knife.  I also used it to sharpen my lawnmower blade.  I really liked that.  I was tired of the stones of knife sharpening.  This has a guide also for the knife that makes the pull of the knife easier than a stone pull. Come time to take the belt of is no problem, takes 4 seconds. Very Easy.  It just feels natural to sharpen the knife with this product. I sharpened the wife's kitchen knives, sissors and my super small pocket knife. They are really sharp.  With an electric stone sharpener, you can't see the stone against the knife whereas you can see the belt flex againt the blade of the knife with this product.  I don't know how long the belts last. It's a keeper.
You won't be dissappointed with this circular saw! This product is very well made and worthy of the Dewalt name. I just complerted a project using this saw and was very impressed.

The safe seems to be well constructed and opens and closes easily. It is heavy enough so that a person would not pick it up easily and run out the door with it. I feel it is a very good alternative to renting a bank lock box.

This is going to be a short one from me.  Why?  Because there is much better feedback at the Candle Power Forums.  Just do a search including the model of the light and be prepared to be overwhelmed by how geeky flashlight enthusiasts can be :-)
summary: Great light at a very fair price.

reviewText: I have the visible light version of this light and love it.  When i needed a light for night vision and hunting hogs i went with this and don't regret it.  Looks like a qbeam through night vision has a very slight red glow to the naked eye from a few feet away but nothing anyone or anything would notice.

Our garage is directly below our bedroom. Our door opener has got to be the loudest one ever... I bet even the neighbors wake up if we have to open it at night! So I didn't need a lot of quieting to be happy... this one does the trick. It was not too difficult to install, though a bit heavy for an old guy like me. And though I don't remember ever leaving my door open (old guy, remember?) the auto shut function is a good idea. It's a bargain at Amazon's current price (~180 bucks), IMHO.

good alternative to high end fixtures.  Ubiquitous classic, respected by plumbers and screams simple noble country club style shower head.  Although, Speakman has been putting out some cheapo home depot plastic versions that look similar, go for this one which is heavy duty chrome on metal and built to last.

This is the second one I've purchased over the years and I put this one on my Hitachi router on my portable router table!  It makes adjusting the height of the router so much easier.  Love the one I put on my Porter Cable router and that's what made me get another one.

I mounted the micro-adjuster on my Kreg Router table and was very satisfied with the results. I had been trying to adjust my fence by trial and error by hand and was wasting wood with poor cuts but with the micro-adjuster I was able to make fine adjustments and closer cuts with no problem. I should have bought one when I bought my table. This is a very good product and very easy to mount on a Kreg table.
summary: Kreg Micro-Adjuster for a Router table

reviewText: my friend who came back form 2 tours in afgansitan is a very close friend of mine and I knew he would enjoy a kive over a car say welome home, so I decided to buy both one for him and myself; needless to stay they're hits!!

The knives are quite sharp and of excellent quality considering the price.  If you have to do any serious crawling, climbing, or contortions to get to your destination you will like arrive without your knife. The sheaths do not have any mechanical means (friction or strap) for retaining the knives.  The sheaths are basically a thick walled plastic "cup"  and gravity keeps the knives in the sheaths.
summary: Sharp knife- poor sheath-gravity based retention only.

reviewText: It did not come with 30 accessories.  It came with two mandrels, two clamps, 4 sanding bands and a pack of cut off wheels The two mandrels that came with it do not fit the one collet that came with it.  Out of the box, this product is absolutely useless without purchasing additional accessories that one is lead to believe come in the box "30" sounds like a useful lot of accessories, doesn't it?  The box itself only says "various accessories" without listing what those are supposed to be.  But the far fewer than 30 accessories that are supposed to be in the box do not even work with the tool that they came with.

This is one of my most-used bits. There are some things you should know before purchasing. First, you don't need a router table to use it. But you will need a straight edge, as long as your joint. I use the Eurkekazone guide, but you can get by with the edge of a commercial piece of plywood if it's well-cut.Now, the whole key to using this bit is setting it at the correct height, because you want it perfectly centered, as you will be routing half your edges from the top and the other half from the bottom. It helps--greatly--to have a thickness planer to ensure that your boards are all of the same thickness.To set it at the correct height, here's a way:1) After putting the bit in your router, find a hard, flat surface (like a flat board or the surface of your table saw). Then push your router down until the blade touches the surface, and lock it down.2) Measure--precisely--the thickness of the wood that you are joining. A micrometer is nice for this.3) Take the thickness of your wood, subtract it from the thickness cut by this bit (1.5 inches, or 38 mm), and divide by 2. Add this thickness to the thickness of the pieces you want to join. EXAMPLE: The wood you want to join is 22 mm thick. Subtract that from 38 to get you 16. Divide that by 2 to get 8. Add that to the wood thickness (22), and you get 30 mm.4) Now, using your router adjustment, raise your router base by the amount calculated--in the above example, 30 mm. This will center the bit exactly if you are careful.If you are joining multiple pieces and some have to be joined on both sides, always route the glue joint for that piece of wood from the same side (that is, either top or bottom). If after routing your joints and pushing your pieces together, you find that your pieces are slightly staggered (every other one alternately high or low), pass the appropriate side through the planer to even things up to perfection before gluing.I have a finger joint bit as well, but for most applications, I prefer the glue joint bit. While a finger joint provides more surface area, it also provides a very long path for the glue to navigate when squeezing the clamps, and the glue takes more time to get into a finger joint, meaning it can start to set up. The bottom line is that when you clamp over a finger joint, excess glue may not completely squeeze out, and the glue line can be more obvious. I use the finger joint occasionally for short pieces (like cutting boards), and when I use it, I usually dilute the glue to make it easier to spread and squeeze out.But my hands-down choice for big pieces like tabletops is the glue joint bit. With a good glue and a straight cut line, the joint is plenty strong, automatically aligns your wood, and creates a practicallly invisible glue joint. I would not join a tabletop together without it. It speeds up the whole operation because you won't waste your time trying to get the pieces aligned while your glue is drying. Major stress reduction!Hope that these suggestions are comprehensible and useful. Happy woodworking!

This is the bait knife in our family's tacklebox, and does just fine.  It's came as sharp as any knife I've ever owned, including those which I meticulously sharpen.  It's held up well, and I've not had to re-sharpen it yet.  We don't live near saltwater, but even as a fishing knife, I've not experienced the rust that other users have mentioned.  Maintenance for us is wiping off on a towel, and occasionally spritzing with whatever lube is laying around.I really enjoy the utility of a great knife that costs so little, I don't mind if it gets lost in a lake.
summary: Very Sharp Knife, at a Great Price

reviewText: Fluke makes well thought out and manufactured products for tradespeople all over the world. I have come to know the Fluke name over the years and find everything they make dependable and professional. I would test a circuit with a multimeter or contact test before handling it if you aren't positive about the circuit layout first. All of these non contact volt testers present a shock hazard if not verified with contacting testers first. They do a wonderful job of getting a quick "hot" or not feedback.

I pulled it out of the box, read the instructions, and was building a workbench for my wife in 5 minutes.  The results look professional.  The grip is great, you really don't need glue which makes it easy to disassemble if you want to move a large piece.  The driver works well.  It's very versitile.  You don't necessarily have to follow the depth guide.  I've experimented and found many ways to use this tool.  I'm looking at the more complex furniture that I shied away from before.
Light weight, incredibly sharp, and very strong blade. I use this in my kitchen and I can't seem to kill it.
I love this little laser. It is super strong (it really does go almost a mile!) and its very easy to see even in bright sunlight. It mounts really easy with the supplier mount and looks cool to beat!

I first learned to use an in-line buffer over 20 years ago while working in a body shop.  We had some pneumatic [air powered] units that were really hard to control [RPM's]. With those it was super easy to burn paint especially plastic parts.  We had a few Milwaukee models but from what I remember they were super heavy.  Over the years I have used a few off brands that worked well but required numerous [motor] brush changes and triggger switch repair/replace. You really do get what you pay for!  I have used craftsman [borrowed] and was not impressed...does anyone know who is actually making any given craftsman electric tool anyways?  I borrowed a dewalt from a guy who I know who refinishes tubs, cultured marble etc. He fanatically loves that dewalt, don't get me wrong it works great and from what I've seen is super durable BUT that damn thing weighs a TON! No joke.  It's also a substantial investment [not cheap]. I had  dual action that as many of you know is pretty usless for compounding, I don't care what kind of bonnet you use it just is not gonna happen.  I started doing research on line and then going into retail stores to "finger" the tools.  I really liked the balance, power and price of the Makita.  I have and still own several Makita tools and use them professionally with nearly no issue, when an issue does arise I have had great service with no repeat problems.  I got lucky as a local retailer was no longer carrying Makita tools if favor of their own "in house" brand that appears to be a Makita knock-off.  So I won't name the retailer, but they are a fairly big name based out of the midwest area.  Nontheless I was able to pick up this exact kit package for just over $100 on clearance, when a few weeks earlier the best price I was able to find was about $200.  Sometimes we get lucky! With a nice polishing bonnet I get great results.  I'd definitely buy again, as for my cheapie, I still use it for compounding and as a loaner to neighbors/friends who are learning the skill.  But this baby does my final polishing and does not get loaned out.  Oddly both units are nearly identical in weight and basic case size but when the motors wind up it is like reving up a fiat next to a BMW, night/day difference.  And I have not had to "operate" on the Makita, nor do I expect to any time in the future.9.23.2011: UPDATE the large 3M Double sided polishing head is the way to go. It is not cheap [$30] but it is washable and for final glaze/wax leaves absolutely NO swirl marks.  As others have said speed 3 OR LESS is the way to go unless you are doing some heavy duty cutting [hi grit compound].  Still SUPER happy with it.  B/C of middle-age joint pain I just can't hand wax/polish like I used to, but with this buffer I can keep my vehicles looking great. w/o the hand pain.
summary: My Opinion the BEST Bang Period!

reviewText: I never thought I'd be writing a review of a toilet - bet here goes.About two months ago we recently replaced a 15 year old toilet with this one. We kept a plunger in the bathroom and needed to use it weekly or so. This had good reviews so we thought we'd give it a try. Installation was a breeze. As to performance we could not be happier with it. It does not flush like conventional toilet by swirling around; it's more like the bottom opens up and everything is swallowed. We no longer keep the plunger in the bathroom. In addition this is the quietest filling toilet if ever not heard. I'd also say the flush may be quiter than the norm too.At any rate we are going to replace the other toilets in the house with this toilet. In the past I've spent mega bucks on high end toilets but this is the best.

This is an excellent choice for families with kids. The high performance flush is going to give you peace of mind and save you lots of money by not needing a plumber if your kids decide to flush something they shouldn't. We all have curious kids, this toilet can take any child's curiosity! Check out my full review here: [...]

Many people who even look at something like the RCA USB home nightlight charger will simply think gimmicky or useless, but might want to rethink that upon closer examination.  Most of us don't want or need a nightlight and have chargers for all our USB devices, but what will happen when you are away from home?  I just got back from vacation and most of the outlets I had access to I had to scout out.  If I had to find one in the dark I'd be out of luck.If you are traveling this lightweight charger can easily be added to your luggage.  The plugs are not retractable so it would be advisable to put the device in a case.  Whether you are in a hotel room or in the company of friends and may need or want access to any device during the night you can easily find it without having to turn on lights.  Some people, however, may find this intrusive as, in the words of someone I discussed this charger with claimed, "the last thing I need is a light in my room."  Insomniacs might want to rule this one out or consider placement in another room.  It is however, great for those who might be on call overnight and need a charged phone without having to grope around for it while half asleep.The RCA USB home nightlight charger can be used with smart phones, gaming devices, MP3 players, and is compatible with the iPad, iPhone, and the iPod.  The light in this nightlight charger is an LED and gives off a bright glow.  The device is not perfect in that some areas of my house, which have low lighting, do not signal the sensors to turn off.  Obviously, this was meant for overnight charging, but don't count on it turning off at the crack of dawn.  If you purchase this with this minor caveat in mind and don't expect more than it was intended to do, you'll be quite satisfied.
summary: This is a nice, innovative device with a couple small caveats ...

reviewText: Bought these to put ion my first aid kit thats in thebugout bag, not going to try it unless I have to

I picked up two of these and one Mr Beam MB360 here off amazon. First I will say the MB360 and the Dorcy lights are EXACTLY the same thing. The only difference is the name on the base, but the Dorcy is $3-4 less then the Mr. Beam.They mount easy and are bright, but take into account they are LED and not incandescent or halogen spots so you won't get serious distance. I put them on "the dark side" of my house and they work great. The motion detection is super sensitive. For $21 each these are great, and I may pick up 1 or 2 more. One was accidentally dropped 4 feet onto a tile floor I was worried it wouldn't work, but no damage and it works fine.
summary: Great light for a LED motion light

reviewText: I bought this to do a backsplash with limited glass tiles used as an accent.  It worked well for that use and also cut the larger onyx tiles with ease.  The blade creates very few chips, less than the standard ceramic/porcelain blade.  Not sure about the longevity or abilities on large amounts of glass tile.

A good replacement choice for the original batter in my B&D flashlight. The newer battery seems to hold the charge longer than the original albeit this is just based on personal observation not measured in any scientific manner. No complaints.
