Worst case, I have a drill press and the correct sized drill so I can fix it if necessary, but if I have to jury-rig an expensive tool to make it work properly I won't be happy.6/11 report back - BD shipped a properly machined replacement track (counter-sinks on original were not deep enough) immediately, and I had it in-hand inside a week.  It now all works just peachy.  I'm using my Biesemeyer rip fence, and my Delta and Kreg miter gauges.  Nice. I came away with the impression that BD maybe has five employees; but they seem to know machine tool work when they set their minds to it.  The customer service call went through Rockler, by the way.  They took the call at the 800 number and sent an email to BD about the problem.  The email was the only description that came with the new part.The additional plate on the right causes no instability, so I haven't added the support legs.  I had not installed the Delta right side wooden extension table, so now I have spare parts.  With the saw now weighing in at over 300 pounds I don't see much vibration.  The length of my table is now nearly 60 inches, and all of this took up not one inch more space in my shop.A truing block I use to check my saw table can identify no problems with the Benchdog table anywhere, and it looks like they may have read some of the posts here because the sharp edges on my table were already rounded.The phenolic plate is solid but not exceptional.  Okay for something like a PC 690 router, but not something heavier.I followed this purchase up with the Pro-Lift/PC 7518 router combo.  It's evident that somebody talked to somebody, because the only evidence I see that the saw, the table, the lift and the router weren't all intended to always be assembled together is the BD table is a different shade of grey, and even that's changing as it gets waxed, etc.  Seriously, the left-side Delta extension moves to the far right side with no modification; Delta even left pre-drilled and threaded holes to accommodate that change.  I had to add some new lock washers, but that was it. The weight of the router and lift on the left just about perfectly balances the extra plate on the right.  Vibration is trivial for either the saw or the router.I also added some double-sided tape and metal measuring tape which I setup to compensate for the width of the BD rip fence.  I backup that fence with my Biesemeyer rip fence.  I spent the time to do proper calibration of the two fences, and now use the line within the Biesemeyer width of cut gauge to determine the cut.  It takes me less than a minute to setup for a groove that is perfectly straight, and within less than 1/64" of the desired distance from the rip edge.  It seems like half of the router-table books I own are dedicated to coming up with an accurate fence.  Mine's built-in, at a cost of two feet of tape from an old tape-measure.The fully depressed router doesn't even come close to interfering with the angle adjustment wheel for the saw blade.  The router fence barely comes close to touching the router when hanging under the table.  When extended  the router collet extends well above the top of the table for changing bits.  The only inconvenience is having to reach under the table and around the router to change the speed.I have to use space as efficiently as I can, and I can't imagine a more effective way to add a router table.
summary: 'nother five - results for Delta LT 10" contractor

reviewText: I can not believe just how great this little light is for the low cost.I have lights that I paid MUCH more for that do not even come close to itin brightness.  Not to mention the 3 light modes and adjustable focus.AND to do it with a simple AA battery vs 3 volt lithium in my more expensivelights.LED technology has come a long way.

I have been using these on my indoor garden for a year they are so simple to use and reliable that I have come back for more to use on other things in my home that I would like to be on a timer.Since this device does not accept a 3 prong plug I have used an adapter with no issues to connect to a high qualityextension cord/surge protector.

This looked like a good idea, but it is so inflexible in what size handle bar and light it will work with that I can't recommend it to anyone.  I did manage to squeeze a light into it and it didn't fall out, but I didn't feel secure about it.
summary: Might work if you happen to have exactly the right size bar and light

reviewText: First, to this sellers credit, all the issues I'm going to list below have been promptly and professionally responded to and resolved. All together I bought four of these.The quality of the flashlight is outstanding. I have a LedLenser I bought here on Amazon for over $100 (P7) and the LED flashlight that comes with this kit is 90% as bright as the P7. And that's not just my opinion, that's using a light meter bought here on amazon as well. The light is a nice bright white and as has a useful range of about 1/8 mile (660') (reflective range about double that.) The one down side is one of the LED flashlights had a defective battery holder, which was promptly replaced. The flashlights have a beam adjustment for range; short and wide or long and narrow or anything in between. At the long range, the light pattern is a perfect square. As you pull it back, it goes out to a round spot and the further you pull it back it goes to a wide flood. The switch goes low-off-high-off-high flashing-off. The high flashing mode is insanely effective if you want people to see you.Now the bike mount. It functions well, but I did have to use some old vinyl 7/8" tubing to act as a spacer on my 22mm handle bars. Its pretty easy to adjust and goes up and down and left and right. You may also notice it's "sloppy." If so, you pull out the little rubber pad and there is a screw in there that you can tighten to take up the slack. I had to tighten all 4 I bought.Now here is the problem. I bought 4 total, 2 of which broke. The seller is replacing both. One broke in the mail and one just broke on it's own. It was fine after a ride and then the next day I came out and it had snapped during the night. The problem is the plastic hinges seem to be a bit brittle. They broke right were the metal pin goes through them. It's really very thinly molded in that area. Two are still hanging in there and we'll see how the two new ones do. I strongly suggest only tightening the nut just enough to keep the mount from turning.I put two on each bike. One is focused long range and the other wide range. You can easily be seen a mile away, and with the two of them like I have them setup, close stuff is visible and long range is also very well lit at least out to 1/8th mile.Based on the price, (I paid $25 each) I don't see how you can go wrong. The flashlight is really equal to a $100 LedLenser P7 (okay 90%) and if the bike mounts hold up, then that's a bonus.

This unit is just what it says: a radio.  It is not a charger!  At first I thought that it should have a charger feature to it but I realized I already have two chargers and the batteries last long enough that they don't need more than one charger to keep up with the tool use.  Milwaukee concentrated solely on making a good sounding radio that can run on battery power and they have done just that.  The music comes out loud and clear from the Rockford Phosgate speakers.  I listen to a lot of AM radio and the reception for AM is better than any other radio I own so I use it at home sometimes just for AM radio.  I thought it was a pretty neat feature that you can charge your cell phone with a battery in when no AC adapter is present. The unit is built like a brick sh**house (as my uncle likes to say) and looks like it could take a bullet and keep on playing sweet music. I also like the straight through plug so it does not take up any space on the outlet. All in all this is another great product from Milwaukee and it is significantly less than Dewalt and Bosch's radio with better sound quality.

There isn't much to say except this is probably a big upgrade in appearance over your current towel holders.  The trendy oil-rubbed bronze color will give an instant "upgraded" look to your bathroom.The quality seems to be quite nice.  So far all of the Kohler products I've purchased are standouts in quality.
I like the 10 in 1 better than the 11 in 1.The 11 in 1 shaft is too thick to fit in some applications.
Lots of light from these Mr Beams battery powered lights.  But, would have liked a little longer battery life.  Lights stopped working about 3/4 through the winter season
summary: Battery Powered Mr Beams Outside Lights

reviewText: It's what you expect, gritty stuff.  Always seems to wear prematurely no matter what brand you buy these days though.

I keep this in my garage for cleaning my cars and spills in the house.  It is a great little vacuum with good suction and plenty of run time.  It is more bulky than items such as a Dust Buster, but the power and run time more than make up for it. The only short coming I can find is the dirt container has a lip turned inward all the way around, and when you empty it, you have to shake it a little to get all the dirt out, but this problem is pretty minor.
For the price, these are amazing. They have worked on everything I have tried them on and never broken a wire. The length guide is derpy and doesn't stay in place, but I don't really use it anyway.

This is the driver I SHOULD have purchased the first time!Instead I bought cheap and went with a 4 volt Craftsman screwdriver that is meant for very light work. With the Bosch PS20, I can drive screws with or without pre-drilling. It has the power to stay with me in work around the house or in my semi-pro woodworking projects. Small footprint gets me into the tightest of spaces, with power to spare. Two batteries and a charger keep me going!
summary: This is the driver I SHOULD have purchased the first time!

reviewText: I wish you could give 1/2 stars in the ratings. If I could this would get a 3.5 rating.This package was a good deal, 15 blades and a ToughCase for less than you can buy the blades at your local retailer.The blades are standard DeWalt reciprocating saw blades. They work and take abuse well. Solid 4 to 4.5 stars here.The case on the other hand did not. I have several of the tough cases; one from DW2166 45-Piece Screwdriving Set, one from DW1163 13 Piece Black Oxide Split Point Twist Drill Bit Assortment, and a couple bought to hold assorted bits and drivers. As was mentioned by another reviewer, this case is thinner than the others. When I bought the saw blade case, I put it in my tool box, tool box into the truck and went to the job site. When I took it out to grab a blade -- I saw that it was already broken! The five bundled metal blades had punched a hole in the case...DISAPPOINTED! As the case was part of the reason I chose this set over another brand, I have to give this part a low mark. 1.5 to 2 stars here.Now will it stop me from buying another one. No, because the blades are still cheaper in the set than buying separately. Just disappointed to see the ToughCases have gone down the cheapo rat-hole.
summary: Blades = great; Case = not so much

reviewText: This is a very good router.  The only thing I do not like about it, is fitting the motor to the bases is very difficult.

I've installed many now with now problems.  The switches seem well constructed.  I had one that did not work on arrival.  The seller was outstanding and shipped out the new switch before they even received the bad one back from me in the mail.

I purchased this lamp along with the one-LED model (MB360). Both work as described with zero problems. I use the one-LED to light a closet and this two-LED model to light my patio for a motion-activated webcam. This one is just bright enough to light my small patio for the webcam plus a little bit of the yard beyond. A drill is needed for mounting but otherwise a very easy install. Good product.

We have a 2.5 foot by 3 foot space between the washer / dryer and the walls.  The shelving unit we had been using, one of plastic, was unfit in the extreme; the shelves buckled, wheels fell off.  So we were looking for something sturdier, with good wheels, because this has to be easily moved.  This Seville Classic unit absolutely fits the bill.Setup is incredibly simple.  I had it out of the box and all set up within ten minutes, with no expletives.  Each shelf can hold 200 pounds, evenly distributed.  The wheels can hold the accumulated weight of the entire unit, filled.  If you're thinking this might be one of those cheap wire shelving units that bend when you use it, rest assured this is not that kind of product.  It holds what it claims to hold, looks good, and moves easily.  It is precisely what we were looking for.
I used this  to replace the light in our curio cabinet. I wanted something that doesn't give of a lot of heat. This unit is great it runs cool and has the added bonus of color and effects.

I have owned this saw for four months now and find it outstanding and I have no complaints.  I really appreciate the way the blades eject by the mere push of a button.  They insert easily as well.  This is a great product and speaks well for Bosch.  Plenty of power, cuts smoothly and accurately.

Is not the best, but does the job, I put the 9V battery plug the cables and let me check if they are ok.I don't need any more from this device so it is what the seller say it is, nothing more nothing less.

SE Mini UV Pocket Microscope, 45x +/-, LED Illuminated with Storage bag, allows user to inspect small items of interest, from jewelry, stones therein, fingernail surfaces, splinters, bugs, hair growing on the backs of your hand, printed letters on a page, leaf veins and other small items of interest.  A toy it is not, but if you have this loupe at your disposal, it will entertain and guide ones interest beyond the casual look we give to items we usually barely see.  Think about the young mind and how it can be drawn to something, when the obvious becomes inhanced into interesting detail.  I really think this should be a Christmas stocking stuffer for every little person who reaches an age, where they can use it to expand the vision of their ever widening worlds.  I have several versions that I constantly reach for of loupes and small visual enlargers.  Did you know scorpions are irradecant and glow in the dark under UV light.  Many items you view will appear much differently when viewed enlarged and exposed to UV light.
summary: SE Mini UV LED Pocket Microscope, 45x power or so.

reviewText: Works as intended.

This little saw is perfect for the smaller jobs where a larger reciprocating saw is to cumbersome to use.  I use mine to prune thick rose canes, palm tree limbs, or small branches of trees with a short 6 tpi blade.  Uses the same 12v max battery as my Bosch PS20 driver.  Small enough to pack around the yard.  Comfortable one hand use and blades are compatible with my larger recip saw.
summary: This saw is also great for pruning!

reviewText: The bulb works and easy to install but it is not very bright. I would like a product with more brightness. Fore my use I would pay more for a more powerful bulb.

Like most people shopping for a band saw, I spent a lot of time on various websites, user discussion groups, etc.  It's enough to make your head spin--so many choices.  When I actually saw the old style (cast iron frame) 14" band saws next to the Rikon Deluxe 14" saw, it was immediately clear that this machine is in a separate class--there's no comparing the cast iron frame saws to this beast.  It's bigger, more refined, has as much power as the best of them, and has a huge resaw capacity (that exceeds the cast iron models with riser block installed).  When you start adding up the bit$ and piece$ required to bring a cast iron frame near the specs of this saw, you'll see that those saws aren't really cheaper.Set-up was no particular problem, but the manual for this saw is absurdly bad.  It would be a bad manual for a crummy, cheap saw, but it's an embarrassment to have such a horrible manual for such a nice machine.  Instructions are sparse.  Hardware does not match illustrations/descriptions (those few that there are).  In spite of this, if you are semi-mechanically inclined (as I hope you are if you're buying a band saw), you can figure it out.As one would hope, this is a powerful machine that cuts curves and resaws nicely.  The fence leaves something (a lot) to be desired--the machining on the fence is marginal, the mechanism to adjust the fence to square with the table is inadequate (and cheap)...but I don't use the fence much anyway.  This is a band saw, not a table saw.  I will likely build or buy a better resaw fence when I get into a project that calls for a significant amount of resawing...but the existing fence will do for now.  Like the manual, it is strange to have such a marginal fence on an otherwise impressive machine.In short, this is a great saw--the fit and finish is very good--and the shortcomings (manual and fence) are only minor annoyances.

Check out my review for the Dorcy 41-1643 30 Lumen 3 Volt LED Replacement Bulb. This bulb should also perform flawlessly.We don't often use our 6 volt, except to spotlight outdoor unwanted activities.
I have had this tool for about 8 months now and it has been absolutely fantastic.  Defenitely worth every penny and has stood up to the abuse.  Without a doubt the best jigsaw on the market.
summary: The last word in Jig Saws

reviewerName: A book lover in Azle Texas "BookLoverAzleTexas"
reviewText: Buy this NOW!  Do not pass Go, do not collect $100!  You are going to be so happy that you did.  This sprayer for your shower has everything you could possibly want.  It is easy to install and even has a feature where the light changes color with the temperature of the water.  We haven't done it yet, but I'll bet it would be fun to shower in the dark.  (LOL)  The hose is nice and flexible too.One note: Be sure you have some teflon tape for installation.I think you'll like this one and want one for every bathroom.
summary: My hubby and I LOVE this thing!

reviewText: It works great and has the power to do the job right.  Bosch makes good stuff.

Works nicely, seems well-built.  I would have liked clearer instructions about the rpm adjustments (some discs require higher rpms, some less).  I've used one other brand of angle grinder, and this is far superior.EDITAfter 1.5 years of using this angle grinder, I'm even happier with it than before.  I've done a whole variety of jobs now from steel brushing paint off concrete to grinding and cutting metal, and have a project lined up for cutting tile and some stone.  The paddle switch is very convenient and a nice safety feature, and the ergonomics make the machine much easier to use than some others I've tried.  Great tool for the long-term.
These filters seem to work really good, almost to the point of them disgusting us.  We have 2 cats and a dog and after three months I go to change the filter and it is almost black, pretty nasty.
Lets you plug your 30A 120V RV plug into your generator.  A little more expensive than the cheaper-feeling version at Lowes ($7), but this is easy to hold on to and find in the dark.

This is an expensive bulb compared to an incandescent.  My little daughter has issues leaving her flashlight on and this LED uses so little energy that the batteries are lasting much much longer.  Similar, if not better brightness to the incandescent it replaced.
love this seal if u ever use it u will never go back to using a wax seal it that great mess free and can be used on any toliet. i just love it .
Perfect light to replace the old bulb in the flashlight spotverry bright and litle consommation on the batteries.I wil install that cand of bulb in all the flashlight I got.

I'm amazed.  Bought this tiny flashlight a couple of weeks ago, and put it on my key-chain, figuring it might help one night to open the front door....  Anyway, tonight I needed to search for something that was dropped my son's lawn.  It is VERY bright for its size, and maybe better ... it casts a nice "even" beam.  Don't know how long the batteries will last, but I'm going to order an extra set since I can see this light will really be useful. I often buy antique furniture and need to inspect the bottom, rear, behind drawers etc.--usually in a dark store or market--and found this light to be very useful for this purpose.  In summary, an excellent product.
do not put under a vehicle but good for hiding a key in a metal cabinet out of sight. hides well

My son and I looked for a throwing tomahawk, this is the best. I functions as a great tool, digging, great for splitting wood for campfire, pounding stakes into the ground. This is really a great, lightweight addition to backpacking treks.

This filter and assembly are definitely a great addition to the kitchen.  I love the fact that it is mounted underneith the sink and out of the way.  Great product.  Can't see where you'd go wrong with this purchase.  There is a slight decrease in pressure but it's very small and there is still more than enough pressure to do what is needed.  Highly recommend this filter kit.
I have loved and used these picture hooks for years, and they are getting harder to find. They are sturdy, pretty, and work very well. Arrived quickly great price.

works as advertise, but the fan is not as quite as expected for the sonic rating...but it does the job and easy to install. I would not recommend using the light as the primary source, but it does provide enough to see and find things.
Piece of art that you can use daily, depend on, buy two and put one back foe someone you care about.

Oh, where to begin.  Yes, I do love tactical and cool flashlights.  Streamlight, Surefire, Fenix, 4-Sevens... All have been used to good effect in the WinThePennant household.Maglite, for years, was the Top Dog in flashlights.  And, that was true for my home, too.  But, Maglite stuck around the incandescent dark ages for too-too long and I moved along to higher tech and much more cool gear.Enter... The XL class of Maglites.  I have an XL100, and really dug it (check my review).  But, I didn't care for the fact that the tailcap writing pretty much is useless at night.  I decided to give the simpler and more straightforward XL50 a shot.  And, now I'm in flashlight heaven.One click - High beam.Two clicks - Low bean.Three clicks - Strobe.The beam is excellent, love the throw, and the glow around the center point is quite excellent.  The tailcap has a great feel, and allows you to stand the flashlight on the tailcap end (like all the XLs).Maglite owners will probably not like that the focus beam is pretty lousy (who cares - the throw is excellent).THERE IS NOT A BETTER $23 FLASHLIGHT OUT THERE!
summary: Smoking Hot Torch - Buy American Baby

reviewText: I've used this tool to work on just about everything. Use the optional 1/4 collet to use it as a light router. Or take off the guide and use it with your Dremel accessories (all the Dremel 1/8" bits fit the standard collett). There are also variable speed controllers available to vary the speed if you want (I got mine off of ebay search for foot pedal speed controller, or a drill variable speed controller with a dial if you just want to set a lower speed and keep it at that) and it makes this tool truly exceptional. There are also universal drill press stands that will hold this so with the 1/4" collet adapter and a chuck, you have a nice 5 amp drill press. Very, very versatile tool.
summary: Better than Rotozip, also a Dremel on steroids...

reviewText: I'm really happy with these bulbs, but I think it is important to read reviews before you purchase.  Here are a few things that were a little different than what I would have expected (although I had a pretty good idea based on other reviews):1. These bulbs are tiny, this worked out just find for me, as my fixture was a little large for the space to begin with-- functionally it's not an issue, but they are likely smaller than the flood bulbs you're replacing.2. As others have noted there is a very slight blue hue-- I guess you could say it's a pretty cold light.  That said, it's a security flood for me, so this makes absolutely no difference.3. Some said these lights are not equivalent to 65w incandescent.  One thing to consider is that your original floods are very likely more than 65w, so check that out. That said, I'd agree that they aren't equivalent to a 65w incandescent.  They are a bit more directional, so I think where it's directed it's probably equivalent, but I don't think they cover the area of a traditional flood.So now that that's out of the way, I love these bulbs.  I bought 2, and so far I've had no problems with either of them.  They seem to have a very sturdy build, and I have no reason to believe they won't hold up to weather. My fixture has 2 bulbs to light a fairly small area (about 15' x 15'). I think they are entirely adequate, but if you're lighting a larger area, they might not be as satisfactory.I think the thing I'm most excited about is the 3-4w power consumption. I've been excited about the prospect of LED lighting to cut our energy consumption (yes, I believe in going green), but I've been disappointed to find that most new LED's use about as much electricity as a CFL. These bulbs seem to be the exception.
I like a clean finished installation and these faceplates look very nice.  I am satisfied.  Faceplates are a simple product so there is not much else to say.

I bought this to replace my Franky Filter system which was defective an caused a flood in my kitcken. The housing that holds my old Franky filter split. The Franky was a very expensive unit & so were the filters.The company didn't offer any help in replacing it. I have since replaced it with the Filtrete (3US-AS01). Simple to install and easy filter replacement. I like it and recommend it.

Save money and buy a 4 pack.  The Tenergy 18650 Li-ion batteries are high quality high capacity rechargable cells.  Good battery life with plenty of power.  Best performing affordable protected 18650 batteries available.  Be sure you get the ones with button top if you plan to use in flashlight.  Be aware there are cheaper knockoffs and chinese brands out there that are not worth it. Good value!

I received a 9.6V cordless drill/driver as a gift.  The one thing that I didn't like was the charging system, which was just a "wall wart" (wall transformer) with a cord that plugs into the drill/driver.  I found the battery charging took much too long & having the cord plugged into the drill/driver meant it can't be put away.Now that I have the PS1MVC pod style quick charger, the battery can be plugged in to charge, which takes much less time & I can put the drill/driver away.  When I decided I wanted this battery charger I searched the internet for the best price & Amazon's price was the best & even the shipping was free! :)

General Tech Intl 2258622 "Steelgrip" Rubber Mallet works just fine for me and I love it. I've put off buying one for way too long. Anytime I've needed a mallet I would fold several towel for padding and use it as a bit of a cushion so I didn't destroy whatever I was putting together with my hammer. So, I caved in and bought one.I read a few review that mention it stinks. Well, yes, it stinks because rubber stinks. Especially brand new rubber. I'm not going to be holding it under my nose day in and day out nor am I using it as product to make my home smell nice. It doesn't smell like teenage boy sneaker feet or like the cats' litter boxes when they need cleaned. Don't hold it up to your nose and you'll be fine. Any rubber mallet stinks when it's new. So do new tires for cars. Oh, yeah, they're rubber too.The striking surface is 2 inches across. That's plenty big for all the jobs I can imagine having.For the price I paid for this mallet and the quality of it, I'm more than satisfied. The weight isn't much at all so it is a very easy tool to use. I used it to put some wheels on an item that only came partially assembled, the reason I bought the mallet, and achieved the desired results. There are numerous tasks I do around the home and when out camping that the mallet will be the perfect tool for the job.A great addition to my tool box.
summary: Yep, It's A Mallet And I Love It

reviewText: I bought this item to use in my window cleaning biz since the first vac I tried was way to anemic to do much  This thing is great and promises to do a great job.
nice flash light --came in a reasonable amount of time---i would highly recommend this cree light for all uses--aand only one AA battery

This 3M Hard Hat is very comfortable and provides good protection on the job site. There seems to be a lot of confusion about the assembly instructions but I was able to follow them without any real difficulty and had it fully assembled and ready to wear within 5-minutes of opening the package.Once assembled,I found this to be generally equal or even superior to other hard hats that I wore as an installer for a phone company. The "4-Point Ratchet Suspension" is comfortable and easy to adjust and the "UVicator(tm) Sensor" will let you know when the hard hat has reached the end of it's service life (Ultraviolet radiation will weaken the plastic over time). I like the venting on the top as it allows airflow, which is a big improvement over the older designs.Highly Recommended!CFH

This is one tough bag.  It is designed for a professional, but I use it to haul basic tools around my home for the standard fix-it jobs. If it has any negatives at all, it would be that the bag does not stand upright on the ground on its own.  No big deal.  I just set the bag against a wall or hang it on a knob.My bag with a full set of tools weighs about 10 pounds.I am extremely pleased with this bag, and I plan to purchase more LeatherCraft products.
summary: High quality & sturdy carry bag for tools

reviewText: This is a light duty hard hat.  When the straps are properly set, the hard hat sits higher on the head than one would expect.  However, it does provide solid protection.  We have over 20 trees to mow around in the yard.  Even though I have tried to trim the low hanging limbs, there are some branches that still hang low enough to bang your head while mowing.  My wife has encouraged me to get a hard hat for protection, but I was hesitant.  It's usually so hot I just couldn't see wearing any type of hat.  This hard hat is vented and I was surprised that it not only protected my head, it shaded my head and the venting kept my head cool. It's very handy to have and is a nice light duty head protection hard hat.  I gave this hat 4 stars because the strapping is somewhat difficult to attach and does not attach solidly... the strapping could be better.
summary: Great protection against low-hanging limbs when mowing the lawn

reviewText: These really fill a niche beyoun hemostats for fine soldering work.  Though very flexible, they seem strong enough to hold solder and retrieve parts.  Only 4 stars  becasue they're made in China.

I like this tool, it is compact enough to fit in your pocket but delivers screw driving capability equal to most 12v full size drivers that I've used.  The light is a nice feature.  I found the small size to be very handy when driving pocket screws in a place that was a little tight.  It will work as a drill but the speed is too low to be very good for drilling.  If you have only one driver and you do much drilling I wouldn't pick this puppy but for the guy who drives a lot of screws it's great.
Finish of the tips of the tweezers are no good. I have to use Dremel to adjust by myself. See pictures.
Not bad for the Leatherman's I own. I'm a contractor and this has come in handy on multiple projects. Great accessory for the spend.

The only gripe I have is that the LED shines below the point of the driver. It's basically useless and I actually wish I could shut it off. Other than that, this is a great little driver that will handle most anything you throw at it except commercial construction. For a homeowner or contractor looking for something small and durable for trades work, you won't go wrong. If you are doing anything heavy duty, a 14.4 or 18 is a better bet, but this will do for everything else. Pistol is a little thick but very comfy. Well built.
summary: Absolutely great tool, light , powerful and well built.

reviewText: This is the worst design I've ever seen for a faucet water filter. My previous Pur filter got a crack in the side after just a few months of use. Since I still have unused Pur filters, I bought this one hoping it would be better. Looks like it's going to have the same problem - instead of channeling the water from the faucet into the filter, the water fills up the cheap plastic housing that holds the filter and it makes its way into the filter through pressure. I'm returning it and probably switching to another brand even though I've got the extra Pur filters.I almost forgot - the "one click" feature also doesn't work very well eitherl. It's a flimsy plastic button/grip onto a rubberish piece that screws onto your faucet. Too much water pressure and it "one-clicks" right off! I just got my new Brita filter - MUCH better.
summary: Poor, Cheap Design - Pur Faucet Filter - 3400B

reviewText: It was easy to install.  It came with 4 different kinds of attachment for various types of faucets.  I have to remove the tip from my faucet before I can install it.  Took me just 5 minutes to set it up.It works very good.  You have to let it flow for 5 minutes to make the filter ready for use.  At first the flow is somewhat slow, but after letting it run as mentioned above, it goes on pretty smoothly.  The water is clear and does not taste anything metallic or artificial.The filter housing can be pushed to rotate out of the way if you need to, like when you need to wash your hands or do some dishes.  The switch from filtered water to plain water is just an easy flick of the switch.  It also has an LED indicator to let you know when is time to change the filter.  You can buy thePUR RF-9999-6 3 Stage Faucet Mount Filter, 6-Packin 6-pack.My only concern is how long it can hold.  I only own this for a week.  I will update my review if it fails to perform as it should.  Most of the materials are made of plastic.  The chrome finish looks really good, very shiny and it looks like real metal until you actually touch it.
i purchased these for my apartment and i love them, they are absolutely beautiful and go great with all of the brushed nickel.

Works great with 2 regulated port at same regulated pressure and 2 non regulated port.The incoming air male quick disconnect do not come with the other female side so you have to buy that separate it a larger size than the other disconnects on the manifold.But other that that it works great and pretty much rugged.

I had something similar I the past but had the trigger on the battery (gun stile) not the top.  It is just a very bad place to put it. If you need to switch directions it is annoying to move the switch.  It just a bad design. Wish I could return it.  The battery seems to last a long time though.
summary: Had some before, this is not the best of the bunch, just ok.

reviewText: I have a few Maglite products now and this is definitley one of my favorites.  This LED model is much brighter than the original Maglite and the battery life is longer.  I like the digital camo look, but they have it in black as well (which is the color of my original one).  Excellent company with yet another excellent product.

I purchased this item maybe 6 months ago at a local box store. It worked well enough the first 2-3 times I used it. I have a larger unit that I use in my wood shop, but this little guy is perfect for those small jobs. I have not used it in quite some time, and the next time I came to use it I noticed that it was struggling to build pressure, takes longer than it ever did new. After about 30 minutes of work it finally reached full pressure, then it kept going, all the way up to 120psi until the relief valve triggered. I called CH and they refused to service the item, refused to send parts and generally were very unaccommodating. I still do not understand how this is not covered by a 1 year warranty, but I finally gave up and ordered a new pressure switch on my own. Long story short, if you are spending under $200 on a compressor, CH will treat you pretty poorly, this is common behavior from a company when they knowingly produce an inadequate product. The funny thing is that customer service on this $90 tool has made it clear that I will not be buying any other tools from CH in the future.7/20/2013 update:I installed the new pressure switch that I ordered on my own and this unit still does not operate properly. Clearly CH is using defective parts and has chosen not to update their inventory with working parts. So disappointing on so many levels.

I have owned a number of these multi tools from Leatherman(tm) and SOG, and I bought a used version of the CX thinking that I could replace carrying an EDC and multitool with just this multitool. For that it works, sort of. First since I got an older version I've got the serrated blade. Still made from 154CM it's plenty sharp even though the blade looks like it's never seen a stone. The flat bits are ok, not great, but at least they are easily replaceable and as anyone who has used a Phillips tip driver knows, they wear out easily. And if you buy the extenderLeatherman 931009 Bit Driver Extensionyou can use any old 1/4th drive tip. I like that the blade is on the outside of the handle, and thus easy to get at. I like the liner lock. Normally I avoid liner locks as I find them weak and not dependable but this one seems up to at least the same level as the blade. (a thin but reasonable work blade.)What's nuts is the carbon spacer. I mean WTF? Who cares what that spacer is made of as long as it spaces, and doesn't rust. Secondly it looks like if Leatherman had thought it out better, they could have put two or maybe even three screwdriver bits in that space stretched out along the handle.Also the frame itself could have been one piece of bent steel instead of two on the blade side. Might be harder to manufacture, but Leatherman went to a lot of trouble to drill out every last bit of steel to lighten this thing, why isn't the frame just a "S" with the two slots, one for the blade and one for the pliers?Can anyone really justify the springs for the plier's heads? I have the original Leatherman and it didn't need a spring to lock in place the pliers. You don't need much friction to hold them in place, and all the force when using them, holds them in place anyway. Why complain, weight I guess and I'm assuming manufacturing cost which translates into our cost.As an EDC, it's too thick. When I hang the knife from it's clip in my jeans and then put my keys in the same pocket and try to reach past the knife, I'm always hanging up on the knife itself. My regular EDC is aSOG Specialty Knives & Tools TWI-22 Twitch XL - Black Handleand it's thin and smooth, so no hangups, scrapings etc. Weight wise it's light enough to not be noticeable.I have left the Phillips large tip in the bit holder because it makes the grip of the pliers smoother in my large hands. (XL glove). Putting the standard tip there digs into my hand if I apply any pressure to the pliers.The pliers are thin, but functional for that everyday task of pulling staples out of paper, bending a coat hanger to fetch that dropped thing in the sink, extracting bones from my fish after cleaning, etc. Leatherman & SOG have many other larger pliers options if you need a "real" set of pliers.On a positive note, the beer cap lifter is great. Works easily and everytime. Better than any of the other cap lifters on all the other multitools I own. The pocket clip is tight, but not too tight. Makes the tool easy to retrieve.After all this negative review you might think I'm getting rid of it, but I'm not. It does fit a function so I'll keep it. But seriously Leatherman could have done better.
Compact and works.  Really easy to pack with you just in case you need it.  Probably not something I would use as my main source to sharpen though.

as other comments stated this is the real deal best air gun. really powerful and well built.  i can even clean the shop floor with this.05/2014  love it so much got another one. nothing compares to this unit  i give it a 10 stars if i can. even better the price went down.....

This is a nice quality set for the money.  The ratcheting mechanisms have a solid/smooth feel.  I'll admit the black finish is just a cosmetic nicety, but for only a few bucks more than the regular chrome set why not?  It's very convenient to have all the deep and regular sockets in one set together.  Out of the box the black finish is enough to get your hands a little grubby, but I'm using them to work on cars not cook food.
summary: Nice to have everything socket related in one place

reviewText: This bag is very nice quality, the construction and durability makes it look like it will last forever.  The side pockets on the inside are nice for small things so they don't end up on the bottom.  I like it because it's good for a 'grab bag' when you have a project and just want to get a few tools you need rather than pull everything out.

The only reason that stopped me from giving this screwdriwer 1 rating instead of 2 is the fact, that it has a great torque, even outperforms my 7.2v skill cordless driver!The bad:1. No battery charge/complete indication, so, regardless that this is lithium, you going to stuck to ole "overnight charge" mode.2. Controls are placed very strangely, very uncomfortable to use. Overall design leaves impression that this tool was designed for alen hand, not human hand.3. No chuck brake and torque setting. This means that in a lot of cases, head of your screw will be severly distorted by means of this tool.I'm not going to suggest this tool to anyone, go get better models for the same price!
summary: Poorly designed, no chuck brake, no charging indicator, but great torque!

reviewText: This little light will impress you the first time you use it at night.  It is really bright.  I keep one attached to my dog leash for walking her at night and another attached to a zipper on my vest for hiking (it's so small and light you don't even notice it is there).  The light is easy to turn on and off with one hand (simply twist the tip), well made metal construction, and super lightweight.  My only complaint is that it does go through batteries fairly quickly, but I think that is even tradeoff considering how bright this light is.  I bought a 50 pack of batteries (it uses 4 at a time) here on Amazon for about $5 bucks.If you're into ultra-light hiking, this light is a must have.
summary: Liked it so much, I bought a second one

reviewText: What can I say. I use my Dewalt tools everyday. I am still amazed by the power of these rechargeable battery-operated tools. The batteries last effectively between 1-3 years before I wear them out. I number and date the batteries and I rotate their usage to get the most out of them. They charge (after the first time) in a half hour. They are expensive but worth it.

I bought these to replace my rapidly fading 6-year-olds and have been very pleased thus far.  NiCad is pretty outdated by now, but DeWalt seems to keep tweaking things to get these batteries to perform better than older versions of the same model.  I bought a kit back in 1998, then replaced batteries in 2004 or -05, and am now replacing those, as the original saw still works well and I have a new replacement drill body.  These new batteries have a date stamp from November 2010, so quite new, and came in the standard 2-pack clamshell, so there didn't appear to be any shenanigans as in other reviews.  They really pack a punch and seem to last longer than the old ones did when new if my memory serves.  Overall, I'm very pleased and got exactly what I expected.

The first time I used one of these was on a hiking trip in the Grand  Canyon.  I was amazed how bright it was.  My only two complaints about  these are: 1) While they are very tough when the batteries are installed,  don't drop one while it's empty.  The batteries must help strengthen the  tube.  I dropped mine and the tube dented easily.  I couldn't get it round  enough again to reload the batteries. I had to buy a new one. 2) Don't let  your batteries get old.  They fit so snuggly in the tube and if they swell  or leak, you'll never get them out.
summary: Great flashlight - bright as many D cell types

reviewText: 33' Electric Fiberglass Wire Pull Rods Fish Tape.  These are small but long and are good in walls.  Have not used these much yet.
summary: 33' Electric Fiberglass Wire Pull Rods Fish Tape

reviewText: Hard to complain about bits at this price, but I don't have any complaints, anyway. They hold up better than the ones I've bought singly at the hardware store (for more than double the price), although I suspect my hammer drill is extending Phillips bit life by preventing camming out.
summary: They hold up better than the ones I've bought singly at the hardware ...

reviewText: I have about 3 diferent size Maglite, and decide to have a led one. Very nice flashlight, but very temperamental. Sometimes it does not turn on and sometime it blinks. When it works, it is great.
little torch big light, plus small AA battery equals useful strong light in a water resistant form. worth every penny

Whether it is the single on off switch option or the three mode options these work well, and are actually brighter and more versatile than more expensive flashlights. Using a single AA battery you not only save money but get a brighter beam. In the event you needed a battery replacement you can easily obtain it as opposed to a lithium battery (which I'm sure the manufacturer of doesn't happen to sell flash lights that use only those kind. . .) Even though I had plenty of lithium batteries I saw the obvious desire in using a AA alternative and have not be disappointed in the least.
summary: Very effective and I can imagine these getting addictive to buy (for yourself and others.)

reviewText: I really wanted to like this mini LED flashlight.  When it worked, it was great.  Really bright, small and portable.  When summer came around the flashlight stopped working.  I thought the batt needed replacing.  However, all three batteries melted and fused within the housing.  Can't get them out for the life of me.  Only thing left was to chuck this thing.  A shame :-(
summary: Works for a while then batteries melted!

reviewText: I'm using this for a window air conditioner.  I know, I know.  I don't have another option.  Rewiring the house for another outlet box is not an option and this is the only window in the entire upstairs that is the right type/size for an a/c unit.  As is recommended, I am using the shortest possible extension and this was also the largest wire (smallest gauge number) I could find in an extension that wasn't $90 commercial long-length extension cording.You must check your cord in your situation, but for me this is working without creating any hot spots in the air con cord or the extension cord.  Hopefully it also is not causing any overheating within the wall.  I haven't had any super hot days where the a/c would be under super heavy load continuously, but I have run it all day / all night in moderate heat without any issues.  Seems to be well made as far as I can tell.
This is a high quality, very powerful impact wrench. A great tool to go with my other 18 volt set. Haven't used it a lot, yet but seems to be very well made.

I own 4 cordless recip saws and hands down by far this is the most powerful. Not only does the battery last a long time but the dual speed makes it work in all applications. Hands down this is the best!

I buy a set of these batteries every couple of months, they work great. When they go down, just pop them on a charger and grab the one that has just been charged. You are good to go again. When I need to buy these, I always get them the next day. Great service.

Around 3 or 4 years ago, I purchased 2 sets of Mechanix gloves that were perfect gloves I used for everything.  When I needed to get another couple of pairs, I could not find them anymore and the ones I found just did not feel great.  Researching online I came to the conclusion that I really needed to try this gloves out as a replacement, and I am absolutely glad I did!**SIZE CONCERNS - PLEASE READ**  It is very difficult for me to find a good fitting glove with a big and long thumb, thin and long fingers, and thin wrists. When I size my hand to charts, I always fall barely up to the large size, but a large always ends up too tight and short for my thumbs and too short for my fingers.  Even my first set of Mechanix gloves where XL.  I ordered a set of Snap-On gloves in large and they are too small, but with all of the feedback on these gloves, I hesitated to try the large one more time, but I did.  I was worried about yet another failed attempt to select large glove vs. the proven XL that fits my hands.  Well these arrived and the large gloves fit my hands like any other XL glove fits.  I would suggest (if you have concerns in the middle of 2 sizes) to go with the smaller size!
The timers occupy little space and is a convenient way to disconnect appliances that are used frequently without having to pull the plug

First: this product is intended for Security+ garage door openers made before 2005. If you have a Security+ opener with a grey antenna wire and/or an red/orange "learn" button on the back, you should be all set. Hopefully, that helps out anyone deciding which model they need.My opener was made in '97 and has the orange button, and it took me longer to read the instructions than it took to actually program this to work with my opener. You hit the button, enter the code you want, and hold down the Enter button for a few seconds. That's it.Mounting it was a breeze. You put a screw in where you want to hang the keypad, slide the keypad on the screw, and then put in a second screw where the battery goes (just under the pad) to keep it secure. They even included the 9V battery!Seriously. If you have a drill, the whole setup and installation takes maybe five minutes.I was also really happy to save nearly a third of what the local home improvement chains wanted for a flimsy "universal" keypad by buying from Amazon.
summary: Great price, great product, incredibly easy to install.

reviewText: i love this flashlight,  very small, sturdy, illuminates much more than other flashlights i use to have in the same price range

Looks good and bulb replacement is easy.  The old fixture had to be taken apart because the bulb was inserted from the top - plus, it was forty years old.  With this unit the bulb is inserted from the bottom.

Bought this for my husband and his shed.  It's a sturdy little thing. For an occasional weekend warrior its perfect to help keep the shed organized.  It has holes in it so you can attach it to the wall.

We have a large pergola in our backyard and wanted to hang lights on it. I happened upon these Q-Hangers and was very happy to find they were easy to use and worked perfectly for our patio lights. I also appreciated that their stainless steel and won't rust. Very satisfied.
summary: Easy to use and worked perfectly for our patio lights

reviewText: The Jet 22-44 is a very good drum sander. I have extensively used a Delta 16-32 drum sander for a number of years and was able to sell it for nearly what I paid for it so the upgrade to a wider unit was financially feasable. I took a look at a lot of machines and read through a lot of the operators and parts manuals. This looked to be the most foolproof, reliable, easy to operate and should have a low operational cost.The machine came in three boxes and were very well packaged. The boxes contained the  sanding head, cabinet, and conveyor belt. Assembly is very easy. The sanding head goes on top of the cabinet and then the conveyor goes inside of the sanding head. The conveyor even features ceramic guides to help eliminate creep of the conveyor belt. I have yet to adjust the belt tracking. A standard 20 amp circuit is sufficient to operate the sander. No special wiring is needed.The smart sand feature works well on the machine. I can set the belt feed to 60 or more and the smart sand will slow the belt down when wider stock is fed through and back up when narrower stock is sanded. This feature has really made using this unit a real pleasure as I dont worry about stalling the motor, burning/gouging the stock, or ruining the sand paper. The key is don't take too much off during a pass.Turn the depth wheel 1/4 of a turn for the next pass or 1/8 turn for highly figured or unusually hard woods like locust or wenge. I usually check the temperature of the wood on exit and put it aside if it starts to get fairly warm. No scientific data but it does seem to help eliminate spotty burn marks especially around the occasional knot that may be present. these usually will hand sand out fairly easily but why not eliminate it from the start.Working with burl, birdeye and other highly figured woods sucepible to tearout on a planer/surfacer is very easy with this machine. It just takes a little more time to surface down these woods. Sanding surfacing makes it possible to make some very nice projects much easier.After using it to sand over 1000 bf of oak and walnut I have no concerns. I use 80 grit most of the time and then sand with a random orbit sander with 80 and then 120 and its ready for finish. On door panels I will sand the individual parts right after the dry fit so there are no cross grain scratches. Finish sand after glue up. I have also glued up and then sanded the whole panel. in this case its better if you drum sand to 120 before the finish sanding to hel get the cross grain sanding marks out. Also becareful (as one should anyway) when gluing up to assure the style is in plane with the rail. Sometimes the clamp can cause this problem if the jaws are not perfectly parallel on the clamp. But this machime can certainly sand it flat again should this happen.The inline stand seems a bit narrow especiallly given that the feed table overhangs it by a ways but it is not a stability issue. I dont mind the inline wheels as the machine is usually pulled straight out from its storage location for use and rolls straight back in when done.The optional feed tables should have come with the unit but it is possible that one would not need these if running stock of less than 3 or 4 feet long. It does take up more space. I would have liked to seen a design where the table was a set of arms with a roller that would flip up then one could feed stock with the roller arm up or down and flip them up for storage. When running wide stock say 40 inches like on a table top then give the stock some support on the edge that is not under the drum head. In/out feed rollers are recommended for stock 5-6 ft and longer.Dust collection is mandatory. And an ocassional cleaning of the paper is good too. Soft woods like pine dont do well as it clogs the paper rapidly. Hard woods like oak, walnut, et al work very well.Changing sand paper is easy. The handy tool they give you is still sitting in the package. I found that it was easy to change the paper with out it. Though my fingers are fairly thin, others may find it difficult to pull on the sandpaper clamp. The tool would be useful in these cases. Start on the outboard side and wind your way to the tensioner on the inboard (motor) side. I re-checked the sand paper tension after running a board after changing the sand paper and found it not necessary. The right hand side has a tensioner on the sndpaper clamp and it keeps the sandpaper taught. Only a little practice is necessary and changing sandpaper is easy.The sander came nearly perfect on the paralellism. It is easy to see that it could be a bit frustrating to set paralellism if needed but no more than say setting jointer or planer blades. In fact it should be a bit simpler as there is only the one drum to set. Careful snugging, checking, and then tightening of the bolts should eliminate any creep in the adjustment.I did notice a curious oddity when making a thin piece of veneer od about 1/16" thick. The drum was making contact with "something" when lowering it down to the thickness of the veneer. It turned out that my dust collection system had enough suction that it was actually picking up the belt. The belt appeared to be tight enough and closing down the gate partially for the sander solved the problem. The sander doesn't need a large volume of air as the particulate size is rather small. Not often when things work too well that causes an unexpected negative consequence. I don't make veneers very often but this most certainly is one of those "not in the book" things you learn.In short this is a great machine.
summary: Jet 22-44 Drum Sander w/ closed stand

reviewText: Was expecting black, not mad at all. AA is nice for ease of finding batteries and it was only bought for a non-critical need (fiddling in a computer case). Would not recommend for heavy use or if your life depended on it but a beater to put in a drawer just in case is a perfect use!

It has 96 holes (I guess, I never counted them), but I doubt it could hold that many tools unless you have an incredible screw driver collection.  The larger holes are not quite big enough for hammers, too big for screwdrivers  or chisels, so why are they there?  It does bend with a load over time.  For the same money you could find a couple of scraps of wood, a few screws  and drill your own holes to make a rack that is truely useful!  I came by  mine as a gift, so I don't have anything in it.  I wouldn't buy one.

I bought the bandsaw and riser in February 2006.  I choose the Powermatic because of the features:More powerful 1 1/2 motorLarger table: 15 x 15 tiltable table with 5x15 fixed wingCarter Quick Blade Tension ReleaseRoller Bearing GuidesFrame mounted gooseneck light fixtureCast Iron Wheels (not aluminum)Cast Iron Table TrunnionChip Blower (small compressor on motor)Included fence and miter gauge.The saw lost a star because of the riser block alignment issue- well known to the manufacturer, and all the sleep I lost before assembleing it.Assembly went about like a kid's swing set. I spend 8-10 hours over the period of a week assembling and aligning the saw.  If instructions were better and the riser block was right, it could be whittled down to 3 or 4. Don't let the manufacturer's screw up with the riser block alignment worry you.  Take your time, follow the ZEN of bandsaw alignment, and everything will align fine. You should either read the books with sections on band saw alignment, or get some help from someone who has, before assembling this saw.Wheels were round and faces were flat.  Table was remarkably flat.  Blade guides adjusted right up.  Quick tension release is awesome (releases all tension from the 1/4" setting).  Everything fit (with some help from the Stanley Tool Company)  worked right and was of good quality.  Saws like a hot knife through  butter (Timerwolf  blade).  In the end, passed the nickel test with flying colors (it ran with 2 nickels for 20 minutes till I shut it off- couldn't even see the nickels move).  The saw is remarkably quiet too.I had my doubts during assembly and alignment, had to cut off the Riser Block Pins (on advise from PowerMatic Tech Support)  as other users did, but now that its done, I made a good decision and bought a very well made, high performance saw that (so far) exceeds my performance expectations.Read the discussion thread I started (bottom of this page) for details on run-out, assembly, and alignment of Saw Serial Number 05125833.
summary: Buying this saw was a good decision.

reviewText: This isn't a light you will be using all the time, but when you need it, you'll be glad you have it! This is something that sits on your keyring or in a kit. when you happen to be without your main flashlight, and need to look for something, or read in the dark, most men always have their keys in their pocket, so even when you are without your main light, you will almost always have this. 10 lumen is enough to do most any task that you would want a key-chain light for.

When i received this tool actually  i shocked, the packaging was not that good as all of stanley tools, but when i collect the tools i impressed, its simple and functional,i recommend this tool for a friend
Very handy saw for quick jobs....happpy with the power and simple features.  Not the right saw to use if your planning on an all day job.

Great price! I had a shelf-building project that required cutting 2x4s and 1/2-inch plywood - nothing big. The saw performed well. No problems. It comes with a blade, but not a blade holder. Also, it doesn't come with a case. I bought the matching case off of Amazon for $50 - a bit pricey considering that is more than half of the cost of the saw - but it fits the saw perfectly, has storage for you blades and has a clamp to keep your blades in place. I don't regret buying it.  I already had three 18v batteries that came with another Dewalt power tool I purchased years ago, so I was good there.
10 lumens is just right to check a patient, or find your keys without blinding everyone. Good jacket zipper pull also
summary: Makes a great ID badge light

reviewText: I am remodeling a house, and needed a tool to cut through grout and wood.  Maybe they include really cheap blades with the kit, but I was really disappointed in the performance.  I needed to cut through a thick line of grout at a door--it took forever and totally dulled the blade.  I next used the wood cutting blades to try to neatly cut oak flooring I was removing where the floor went under cabinets.  The blade burned and smoked and dulled and I gave up.  I've ordered a dewalt angle grinder/cutting saw that I should have gotten in the first place.Update:  A month later and while cutting flooring nails off reclaimed oak floors three of the little "nodules" on the OIS accessory holder popped off.  I don't know the minimum amount required to hold an accessory on the tool, but I am probably close.  These are not particularly thick nails--they are the kind that are used in pneumatic floor nailers.  I really should send it back, but I found a place online (toolpartspro.com) that has the replacement part for less than $7.  I'm hoping I can replace it easily myself, but I'd buy another brand if I had it to do all over again.

I recently upgraded to a Dewalt 18V drill, so I bought this bare saw to go with it.  I just spent a good part of the weekend building a deck and stairs for my spa.  This saw rocks.  Very light, very easy to handle both right and left handed.  The trigger safety is an easy reach.  I can't say enough good things about this saw.

I would've given this 5 stars, however, this is the first wood filler I've ever used and I have nothing to really compare it to.  So, let's just say it works, like it should.  Dries solid, and it's easy to sand.  But, it tastes bad on toast, so, 4 stars it is...

It has 7 LEDs with a reflector that illuminates the whole of my 17" keyboard. That's good. It clips to the edge of my screen with an actual clip so isn't dependent on having a USB port in exactly the right place. That's good. It has a long enough lead to reach anywhere on my computer or my USB hub which is somewhere among the jumble of cables at the back. That's good. The lamp has a neck that allows me to put the light head in exactly the right place and it stays there without sagging sadly. That's good. It's the first and only keyboard light that has all those advantages. That's excellent!.However... After three months four of the LEDs have died completely after flickering for a couple of days. So it's down to just three and that ain't ay use at all. Shame, really, because it's otherwise a well-made and designed gadget.

Just got this in and haven't had a chance to use it yet, but I can assume that it will work as well If not better than normal duct tape. I will say, I do like the size of the roll. Not too big where it will get in the way.

I got this for my 12 year old niece. One problem was that the shade was "dented" on one side - most likely from shipping. However, my resourceful sister (niece's mother) gently took a hair dryer to it and solved that problem (the inner shade lining is made of plastic). I let my sister and my niece try to assemble it themselves. They had just a little problem properly snaking the electrical cord through the base, but otherwise it was straightforward. So, just a little mechanical aptitude would be helpful during assembly.It looks good, everything fit well enough (the lampshade was tilted a little, but that should be easy to adjust), and I'm sure the two drawers are perfect for hiding away favorite items.I think this would make a great "just because you're you" gift for any young girl.

This box was not intended to keep a determined thief away from valuables.  If you think your going to protect highly valuable things in a thirteen dollar box then please think again.This box could easily be gotten into with a pry bar or strong screwdriver, but not in a hurry.  This box is to serve as a deterrent or to discourage a thief on the move.This is a perfect box to put personal items in that you don't want others to see or have access to.  If you have kids you can keep items in it that you don't want them to see.  Also, if you have company, this is a great inexpensive safe to put private things so visitors don't see or have access to your private things.Recommended for specific purposes.

Pro:* easy to install - a splitter needs to be connected to the water tank for connecting the washlet water hose, and a mounting plate for attaching the washlet to the toilet, more information regarding size and fitting can be found on Toto's website. It took me some time to install only because the threads of the plastic connector on my water tank is worn out* air filter really works* 2 energy saving modes for seating warming, one you can set to activate for 3/6/9 hours every day, another that's automatic based on your usage pattern, and they can be used together* water hose uses quick disconnect fitting and the washlet just clicks onto the mounting plate, allow the entire unit to be removed quickly without any tools* the lid and seat can also be disconnected from the unit without any tools for easier cleaning* a water filter built into the water splitter prevents the unit from getting clogged, it can be removed and cleaned* there're buttons for the basic functionalities on the unit itself, allowing operation without the remote if neededCon:* the spraying wand is a bit too far back, I need to sit further back than I used to and set the wand to the front most position* the lid is really flimsy, definitely can't be used as a seat* this purchase is a choice of lifetime, once you get it, there's no going back. I know I will always be getting one if I ever move again or this unit breaks down.

I should've bought this a long time ago.  Thing is great.  Got the special $20 bucks off fathers day promo witch makes it even nicer.I can't believe how bad my old saw was in comparison.  Love the quick change blade release, super easy deck adjustment for bevel cutting.  Good balance, power, etc. Even the exhaust blows the dust out of the way when cutting.  Nice touch.Bought the assorted blade kit that comes with the plastic storage case as well.  Quite happy with that as well.

My wife bought this for me after completing a planter box project for her.  She knows I like Dewalt tools and am pruning out my Ryobi inventory piece-by-piece.This saw looks great in the Amazon ad, but when it arrived I was a bit disappointed.  The box was not packaged well, as the saw was jiggling around in its container.  Good thing it's built well, because it could easily have been damaged if it were of lesser quality.  The lack of packaging material seemed odd to me.Next, when I saw the price my wife paid, it seemed hard to believe it wouldn't come with a case and battery  She knows I have other 18V DeWalt tools, so that's not a showstopper.  But, considering I have purchased a fine DeWalt 18V drill with case & batteries for $100, this seems way overpriced or under-accessorized.Finally, the real disappointment is the fact the ad states the saw accepts universal blades.  It does not!  The documentation sheet, which also is poorly laid out and hard to follow, states the tool requires t-shank blades.  Bear this in mind if you have a large set of universal blades you are expecting to use.As a consequence of the blade issue, I know am keeping my Ryobi saw just to use the blades I already own.
summary: Overpriced w/o battery & doesn't accept universal blades

reviewText: If you a serious router person at some point you will need and/or use guides.  This is a nice set, in a nice rugged case, to keep you organized, with common sizes you need.  I use them with my Bosch router and they work just like they are suppose to.
Moves a lot of air through the 6 inch outlet and very quiet compared to the other fans in my house. Well worth the money.

oneThis charger is way better than the OEM one that came with my 14.4 Firestorm drill. The old was a piece of garbage.  This charged up one of my old batteries that I thought was dead and gone, but it charged it up with no problem. You won't go wrong if you purchase this.  The maintenance mode kicks in once the battery is fully charged without over charging it. The maintenance mode also allows you to leave the battery in the charger without worry and you'll always have a battery on hand ready to go.

Been searching for this for several years.  I like the  driver  but the original battery and charger died,  and I couldn't find another.  Then Finally  I found both  on Amazon.com.  Both are here and cherished and working well.  Thanks.  Great items.  I think about you guys every time I use it.  ray-g

Anytime Tools 101 Piece Screwdriver bit set. This little tool kit has come in handy many times. I repair computers, and I do a lot of laptops. I can usually find a bit to get the job done with this kit. Would recommend.
summary: Anytime Tools 101 Piece Screwdriver bit set.

reviewText: It makes a motor based noise that anyone can hear.  But more importantly the display is not great.  It does the exact same motion over and over and it is easy to see that it is the same motion.  Wouldn't buy again.

I have carried various surefire and streamlight models for the past 13 years.  I carried them off-duty and when working plain clothes.  I went through multiple of each kind, and they both took two CR123 Lithium batteries.  I decided the technology has progressed to the point of using a smaller light for the same effect.  After getting the Fenix PD22 I wish I would have switched a long time ago!  It has more lumens than both of my precious lights, and I was able to compare the beam side by side with my streamlight.  The Fenix beam was brighter and crisper with a larger bright inner radius.  It was also over two inches shorter!  Not only is it significantly shorter, the diameter is 0.85" for the ENTIRE length of the flashlight.  For the surefire and streamlight models I owned it was a 1" diameter except for the last inch or so by the lens, which was significantly larger in diameter.  The Fenix's size makes in very easy to carry in a front pocket or cargo pocket.  I would highly recommend this and will be sticking with this model from now on.  I wouldn't feel comfortable carrying anything smaller as it wouldn't be possible to operate the tail cap with my thumb as the lens would be covered by my hand.
summary: Unbelievable light in a small package!

reviewText: I'm very pleased with this level. It has a solid feel, though not heavy because of aluminum construction. True, it does not have measurement markings or a 45 degree bubble but I don't use those much, so I don't miss them. Would certainly recommend to a friend.

keeps the angle simple for sharpening knives. its difficult to use with larger kitchen knives, but i can shave my face with my pocket knives. works great on knives up to maybe 5 inches or so. still works on larger knives but its more difficult.
summary: works great on knives up to maybe 5 inches or so

reviewText: I ordered this attachment because I needed to work in a confined space. The device worked perfectly, and it made short work of the task at hand.  It was worth every penny just for that situation alone, but now I have this excellent tool in my collection, ready for any right angle situation that comes up.(th)
summary: Right angle drill adapter perfect for tight quarters

reviewText: I used this timer to have all my exterior Christmas automatically come on at 5:00 pm and off at 11 pm. Works great. No more running all around and plugging inflatables up every day. you'll love it!!

In an effort to be energy conscious, I have been replacing the incandescent bulbs in our house with more energy efficient ones.  I started out using compact fluorescents (CFLs).  The newer ones work great, are cheap, and the color is pretty good.  However, I don't really like the looks of the CFL spiral tube in table and floor lamps, even though the shade usually covers them.  They are fine in lights with globes though.So, when LEDs started coming down in price, and they were making ones that looked like regular bulbs, I thought I'd give it a try.After I started out with a Cree 60W, 5000K bulb, I turned to the 2700K.  The 5000 was too "harsh" for indoor, and my wife almost gave up on them completely.Luckily, she let me pick up the 2700K, and liked the soft light it put out.  The come on instantly, unlike fluorescents, and I have not seen any flickering at all.  I get plenty of brightness - at least 60W equivalent (for about 10W).  Some peopel have mentioned a buzzing, but I have not noticed anything yet.  Then again, I don't have these lights on a dimmer.The bulbs work great in regular sockets, but they "feel" a little bit larger then traditional bulbs (that could just be my imagination).  They are certainly heavier and more solid.  The bulb itself is covered with a rubbery material that feels sticky, but I have not seen any dust accumulation on it after a few months in the socket.These bulbs should outlast me, so I have systematically replaced all of the table and floor lamp (anything that will move when I do) bulbs in the house.  No problems yet.A significant investment up front, but lower power bills and rare replacement costs.  If you are looking for a way to help the environment, safe power, and, eventually, money, try these out.  Start with one, and then by in bulk later on for more savings.
summary: Great value and performance!  Cree is top notch!

reviewText: Difficult to use and understand. No connector I have purchased has lived up to my satisfaction. None lasted too long either...

I replaced my kitchen LED that was extra Warm with this.The reason was the Warm light was just too low and made cooking a bit of a pain.If you have a work area that needs strong illumination & you want to save on the long term cost - get this bulb.
summary: Really is bright, light feels natural

reviewText: I purchased this kit approximately two years ago, for a major remodel with a lot of framing and interior finish work.For the price, it was a pretty good value -- enough to get me started. I added a Hitachi framing nailer, which is a bit air hungry, but the compressor supplied it adequately.The compressor is noisy -- high pitched and tinny with a bit of a ring to it when it shuts off, pretty unpleasant to listen to. But it's small and portable (and inexpensive), and that's the more important factor for consideration, right?However, after about 6 to 7 months in service, the air regulator failed and required service. I'm not exactly sure what happened, but the red adjustment knob felt as though it wasn't engaging anything internally, and I could no longer adjust pressure. It required service, and Bostitch directed me to a near-by service center, which unfortunately took a couple of months to return the unit to me. Any other compressor could have used an off-the-shelf regulator, but with all the molded plastic on this one, I think I was stuck with special parts.(It's not really pertinent to this review that I bought a different compressor, and gave the repaired Bostitch to my dad, who appreciates it though doesn't use it much.)The nailer and staplers that come with have been reliable performers, and as a combo kit, I'd still recommend this for moderate-duty use around the home with little hesitation, though for anyone earning a living off of these tools, a compressor with standard issue gauges, regulator and connector might be a safer choice if a repair is needed quickly.
summary: Good kit for the price, despite the Compressor problem...

reviewText: This 24 inch long steel breaker bar was an essential tool for two water heater anode rod replacement jobs yesterday.

I've only had this machine a couple of weeks but it's seen some heavy use with my planer and drum sander. I don't have my ductwork installed yet and just using flex hose to individual machines and a 55 gallon drum separator. There is no doubt that this machine will do the job when properly set up.

The white light is very nice as it allows me to see clearly.  The lamp was easy to put together, but it has no real fasteners to keep the pieces together, so occasionally, I must push on the parts to make sure they're firmly seated.The light it produces isn't super-bright on either setting, so it's only good for directed light on something you're working on.
I use a few of these in my home, Kidde is a good brand name and at this price they are a good value.

I bought this for my Fenix TK30 which is only a 1" body. It is difficult to put in because of the additional ring on the body of the light. It's a very tight fit, but I'm sure it will stretch (break-in)and work great. Taking it out is much easier.I seriously doubt that this thing could stretch enough to fit a D-sized light. At least not with any normal effort. My guess is that if one could get a light of this size into this thing, it would be a major task and not worth the trouble.As to the quality, it seems to be very good. And I think the pivoting feature could certainly come in handy.

Ok, so I'm a girl. But I've been on my own-manless-for 20+ years so I'm handy w a screwdriver and all that huff.ASSEMBLY:This piece has wires you have to connect-snap. Done. But then you have to stuff it all up inside the base of the lampshaft--a bitch. Mine just would not go. It took several attempts to stuff it w/o getting one of the connectors blocking the teeny screwhole (which blocked the screw)or wires/pinch it when I tried to re-assemble to the base. So I layed it down horizontally again but rested the lamp head on a chair with a cushion, and tried yet again. See, the shaft thing just doesn't set DOWN far enough into the base to align the screw-holes. I tried 4x before I finally stood it up, wiggled and waved it around like a dancing fool until it seeded itself DOWN to where the shaft screw-hole and the base screw-hole aligned to actually be able to secure it with the iddy bitty screw.It only took 15 minutes but what a bitch!
