reviewText: I moved into a rental, and they only had 1 garage door opener.  I ordered two of these to use in my cars, and left the original opener inside the house as a backup.  I did the auto/self programing function on the garage door opener (Craftsman) and it took a couple tries, but eventually worked.  Sometimes the door doesn't open, but I think it's because the switch itself on the door opener isn't that great of quality.  If you give it a nice hard push, it seems to work well.

For me, this is exactly what I was searching for to use as a keychain type of measure! I removed the smaller O ring on the lock and placed my regular larger keychain O Ring and this is now my regular keyset. Everywhere I go I have my tape measure with me, how handy is this!Yes, this is small and not as heavy duty as the bigger Stanleys are, however, because it is lightweight and small, it fits into my jeans pocket even with my keys on the O Ring and quite easily. Here are the pros:PROS:+ This is 34 inches long (and I find it long enough for me to measure most things while I am out and about).+ It locks the measurement--what I do is firmly move the locking part all the way down. To unlock and put the tape all the way back in, I push upward and back the tape goes!+ Reading the tape - For a small 1/4 tape, I was pleased with how well I could read the measurements on the tape.+ Usefulness - Does what is supposed to do - useful for traveling on the go. This is not meant to be a heavy duty 50 foot or 100 foot 1 inch wide tape, it is meant to be just what it is - a small, lightweight travel tape.Highly recommend this Stanley lightweight measuring tape!
summary: This small Stanley PowerLock Key Tape is a perfect on the go tape measure!

reviewText: I replaced the light switch in our laundry room with this Lutron sensor switch with solid results.  It was a pain in the neck entering the house from the garage in a dark room, and feeling around the wall for the light switch.  A motion sensor seemed liked the perfect solution.Installation was easy, just flat out replace the existing switch, lead to lead, but please note that this is a SINGLE POLE switch.  It will not easily install if you have more than one switch in the home activating the lighting fixture.  It also comes with several options.  There is a small programming button on the side, that you can use to adjust timing of the sensor, or even its use (ie. motion or as a photocell that clicks on when it becomes dark).  I have it set for five minutes with motion.  So we can do laundry or bring groceries in without it switching on and off during the process.My only knock is that upon first glance, it feels a bit 'cheap'.  The cardboard box it is packaged in feels cheap and looks ugly, but I'm not keeping it around, so it's not a big deal, however, it set a tone that had me a bit skeptical.  The instructions come in english, spanish and french, but they are poorly designed and it was hard to find the information I needed in a jumble of different boxes and languages.  Again, not a big deal as the actual switch seems fairly well made, if not entirely attractive itself.Overall, its a great little item, and several visitors to our home have already commented on how it was 'cool' to have the light pop on as we entered the garage.  Another good idea at a good price.
summary: Easy to install, Quick to react.

reviewText: The small size of this LED flashlight makes it ideal for traveling, especially when one doesn't want to wake one's partner in the middle of the night as you move around the room/cabin.A bright, focused light source that illuminates clearly the necessary area.
why is black and decker selling parts to a tool that can't be used?  see tool for an explanation.  please!
You pretty much can't pass these up.If you don't loose them they should last a long time. I wish I thought of this. Actually I wish I had invented the internet..............

This is really an excellent product. We use it in our mud room to automatically sense our presence when we're coming in from the garage to light up the mud room. We also have it set to auto-shut off after 5 minutes of lack of motion. It works great. We have a cat and I feared that it would turn on the light when sensing the cat crawl into the room. We set the light on low-sensitivity and it does not sense the cat. I like how there are some programmable options including light sensitivity, amount of time to auto-shut off, and others.

Having never used diamond sharpening blocks before, I purchased these as an experiment.  They perform better than expected.  Having used them, with water stones for a finish, I found them very useful.  So well, in fact, that I intend to buy the larger and longer versions for really serious sharpening, along with the "grip" needed to hold them flat and in place.Well worth the low Amazon price, if you have never tried such "blocks" before, and are curious about their utility.
summary: An economic way to test the utility of this type of sharpening.

reviewText: the GE 45605 Z-Wave Technology Duplex Receptacle are fantastic.  i now have 2 and they connected to my existing security system and are working flawlessly.  Only downside if you use the plus that are flat with a right angle it does make it a bit challenging to get to the on/off button.  There is also a nifty blue indigo nightlight when the outlet is not in use.

This Leatherman has just about everything I need. The best feature is the 4 tools that open when the pliers are closed. It is a bit heavier than the others I own, but not too heavy. I own and use several other multi tools: Leatherman Crunch and Freestyle, as well as Gerber Original Multi Tool, Crucial, Suspension and Mini Suspension, and a Craftsman multi tool that has a needle-nose vise grip pliers on it(Kershaw A100c). The WAVE fills all the gaps that these tools leave open, as I have never really found a good use for the vise grips, and the Gerber tools are not as sturdy and most are now made in CHINA. Also, one handed opening is not a big deal to me. I bought the pocket clip and lanyard ring, and plan on buying the bit sets and extension as well. This is just a well made and well thought out tool. If it holds up to the medium duty use i put most of my knives and tools to, I will probably have this for the rest of my life.  My only gripe is the phillips head is still a "cross driver" albeit the best one I have seen yet.  It is my understanding that this can be remedied by buying an adapter, so maybe I will buy thatI ordered the Leather/Nylon combo sheath but Amazon sent me the all leather one. I liked it so much that I did not bother to send it back.
summary: Best Multi Tool I Own IMO Superior to GERBER

reviewText: A definite must for the cabinet maker, keeps everything nice and square, the aluminum is great because it is light and never rusts.
Love the look and feel of this sturdy tool bag.  I use it with a large sturdy leather belt ordered separately.

The woodpecker clamp rack is definitely a very elegant storage solution for your bar clamps. The triangle design of the bracket itself definitely appears to be a stronger design than other clamps where they just appear to be an L bracket with some slots cut in them.I do have the clamps attached to studs but I definitely don't have any worry with them being fully loaded with 48" clamps.All in all a great space saving way to store your clamps, and it's made in the USA at an excellent price.
Smart as expected. Looks great with its minimalist fashion. Love the remote access. Only thing not intuitive is the dial direction - I tend to expect it to be opposite of how it behaves.
Best Carpenter Square I could find.  Nice clean sharp edges for precise markings.  Works great, easy to read.

I've had this for about 5 months and use it to turn on a lamp automatically.  Never had a problem with it and it works great with my Vera Lite controller.  I really like the fact it has a second unswitched outlet on the unit.  Very convenient.
summary: Works flawlessly with MiCasaVerde Vera Lite

reviewText: I bought this as a backup and would likely look for a heavier gauge plastic if I were planning on using it for any length of time. It did arrive in good condition and will likely work for a while should I need it...
summary: Lightweight, doesn't seem like it would hold up...

reviewText: I read some of the reviews prior to buying this product. Some of those reviews made me think twice. I finally realized the worst case scenario if I don't like this item: I'll have to pay for the return postage. I purchased it and installed it on my Makita mitre saw. Here are the areas where some of the other reviews were amiss: 1) The laser line is way off. Not true. The laser line puts the cut immediately to the left of the mark. 2) Installing the laser puts the blade out of balance. Not true. There is no difference in my case. 3) Installing the laser causes the bolt to rub against the blade guard. Not true in my case. 4) The laser isn't bright enough in a well lit area. Not true. I have 3 dual tube shop lights near my mitre saw and I can see the line quite well. Here are the areas where some of the reviews were right on: 1) the laser is not adjustable. True. I wish it were adjustable and I can learn to compensate. 2) The laser doesn't turn on unless the blade is turning at least 500 rpm. True. This is my only issue with this product. It's not a good idea (in terms of safety) to have the blade turning while you line the work piece up. It would be really neat if the laser came on PRIOR to starting the saw.
One of Leathermans better tools. I bought this with the 40-bit assortment Bit drivers and they fit into the sheath with the tool.
I have used this for about 6 months.  No problems so far.  Works well.  Nice to have the longer hose to cover the entire garage.
whenver we are on a job we always reach for My studfinder now. This really is a great unit and worth the money. I've owned it for 2 years now and its still working great.
summary: Best stud finder I have owned

reviewText: No complaints at all with this. its hard to go wrong with this square. sturdy, good quality, nice and square

I have never used any sharpening stones before. These have sharpened all of our knives, a wood chisel, and a hand plane and the results are simply amazing. Five strokes on each stone is enough to sharpen every knife to razor sharp edge. I hope to be using these for many years.

This is a very solid but limited use multitool. I bought this and a swisstech one and will keep this one and give the other as a small gift. It's about 2 7/8" diagonally across and seems like it would be hard to bend. Also hard to gain much leverage with to bend though I guess. Not much of an additional to my keyring, in between a car key and it's separate fob it doesn't seem like it will cause any issues in my pockets. It will likely come in handy if other tools are immediately available.

We had old fans from the 80's and they were loud. We hated them. These Panasonic fans are a revelation, you can barely hear them and they do the job. Excellent product, I bought 3 more to switch out the other fans in the building.

This an OK knife, sold for a very low price, but there was a problem with the frame lock on the knife that I received that makes it imperative that you only use the knife with great care.  The knife uses a frame lock – a piece of metal that prevents the blade from closing.  However, while the lock did engage on my knife, only about half of the thickness of the locking piece did so.  When engaged it did lock the knife blade, but I worry about it slipping, enabling the blade to close on my fingers. I was able to open the knife one handed, but the lock only engaged when the blade is opened with some force, making it imperative to make sure that the lock is engaged before using the knife.I am a fan of coast flashlights and they are my go-to lights that I use in preference to all the others that I own.  I was therefore surprised to see a coast product that was not assembled with the care that I have come to expect from their products.  Ordinarily, a possibly defective safety feature would be enough for a one-star rating, however, many pocket knives do not even have any sort of lock, and that while I fear that the lock might slip it has not yet so, so I am giving the knife 3-stars, with the very strong caveat that one use it only with very great care.  The lock on other knives may be OK and if it were, in view of the price, I would have given the knife four stars.  All that would have been required for the lock to fully engage was a little grinding on locking piece, and this may be the case for other knives, but not mine.  This looks like a case of poor quality control, which is not surprising for a knife sold at this price, but is for one bearing the Coast name.The finish of the knife was OK, but as others have remarked, one of the screws holding the wooden inserts was raised a bit instead of being recessed along with the others, which is another example of poor quality control.  The blade was reasonably sharp, but not overly so. The knife lacks a belt clip, but has a lanyard hole on the frame.
summary: OK, but the frame lock was poorly done

reviewText: I bought two of these. They are very intuitive and a great value. Both came in the same box and shipper. 3 Months later, one works and the other just stopped. It is a good light for minor ambience settings. It's not gonna be strong enough to impact a room with other lights on, or plant. Consider buying a 9w if that is the case. It is pretty directional, but not pin light.
summary: AMAZING!... if you get a good one

reviewText: I put it on the side wall which doesn't get direct sunlight. It never turns off. The sensor needs to be less sensitive so it wouldn't turn on during fair amount of light.
summary: Don't use it if your area is not super bright

reviewText: I bought this to yank the motor out so I wouldn't have to replace my whole Ventamatic attic fan.  The motors have the same dimensions, and this one allowed me to upgrade to the lower-energy motor.  swapping took about 5 minutes.  It lasted the summer fine, and was quieter than my old one ever was.  I even got a buck at the recycler for the old motor.

I tinker and repair... that's just who I am.  Unfortunately, too many manufacturer's decide to use specialty screws to prevent folks like us from gaining access to products so that we have to return them for repair, or throw away and repurchase.  A tool kit like this contains just the bits you need to open and repair these products, which can save you tons of money.  I've repaired coffeemakers. vacuums, fans, and countless other items with these bits.  I had a smaller set for many years, which I loaned out and was never returned.  This particular set is far more complete and is an well-made, and a tremendous value for the price.
I like this flashlight. It is small, basically a key chain flashlight great for those dim lit restaurants when you can't read the menu or when you need to see your keys to open a door lock at night.
These bits make drilling into concrete a painless affair when used with a rotary hammer drill. They hold their edge well and are tough and well contructed.

I use these in my RV for the outside "porch" light and for the indoor shower fixture.  It's cool that they got LED in a plastic case like this.. the light output is very nice and appropriate color for those area.
summary: excellent for wet-prone areas in your RV

reviewText: I live on a street where all of the houses look very similar.  More than once I have cruised right past my own driveway.  I realized that I needed to make my house a little more identifiable after a co-worker drove me home and I couldn't even tell her where my house was without her creeping slowly down the street until I could see my garage behind my house.  Enter this little gem.  I turn on the switch before I leave. It blinks on then turns right back off, but is burning brightly when I get home at night.  I then turn off the switch until I leave the next day.  I can pick out my house no problem now.  Perfect!
summary: Does exactly what I hoped it would

reviewText: A quality bottle opener. The pry part is good for opening paint cans & cleaning grunge from under your fingernails. The screwdriver part is better than nothing. The phillips on oppisite end is worthless. Opening bottles does great. Made in China. Nice order add-on to complete Super-Saver shipping.

I got this system to encourage me to drink more water because I can't stand the taste of my well water here.  After my brother installed this system for me, I now have really great tasting water! Instructions were written clearly, and it took him about one hour to get it put in, even after drilling a new hole for the spigot (instead of just using the spray nozzle hole).  One drawback is that the water pressure is pretty low when getting the filtered water, but then my original water pressure is only 40 PSI and that could be the reason.  Also, having the filter system installed has not reduced the water pressure when using the faucet, which is good news.  One nice feature of this system is that you can remove one filter at a time (has 3 filters) without having to shut off the water.  Filters are pretty expensive to replace, but only have to do so every 6 months...works out to about $9 a month, by my calculations.  The spigot looks classy and sleek on the sink, and I look forward to not buying bottled water now.

Just want to add my vote to the other reveiws.At first I was concerned about the half width allen bits (they are called something else). But they actually work very well. I even take it with me bicycling.I don't wear it on my belt so I looped the Wave case flap through the bit case loop. That way they are always together.
Replaced a GE slim model, this was a great choice.Dislike the trouble in removing the built in plug, should of come free with out so much cutting, a bit dangerous to be slicing it up, otherwise fine.

I am not a plumber and I did want to have to pay someone an arm and leg to get a small job done the "right" way. I had to make several cuts on some copper piping and had to find a quick solution as I had to turn off the house water main. To make sure these would work, I had an extra Shark Bite and I put it on an extra piece of copper piping I had laying around. Once it was on, I could not get it off for the life off me. I used slip joints, hammer, screwdrivers and nothing could get that Shark out. So after reassuring myself, I installed the other Shark Bites, left the sheetrock hole open to make sure it wouldn't leak and after a week, went back and checked for leaks and absolutely no leaks. This stuff works. It's a month now and no leaks. I highly recommend these Shark Bites if you don't want to worry about replacing a whole line or don't want to deal with soldering copper.

This is a very good buy, but there are a few problems to work around (nothing huge).  First, this will only work if your plumbing is tucked away inside an INSIDE wall.  Because there is no heater, you need the warmth of the house to keep the water room temp.  If your plumbing is in an OUTSIDE wall (window wall), the plumbing will not stay warm enough to use the bidet in Dec-Mar if you live north of S Carolina.  Second, the plastic piping that connects the bidet device to the house plumbing is difficult to attach to the little nozzles at the connection point.  STRONGLY advise that you attach the white plastic piping to the main bidet piece BEFORE you install.  Once in place, it will be very awkward to reach and it requires a lot of hand strength to attach it correctly (wait for a non-damp, low arthritis day).  Third, the plastic piece that screws on directly to the bottom of the toilet tank is not well designed.  The screw-on bolt DOES NOT rotate independent of the rest of the little piece. That matters because once you tighten it into place you will have to attach the other end of the white piping to the little nozzle on it.  That nozzle may be facing away from you once the piece if fully tightened and it can be tough to attach things at an awkward angle.  Solution: ALMOST tighten the plastic part that attaches to the toilet tank;  rotate toward you so you can affix the white piping, THEN fully tighten the screw-on bolt to the bottom of the toilet tank.  Having said all that, it's not really so tough.  The directions stink, though, so you need to have a good idea of how it will work before you begin.  It's pretty logical.  Apply the above tips and you should be home free.  To test: put plastic wrap over the seat and turn it on.  You should see a strong stream of water hitting the plastic wrap.  Do I really need the plastic wrap to test?  LOL, yes.  Or you will be soaked from the stream of water.  Final note: if you have an old house and no one has done any plumbing adjustments for quite some time you will need WD40 to loosen the existing screw connections if you do not wish to strain yourself or damage the existing lines.  Just spray on the treads, wait 2 minutes and slowly turn.  I wasted well over an hour discovering these tips and making a foolish mistake.  I hope these tips help others do the job quickly and happily.  BTW, once you have the old toilet seat off, it might be a good time to replace it.  My folks had an old, heavy wood seat.  I got a new plastic, soft close seat and lid and they are happy about that.  Just make sure you buy ROUND or OVAL (elongated) to match what is there already or it won't fit right.
summary: Amazing bargain; no electricity; minor probs to solve (solutions listed here)

reviewText: This product provides plenty of light it just needs a longer extension.  still better than the other two I purchased at the same time because the light it produces is brighter.

It's compact ~ weights only 4.1 ounces ~ easy to understand and use ~ and provides instant troubleshooting information.I'm 5' 4" ~ but with the four ft. extension I'm able to touch the highest fluorescent bulb (11 ft high) in our garagewith-out a ladder to do a lamp test.1. Lamp test ~ This checks if the bulb is good and works WHETHER the bulb is in a fixture OR NOT in a fixture.Touch the surface of the light bulb with the probe & hold down 'lamp test' button.This excites the gas in-side the bulb and if the bulb is good ~ it lights up.If the bulb is in a light fixture, the fixture should be turned off.I checked my pile of old spare bulbs (9) which I've had stored for years, right where they lay ~ in less then a minute.And with fluorescent bulbs under attack for revamping, and the new are half the size of the current 1 1/2" dia size,I've been stocking up so I'm not forced to buy new fixtures one of these days.Sooo ~ another wonderful use is that I can check every fluorescent bulb I buy right in the boxbefore I store them away to know I didn't receive any defective ones, it's un-common ~ but it happens.2. Pin Check ~ Slip the two pins in the slots on the back of the tester ~ the filament under the metal capis used to excite the gas inside the tube ~ press the button and if the pins and filament are good the light will come on.Check both ends of the lamp. Obviously ~ the bulb isn't in the fixture with this test either.My only disappointment with this tester is ~ the pin test is for dual pins only and doesn't work withsingle pins ~ or recessed double pins ~ but of course the other tests work for these two.3. Verify Voltage ~ The red light continually beeps any-time it's near electricity.This checks whether the ballast is good by verifying the presents of electricity,when holding the probe near the input and/or output of the ballast, the fixture must be turned on.(this isn't checking if the ballast is O.K., it's only checking there's electricity to the ballast)(The tester senses any electricity ~ incandescent bulbs ~ wiring ~  phone wires ~ etc,so this is also a handy tool for testing the presents of electricity for other purposes)4. If the bulb passes the lamp test ~ and pin test ~ and if voltage is present AT the ballast ~but the lamp isn't working then the ballast (or fuse) is likely bad.Compatible with all fluorescent light bulbs. It tests bulb sizes ~ T2 - T4 - T5 - T8 - T9 - T10 - T12.Does not work with LED and incandescent (standard) light bulbs.Awesome ~ doesn't even cover how amazing and helpful this tester is.We have 6 fixtures in our garage and 3 lamps that use florescent bulbs so I appreciatethe speed this tester sorts out the problem.The tester saves a lot of guessing, going up/down a ladder.The tester is held with one hand, and only has one button to push, and yet gives a wealth of informationI highly recommend this product.Kit includes ~1. Test probe ~ which can detect voltage from 90 volts to 600 volts with-out contact.Includes a 9 volt battery, (battery is expected to last for 500 tests)2. 48" Retractable antenna ~ Easily snaps on.3. Case ~ Nice quality, cloth ~ zippered case ~ roomy. Holds all parts and booklet with ease. ~  'Amprobe' logo nicely stitched.4. Instruction book ~ 4" X 5 1/2" and 1/4" thick, thank goodness only the first 15 pages are English.Has a 1 year warranty.Amprobe has been around since 1942.Footnote: The ballast in a fixture is designed for a certain wattage. Bulbs need to be that wattageor they won't likely work when installed even though they check to be good.
summary: Check Fluorescent Bulbs ~ WHETHER - OR - NOT ~ In A Fixture!

reviewText: I don't have a mp3 player so have not tried it with that.  pretty good reception long life on a battery. would like it if you could charge batteries as well, but the lithium batteries require a pretty sophisticated charger so i imagine the price would be much higher.  plenty loud a little bassy. overall i like will be great for camping trips too

This was a great purchase - it arrived promptly and worked the first time. Sears told me my logic board was bad on my garage door opener and suggested I buy a new one. It didn't make sense to me so I took a gamble and ordered the remote. Glad I didn't listen to Sears and simply replaced the remotes since the "craftsman" brand remotes tend to lose their security + functionality when the batteries die and revert to the old rolling code technology. I'd highly recommend these as replacements to your craftsman openers or for spares if you have a number of cars like we do.

Great strength, comfort, and grip. Industrial quality. Perfect for electrical work or mechanical. If building a tool kit for home, tradesman or apprentice put the extra pennies and start with Irwin, you'll get some years out of it. I haven't regretted it, to think my enthuasism for this brand started with a measuring tape.Amazed at how easily this thing cuts through steel wire, without a scratch.
summary: Ideal size, I'm sticking with IRWIN.

reviewText: I have borrowed the blue-shelled version of this recently. It seems to be the same sander. Pro is that you can use your own, cheap sheets on this. Con is that yes if you do side to side action those sheets can come off. Also a con the motor is not that powerful so you can bind it up if you press too hard. This is a more capable sander than the mouse-type ones. Sanding any kind of a medium or large surface on those isn't fun, so this does a better job. However, after using this and wanting more power I bought a pretty cheap belt sander and it was like being reborn. The thing destroys roughness in ways this sander could never begin to dream about. So if you have serious sanding to do don't bother with this, just get a belt sander. Otherwise this is definitely better than going by hand.

It is a good respirator, well constructed, copmfortable and reliable. One no - not every pair of gogles can be worn simultaneously with it.I have just taken one star off my rating after using the respirator for a while. I find it mediocre on comfort. It is bulky, doesn't move air as easily as I would like it to and its strapping mechanism seems a bit weak to keep it tightly applied to my face. Incompatibility with glasses is a seriuos impediment.
I gifted 2 of these to family & they are so pleased that they can use it to automatically turn outside lights on & off at the same time each evening/night.

I bought this for use around our RV when I need a little extra reach and it's come in very handy.  It feels light as a feather, yet is sturdy and quite rigid when used.  I love the way it easily pops open and locks in place, yet is quickly closed and carried with one hand.  It's nice and compact when folded.  I'm very happy with it.  Manufactured in Germany.

After owning another Wixey product: a remote planer readout and being absolutely delighted with its accuracy and repeatability I tried the table saw fence readout to couple with a new Vega fence. The readout unit installed on the left side of the fence locking mechanism with only one drilled hole (which Wixey even supplies the drill and screw for, a really nice touch since drill size and self-tapping screw size is a critical combination for a trouble free self-threading)). I had a bit of trouble, however, setting up the system, as the readout unit needed a bit of adjustment to get it to slide onto one of the two pieces of track that fit end-to-end. At first I couldn't see how it could slide on one piece and then bind up a bit on the other one since the two tracks were within 5 thousandths of one another in the part that the readout slides on. But the directions say "loosen the screws on the back of the readout" until the unit slides freely but without any slop. What the directions didn't tell me was that I needed to actually [carefully] pry the unit apart slightly to get that screw loosening to do anything. I was a bit paranoid to go prying apart an electronic device for fear of breaking it and having a bigger problem on my hands. So, I contacted Wixey and got the skinny on how the readout unit fits together (in one day by email - pretty darn good customer service - and from a guy named "Wixey." That sounded good to me!). At his direction I pried it apart slightly to get it to loosen up just a bit, re-tightened the screws a little bit and then did that a couple of times to achieve the required free-sliding, but not binding condition. After that little hick-up it works like my planer readout - perfectly and repeatably. Wixey is the way to go if you want dead-accurate and repeatable results. I've got some other brand digital readout devices and not all of them "keep their brain" and must be re-calibrated periodically (or in the case of some brands - must be constantly re-calibrated). I have not had to re-calibrate the planer readout at all since setting it up (which was easy), and it is dead on every time. By "dead-on" I mean within a hundredth of a millimeter compared to digital calipers using a spiral planer cutter head on perfectly set-up planer in-feed/out-feed and bed rollers .002 above bed). I love that! So far in the two days of use, cutting some pretty expensive 10 quarter Walnut it has produced (with a properly set-up Vega fence)some cuts that are the same on the readout as with digital calipers. Sweet. If it were a perfect world this readout would have 2 AAA batteries in it like the remote planer readout rather than a big button battery. Remembering to turn it off rather than waiting for it to turn itself off should extend battery life until that little caveat is addressed in the next iteration. I wouldn't wait just for that to buy it now though. I wish someone had made this thing 25 years ago. I wonder how much time I've spent collectively just setting my fence with a tape measure over the years...  Get it now. You won't be sorry.UPDATE: After several projects including a walnut and cherry double chest of drawers I am glad to say the Wixey gauge is still dead on. I only had to recalibrate it once when I re-calibrated the parallel of blade to table slot. The Wixey makes fast, accurate and repeatable cuts. I don't even check the results much any more (after about 200 times because of paranoia)since they are always right.

I love the retro design of this lamp. It looks like something straight out of the fifties. Even the on/off switch looks like something you'd find on an ancient appliance. It's a gorgeous lamp, but as soon as I turned it on I realized I just don't like the light quality of the fluorescent bulb that came with it. It's too bright and somehow it feels institutional, like something you'd find in an office building or a hospital. It's not a pleasant kind of light, and because the lamp is fairly low and close to the surface of my desk, it's even more annoying. So, A+ for design, but I wish they'd used a different kind of bulb.
summary: Beautiful design, don't like the bulb that came with it

reviewerName: Ken Esq "Four Stars isn't a negative review..."
reviewText: I wasn't expecting much for the money, but got less. They're cheaply made, but I would have lived with that. One worked and was okay...the other didn't detect any motion other than being dropped from 6 inches on my desk. Back they go...if you get two working units they're probably worth the money...but don't expect much.

My opinion of energy-saving LED lights has changed drastically in the past couple of years.  The energy savings are excellent and the LED science has improved so much that we're gradually changing out much of our interior and exterior lighting from incandescent to LED.And now this Brightech LED floor lamp has surprised me with the amount of light it offers.  Rather than the diffused, warmer light of an incandescent, the LED lamp provides a directional cool and very bright light.  If, for some reason, you choose to adjust the arm of the lamp to close body proximity, you'll be amazed to find how little heat it puts out -- unlike an incandescent or especially a halogen bulb does.  The on/off function is via a thin toggle switch behind the actual lamp head.The floor lamp has a sleek, modern look with a brushed silver finish.  It's highly adjustable and moves smoothly to each new adjustment.  It has a limited swivel at the base of the adjustable arm and that arm then extends/retracts easily.  The lamp portion itself will rotate easily to find your perfect position.  It's height varies, of course, depending on the degree of articulation you've chosen -- but its size works great as lighting behind or beside a chair/sofa or extending over a desk.  The actual lamp head is somewhat small at about 5.5-inches diameter at the widest point of the flared opening and about 4-inches in depth.The lamp arrives in double boxing.  It is SO simple to assemble, that you'll find it will take you longer to extract it from its ample packaging than it does to put it together.  There is a small one-sided sheet of mostly illustrated instructions.  While the instructions are not very detailed, I'd have to say that you don't *really* need them.  It becomes obvious pretty quickly how the three components fit together.The heavy base will give you an upper body workout (or maybe I'm just a weenie).  It weighs nearly 12 pounds which helps it to stay put where you decide to place it on the floor.  The ends of the middle piece are shaped differently so it's readily apparent which end attaches to the base.  Included with the lamp is an allen wrench with two differently-sized ends for tightening the appropriate screws at the base (the larger screws) and to secure the adjustable arm to the middle pipe section (smaller screws).  Probably not a bad idea to hang onto the allen wrench in case you need to re-tighten the assembly screws or the adjustable arm screws at any point.The cord is nearly 9 foot long and can be tucked into a channel that runs the length of the lower pipe section.  There is a section near the AC power supply where you can separate the cord via a connector in case you need to thread the cord through a small opening that would otherwise not accommodate the size of the larger AC power supply (perhaps office furniture or hidden electrical outlets).The bulb in this lamp is not replaceable; however, its expected life is about 20 years.  I can DEFINITELY learn to love the idea of never buying and changing out light bulbs for 20 years.Sample provided for review.
summary: 4.5 Stars -- Bright white light in a very adjustable floor lamp

The staplers, made in Sweden, include a staple gun for thin material and upholstery and a hand stapler for thick stacks, etc. These are high quality staplers and will do almost anything you can imagine using a stapler for around the home or office. The set include a box of 5000 5/16" staples, made in France, and a box of 5000 1/4" staples, manufactured in China.  These heavy duty products will not disappoint and the Rapid 90062 Combo Kit is practical and useful.

This is an excellent product, a very sturdy ladder and the handle bar makes balance and holding accessories a breeze.  It folds up nicely for storage.  It was exactly as advertised, a great value for the price and the perfect height for washing trucks and campers.  It also works great for pruning trees and shrubs. ...to fit a 12 ga wire.  I was trying to fit them onto existing wires in my yard and try as I might, I couldn't get them to close/connect on the bigger wire.  I bought 14 and that solved the problem, but cost me $38.

reviewText: I HAVE MANY LEATHERMAN UTILITY TOOLS, AND THIS ONE IS A GOOD ADDITION TO MY COLLECTIONS THAT INCLUDES MANY OF STANDARD MUSH HAVE TOOLS, BUT ALSO SOME NEW FEATURES FOR SOME DIFFERENT APPLICATIONS.  GOOD CASE TOO.

Happy with this holster. Been using the leather one which started showing signs of severe wear to the point of the belt loop breaking. I've always used leather holsters and usually patch them up. This time I figured I go with the nylon. This has all the features of the leather holster plus one more: a hole in the bottom in which I could slide the tool into while opened in it's plier position (actually I cut that type of hole in my leather holster knowing the nylons had it).The side elastic holders are great for whatever small things you can think to put in them. I don't smoke but I keep a lighter in one and my Leatherman bit extension in the other. I've got two small safety pins to pinch the elastic holder a little tighter for the bit extension. The internal pocket is great for holding the multi-bit holder and does a better job than the leather holster's. It's a bit deeper in which the main tool doesn't catch onto while sliding in.The only thing I don't care for on this nylon holster is the Velcro fastener. I prefer a snap button fastener. The Velcro is too loud, too strong, and sometimes wants to hook onto certain shirts I wear. I'm going to modify it by removing the Velcro by it's stiches and installing a snap button. Once I do that it'll be a 5 star.

I bought a "key cabinet" and needed key tags to identify and keep keys organized. These tags are just what I needed. Excellent quality, white plastic, a hole for hanging, with another hole & small ring at the bottom for the key itself. Label each tag with a permanent fine tip marker.

We used to only purchase Delta brand faucets for both our personal property as well as rental real estate however, when the quality started to deteriorate, we tried out Moen and soon became big fans. In fact, bit by bit we've been replacing the kitchen and bathroom faucets to Moen brand products so when this came up for review, I jumped at the opportunity to give it a try.We already have two other Moen faucets - high arch with a pull out sprayer - but a bit less costly than this but neither comes anywhere near the same quality of this one. The attention to detail and quality of every part really shows through and although this might cost a bit higher than an average unit, it compares favorably in features and quality to units priced substantially above this.Weight is substantial/solid, ceramic insert, fluid feel when in use, very attractive appearance. The picture doesn't really do this justice - initially I was a bit worried that it might not fit large pots etc well as we've been using a pull out faucet but found this to be of not real concern.Last but not least, be sure to check Amazon...as of this writing, this exact same faucet was being sold by a big box store for over $150 more!Very nice quality item!

About 22 years ago, my first wife (now ex-wife), bought me a Workmate 400 for Christmas. It was the most useful and versatile tool for 17 years. I still own the 400, sort of, but it sits in my sister's tool shed some 170 miles South of me today. I do mini-projects around my wife's house, such as a fence, a deck, enclosing the patio, etc.,etc. I have been sorely missing my workbench.I ordered this Workmate 225, because it looks a lot like my old 400 and it it is very reasonably priced. I am building a step-up platform to our deck in the backyard, which sits about 14 inches off the ground. The step-up will provide a 6 inch transition from the side, up on to the deck. I ordered this Workmate on Thursday and it arrived that Saturday, via Amazon Prime Saturday delivery at no extra charge. It arrived undamaged and in perfect condition despite a large hole on the side of the box. Thank you FedEx. I spent about 35 minutes Sunday morning putting the pieces together. By 08:45 a.m., I was already using it to cut 2 x 4 treated lumber with my power saw. Although it's not as "polished" as my old 400, it's still as functional and just as versatile.  Also, this unit is much lighter and easier to collapse and set up than my old 400. However, being lighter it doesn't provide the more stable platform that my heavier 400 did, but that being said you can add to the stability by putting your foot on the step.For the price and utility it provides, despite being made in China, it is definitely something that no serious home-improvement enthusiast should be without. It's a good bargain and indispensable if you're sawing lumber. I recommend it.

This paint does what it advertises! Some of the reviewers seem to have believed that this paint would be self luminescent like a flashlight, glowing day and night. This paint only REFLECTS light back to the source of the light, and it does this VERY well - especially considering the price. I painted grill inserts for my Jeep, expecting so-so results, perhaps nothing due to the reviews. But for the price, I decided to try it anyways. Well, this is the coolest looking paint I have ever seen, almost mesmerizing when it reflects the light back, nearly invisible in the day.Update July 30th, 2010 - I have since sprayed this paint on my rocker guards and the effect is great. Draws attention, period. The reflecting is bright enough to draw comments from strangers, and although it is going to take a few more coats to make the reflection of light uniform - that is ok. The entire purpose of this paint is to draw attention. I feel better now driving through intersections with a car without doors when I know that everyone who is remotely paying attention will see a bright white bar under my car. Great nightime safety addition that looks good in the day as well.As a note - the instructions really need to be followed EXACTLY. I painted my rocker guards with two cans, and the can held at an angle. Worked okay. Then patched up a part that I sanded down while holding the can vertical - no comparison. Repainted both sides with one can while following the instructions exactly (duh) and it is much more reflective.

I have a Leatherman Wave and a Leatherman Wingman. The two tools are about the same size, although the Wave is somewhat thicker.Despite having "Wave" in the name, this pouch is way too big for the Leatherman Wave. It won't fall out, but there is lots of extra space at the top, bottom, and sides.This pouch is rather ugly, the seams curl up, it is a bit asymmetrical, and the construction uses what looks like black glue.Nonetheless, it gets the job done and it seems very durable. I will use it.

It does not and can not work on side mount plus the instructions ramble on without any clarity.  They are pointless for any installation as if a bunch of words about the lever equate to instructions.  Very disappointing and certainly not worth twice the money over std levers.  I only bought it due to the side mount claims which are completely false.

It is amazing you can buy something like this for only $17.  A microcomputer to control heating and/or cooling.It took me a half hour to wire up this unit in an extension cord, and we use it to control heat in our chicken coop.Beware that it uses ONLY Centigrade, so you do have to convert.  The user interface, such as it is, is a typical engineer interface (remember the interfaces on 2-button LED watches?).  But once you get the hang of it, it is easy to set the temperature set point and the differential (the amount between turn on and turn off, or hysteresis).I would have liked degrees in Fahrenheit, but I have a conversion app on my iPhone...
Low profile plug, with 13A and 1625W rating. Good performance and great price. I am going to buy 3 more of these. Save yourself the hassle and just buy 5 to begin with!

I'm really sold on HitLights. I purchased quite a few of them and really like them. I use the cool white bulbs in the kitchen and the soft white ones--which I really prefer--elsewhere in the house. The Kill-A-What confirms the power usage exactly at nine watts.

Easy to assemble. durable. This is a good router table, and does everything I would want it to. It's quite compact, in that it's intended to be a tabletop. I'm glad I bought this vs. going down the path of building my own router table and jigs.

Whether you are laying tile, concrete or vinyl - the Bosch GSL 2 Surface Laser will save you money and time. The old fashion way would be to use a straight level or board to check to see where the floor was raised or dipped in and mark that area with chalk. What happens if your straight level is not long enough or your board is warped? This is where the Bosch GSL 2 comes in. With it laser technology to cuts time in half and you will have less headaches.Here is how it works. Place the level in a corner where you want the entire floor to match. Turn on the laser and adjust the height of the GSL 2 until its two laser lines come together as one on the floor. With the remote control start scanning the surface of the floor and all you need to do is watch for the lines to split and circle those spots with chalk. It is that simple.With a remote control, you are able to sweep an entire area in just minutes, finding trouble spots that would have taken hours the old fashion way. It does not matter what type of scanning you need it to do - small or large space, the GSL 2 will be able to tackle it.Range - up to 30 feet without target plate, up to 60 feet with target plate.

I bought a kit like this about 2 yr's ago. I own a cabinet shop in MD. So for installations its one bag of tools instead of several seperate boxes to carry in the home. I have noticed the sawzal runs the battery dry very quickly. As does the circular saw. The cold drains the battery's as well. The drill works well in any material. The bags support rods have poked thru the bag @ the ends around the zipper area. Lucky for me my install's need little cutting on site. So my three stars reflect the cost vs. the outcome. I do not use these tools everday. The batteries do have the charge indicator lights to tell how drained it is before you use it. If nothing else the Drill is a excellent product in the V28. If your a handy man and wish to use this bag of tools everyday you may be disapointed in a year.

I may have been expecting a bit too much of this poor tool (who has now gone to tool heaven).It was so convenient for light tasks like engraving and polishing.  I strongly endorse getting the key-less chuck if you will be swapping bits and tools a lot.  So this is a very versatile and convenient device that holds a charge very well.It held up as a drill for a while.  But repeated use drilling into pine boards caused it to crack and stop working.  It was a good bridging tool but I have up-graded to something a bit more robust now.

this is what you need if you are going to be putting on many handles and knobs in your kitchen, bath, etc.,  I did three houses worth with this device.  flawless.  Mark, punch, drill and screw.  it is that simple.
summary: Yes.  makes putting on those handles and knobs a no brainer

reviewText: First off, I am NOT a general contractor or tiler, or any other kind of flooring craftsman. I got this tool hoping it would help with a series of wood and tile floors I'm planing on installing in a couple of weeks. My house is old and I know that the current floors are an uneven mess, so I'm sure they'll be even worse when we strip off the existing tile.I agree with the other reviewer that the level measurement plate (the white board that shows you how uneven your floor is) is kind of a pain to use. However, once I figured out what I was supposed to be doing and got comfortable with the remote, I found it to be a simple and adequate way to test deviation. It is very important that the unit be sitting on a totally flat spot when you shoot the laser. Anything more than 4 degrees off and you will need to move the unit (because it won't self-level, a function the level attempts to perform when you turn it on).Of course my floors are old and shockingly un-level, so it wasn't difficult to see the discrepancies on the level measurement plate for the preexisting flooring. In a couple of weeks my construction pro will show up, rip off the old floor and be able to use the tool on the sub-floor that will most likely need pre-flooring prep. Although he has been a general contractor for almost 25 years he has never used this kind of level and is very interested to try it out.This is obviously a very specialized level and one I would think was indispensable for somebody in the flooring trades. The level is very easy to set up and comes with batteries if you don't already have a Bosch rechargeable battery. Like the other Bosch tools I own this level is extremely well-made and substantial.  The use and set-up  manual was very easy to follow, and it probably took me about an hour of farting around to finally figure out the best way to operate it.People might consider this a dumb point, but I'd like to say how much I like the toolbox the level comes in. Unlike every other power tool I've ever bought, this box is roomy and doesn't require a degree in origami to get the tool back into the case after you've finished using it. There is ample room inside the case and it also has snaps on the bottom that will connect to other Bosch tool boxes and make for more convenient carrying.
I would recommend this product to anyone who needs a door chime. It flashes as well as chimes. We use it for our business and the distance is a pluss

I bought this bag, and it really does put all my other tool storage solutions to shame. I like that it keeps everything organized and in view. I can zip it open, roll the panels and snap them down, and put it on my workbench when I'm home - then just zip it up and take it with me if I need to work elsewhere. No more 'two tool sets' problems!Just a note - you can slide a hammer through the large d-rings where the shoulder strap attaches. There are nice touches like this throughout the bag.Very solidly made, it should outlast me.

We have been using these alarms for about 6 years now and wouldn't think of doing without them.  I initially bought them because a house we were remodeling had some issues with the floor drain backing up.  They worked so well that I ended up scattering them about the house, positioning them on the floor near all water sources.  My husband had installed new plumbing throughout the house, and apparently one type of PVC fitting we had used was faulty.  The alarm alerted us to a water leak that could have caused tons of damage to our newly installed drywall.  We had used these same plumbing fittings throughout the house, and two more eventually failed as well.  Fortunately the alarms alerted us to these water leaks.We have placed these underneath all of our sinks and beside our water heater and washing machine.  I bought some of these for my son's house, and they have alerted him to an overflowing laundry sink, a copper pipe that had corroded and sprung a leak, and a sump pump that had quit working.This is such a simple product.  There are two metal connectors beside each other.  When water comes in contact with these connectors, they sound an alarm.  To turn it off, just dry off the connectors.  My daughter did have a problem on occasion with the humidity on her basement floor setting the alarm off.  She now places those on either a thin piece of cardboard or a piece of fabric.  The water still reaches the alarm, but the humid concrete floor doesn't set the alarm off needlessly.I'm really amazed that more people don't use these alarms.  They can save you so much trouble and money by alerting you to potential water damage.  Just look around your house and think of every water source you have and what damage would be done if you had a leak.  These little alarms are inexpensive and priceless.
summary: This little alarm could save you BIG money in repairs

reviewText: I admit, I was a bit perplexed with this lamp at first.  It shipped in a smallish 6" cube. It's a featherweight at half a pound.  It's convenient with a decent length white USB cord... but.. what to do with it? Ahhh.. it's PERFECT for my husband's desk.  I found a pretty wine bottle and had it sitting on his desk when he arrived home. He LOVED the new lamp on his desk!  It's perfect so he can see his keyboard in the dark without having the overhead lights adding heat to the room. I found I'm perpetually keeping my eyes open for other neat glass and plastic bottles to try with this lamp.  So many are absolutely perfect. So far I've found it sits pretty on wine bottles and many different glass or plastic soda bottles.  Remember those 1970s sleek neck glass soda bottles that were stretched to elongate the neck?  Those would be PERFECT bottles to give this modern lamp a retro look.Now what to do with it?  It sits pretty on the computer desk, plugged into the USB port. When the computer is on the lamp has power.. when the computer is off?? Okay, well we all have those USB cubes, just plug it directly into the wall...... but I live outside the box.  I kept this lamp in the back of my mind the past few weeks as I've gone about my daily activities.  The power went out one stormy eve.. we were without power about 8 hours.  I needed a lamp.  A light came on in my head.. I grabbed this lamp, and a USB battery recharger such as theSatechi 10000 MaH Portable Energy Station Extended Battery Charger Pack for iPhone 5, 4S, 4 & 3GS, iPad 1, 2 & 3, Samsung Galaxy S2, S3, S4 Sprint Epic 4G Touch, Blackberry Playbook, HTC Flyer.  WE HAVE LIGHT ! !  NOW we're talking !!  These things are GREAT for backup light when the power goes out!  They are also great for camping purposes, as we learned recently at the annual ARRL Ham Radio Field Day!  Again using a portable USB battery charger, the lamp stayed lit while it was needed.  Need a light for your camper? Kids need a light in the back of the suv at night? This lamp just has soo many uses!I now intend to get more of these lamps for every day use around my home, now that I've realized they are PERFECT for us disaster preparedness types!!  I have several of the small USB battery chargers, now I just need more of these lamps!So my recommended uses for this lamp includes:* Anywhere you'd normally use a soft lamp, such as bedside, or by the computer.* Portable Light - camping, RV, or those who transport animals, it's a convenient little light.* Emergency Light - versatile for backup lighting when the power goes out* Anywhere you'd like to have a lamp but cannot run a power cord (you'll need to switch out those USB battery chargers as needed)Anyway, it's a great gadget, so I took it to our local ham radio club meeting. Other hams agreed, it's versatile and perfect for so many uses!  Did I mention how the guys kept playing with the capacitive touch, blinking the light in morse code style?!So.. shhh... one of the ladies said she's going to get this lamp for her father for a unique gift. It's outstanding for gift giving and is a great conversation piece.Satechi provided this lamp for reviewing purposes.  I honestly absolutely love the lamp, it's a TEN STAR item.  Quality made, versatile, stylish and MODERN.
summary: *** Step outside the box *** MANY USES for this USB LED LAMP *** Makes a very unique gift ***

reviewText: I have a full set of Dewalt tools that all use the 18v XR and XRP batteries. These batteries seem to have almost twice the run time than the standard batteries. The standard charger that came with the set charges all the 18v batteries so no extra purchases to get a new charger too. Some tools like the large 1/2" impact and the circular say did not run long enough at times to finish the job and even having 2 batteries I was waiting for one to charge up. Now I can do almost everything I need to do with just one battery so I have the second one for backup or the next thing I want to do. Great upgrade, I highly recommend it.

Routers and circular saws need guides to cut perfectly straight.  This is a great guide that has always worked well for me.  From simple door trimming, to precision sizing of dining tables and furniture building ---> this has worked well.I use it with the emerson wide jaw.  You mount a scrap of wood to the wide jaw, and trim it on one side with a circular saw, and on the other side with your router.  This is a great way to align the guide to your cutline.  The directions for the clamp and wide jaw show you how.I have three sizes, and occasionally I set two parallel to each other to rout a perfect groove.  With the router guided on both sides, it is impossible to mess up the cut!Good stuff.  The low profile of the guide also helps.  No clamps to get in the way of your tool.

In addition, you don't have to worry about this one rusting, which seems to be a problem with most of the other stainless steel caddies. As always, you'll get the best price here. True, it isn't as big as many of the other ones, but you may not need one that big. I used this because I love Dove soap, but as anyone who has kept any type of soap with a good amount (as compared to other soaps) of lotion in it on those built in shower soap caddies...it get's mushy and mushy fast. And when it isn't getting mushy, you end up playing foot hockey with the thing when it slides off said built-in shower caddy. No more. I installed this thing with ease, and now all our shower condiments, or whatever you call them, are out of the way. I tested the strength of the caddy by putting a decent amount of downward pressure and they seem to be pretty sturdy. They even give you an extra set of adhesive for when you end up moving it later on down the road, or if you just messed up the first time around trying to install it. There are also general replacement adhesives at any moderately-sized grocery or warehouse stores in cased you messed up twice or you fantsy moving apartments often. It's not shown in the product pic, but there's actually a little hook with two prongs on the end that you can hook your back brushes (or whatever else) onto. You just insert the non-pronged side sideways into the little slits you see on the caddy and then turn it flat so it "attaches" onto the caddy. If you're having trouble visualizing the size of the caddy and whether you can accommodate your shower condiments (I'll figure it out, eventually), you can fit a decent-sized (meaning non-Costco) shampoo/conditioner bottle and a bar of soap on each end, and a bar of soap right in the middle. You might be testing the strips this way in the long haul though. Overall, this is a great buy that solved more than one problem for me. Two-thumbs up.
summary: A great substitute for the larger shower caddies.

reviewText: This kit is pretty abundant and a great upgrade from our smaller traditional kit.  It has everything you can use including eye wash and one time usage cold patch.  There are quite a but pieces over 73 in a plastic container.  I haven't been able to confirm if the case is water resistant but will update my review if I find the claims to be bogus.  Until then 5 stars.

CAUTION:  THIS RATING IS FOR THE 21 DEGREE NAILER; THE F21PL.  I would only recommend a 21 degree nailer, NOT a 28 degree one.  The 28 degree nails are more expensive and hard to find.This is the real deal.  It slices, it dices, it shoots nails through everything (EVEN WOOD TO MASONRY!), it hangs joist hangers, and oh yeah, it does regular framing tasks too!  I love this gun!  It's not even that heavy.  It feels pretty good in your hand all day.  I don't want to put it down.  We used to use only Porter Cable FR350A's, which are also wonderful, reliable, tough, and recommendable guns, but I like the versatility of this one better, and the extra power.  I can lower the PSI on our compressors with this gun to 80-90 for most tasks.Pros:1)  POWERFUL2)  CONSISTENT3)  TOUGH (We use this to smash joists etc. into place when we don't have a free hand)4)  GREAT AT TOENAILING!!!  (This should be #1, because it sets toenails better than anything I've seen)5)  Lightweight (for its size)6)  7 Year Warranty7)  Push Button Depth Adjustment (but not as convenient as the Porter Cable's)8)  It works even at lower pressures9)  Easy rotating exhaust10)  It shoots my favorite 21 degree full head plastic collated nails (They're usually the cheapest too)Cons:1)  Bulkier and bigger than Senco, Max, and Paslode (You can't fit into every crevice and gap)2)  No Dry-Fire Lockout feature like Porter Cable's to prevent damage from chronic dry-firing (firing on empty)3)  You have to let the gun run out of nails before reloading with the common plastic collated nails, or nails may feed incorrectly causing jams and misfires.  There is a new brand of nail coming out soon which prevents this problem completely.  They're called "Lightning" something or other.  They work great, and are cheap

Priced right. It is thin, but in accordance with its quality. I love the SF Giants baseball and Halloween theme. I got mine to double up and line the backside of my outside work bench. It has helped tremendously with cutting down on the noise that reaches the inside of the house. If you want a nice thick moving pad, I suggest you spring for one.

reviewText: I really works well with a long range. The sound of the doorbell is crisp and clear. Would recommend it to anyone.

Fantastic multi tool! The only thing preventing me from giving it 5 out of 5 score, are the locks on the blades. If they're not being overly sensitive one day, the next day they get jammed. But besides the blade locks, the tool is fantastic. I can't get over the smooth gears. They actually allow you to open the tool with one hand, as opposed to other multi tools, that usually require a struggle.

Flashlight warns to only use unprotected batteries so I bought it with the Supernight 26650 unprotected batteries.  The batteries are 65.6mm long approximately which makes them a bit short for three to be long enough to make good contact with both contact springs in the light, causing flaky operation.  I ended up making a approximately 9mm long aluminum spacer with the edges insulated with Kapton tape to improve battery contact in the light.  In other words the light current draw is such as to require unprotected batteries but the battery tube is sized for longer protected batteries it seems.  DUMB mistake.  I estimate output as quite high with the supernight batteries and the spacer but no more than half the claimed amount and as soon as the light gets warm it shuts down so I suspect that my sample is defective.  Will probably return.Now appears to have died completely after only a few minutes of operation.

I bought a different kind of light that was like this awhile back and it seemed to work better then this one does, but this one works well enough.  Surprisingly enough, women get more of a kick out of this nifty little light then men do?

I gave the Bosch scanner 4 stars because it does work decent for the most part depending on where I am in my home. But I think I would have given it 2 or 3 if I was reviewing it on only finding studs - especially in my garage where I know almost exactly where many of them are already and it is off enough to make you possibly miss the stud if you were going off its reading.I think I have more stud finders than just about anyone and they all have their pro's and cons and "sorta" work depending on the application. I guess I am just determined to find one that works for all applications and it seems some come close (like this one) and others are plain crap.Honestly the last one I bought before this (can't remember the name but it's sold on Amazon) was basically a set of 4 yellow plastic covered magnets and they work perfectly at finding the studs - how funny (but obvious) is that? That set was something like $5 - $10 I think and it blows away most all electronic models I have when doing the basic task of locating studs.I have watched several reviews of this scanner and it seems to work well with the various types of scanning it can do although I cannot comment on those as I have yet to try them in an actual situation other than scanning areas I know have power going to them for example and it does recognize there is power behind the wall in that area.

This driver was fairly expensive ... and (admittedly) I was unsure if I was spending my money wisely. After using the driver for about a month I am now confident that Bosch makes a quality tool that logically commands such a price tag.I have assembled a multitude of structures and workshop pieces with this driver, forcing 3" coarse thread screws through dry lumber without any bogging down. My only trouble has been twisting the heads off of screws! - my fault for not properly setting the clutch. My friends are envious and will soon be purchasing this Brute Tough monster.
summary: Too much driver for a diy'er ... never!

reviewText: I bought two of these cutters, one for 12 gauge and one for 14 gauge wire. This handy stripper has a little notch in it which lets you cut the sheath part of NM or romex cable without nicking the conductors. You then just pull off the sheathing. This is great for wiring jobs where you need to strip off lots of sheathing, like panel installations and installing receptacles, switches, ect. No more wasted time with trying to strip off the sheath with a knife, not to mention cut fingers! A must have tool for anyone working with wiring.

great cool color...not super hot like the halogen bulbs these replaced.I purchased 3 bulbs for my round accent light things to replace the 10watt halogen...2 of the 3 bulbs just stopped working at the same time after 4 months of light usage..the 3rd...still running fine.UPDATE: as mentioned by the reviewer below me, apparently, these are the cool white version. I ordered 2 replacement bulbs...had exact same part number and description...but when I got them, they were the warm version....now I have 2 warm lights and 1 cool in my Ikea lights. Annoying...Cool white is white, not yellowish nor blueish...
