reviewText: This tool works just as you would expect.I've used it to put down 500 square feet of 3/4" red oak flooring so far, and have not had any problem:  no jams.The only negative I have is really mostly a user error.  I've driven 3 nails into the face of the floor instead of the tongue -- it's easy to do unless you pay close attention to where you line up the tool before you hit it.
summary: Does what it's supposed to do!

reviewText: These are good batteries and the price is great, when I wen't to the store I was shocked at the price, so I think these are a steel, and they do work and last, its all about money, quality, and free shipping
This driver is good, but it needs more bits that are more commonly used and less bits that are rarely used. Quality and feel are good.

The other reviews are spot on, I could not live without this!The bits are stored in the handle that slides out to expose the storage of the other bits. The handle is made of a strong plastic that has withstood my abuse quite well.I use this screwdriver A LOT and I know that everyone who has one loves it as well. If you are on the fence, go ahead and get it. You will not be sorry you did!

These are not white light (warm) or blue light (cold) LEDs - they are a significant dingy hue of yellow. They barely lasted 150 hours, nowhere near what any decent LED lamp should last. Of the 4 that I bought two were Dead on Arrival, and others have been used less than one month @5 hours a night. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THESE AT ALL.

Grandson's first stone - great size for a 12-yr-old to begin with, and handy with the included container of lubricant.  I DO NOT like the white Arkansas - it stores on the underside of the carrier, but cannot be mounted.  Very inconvenient and a stupid arrangement that makes grandpa peevish.

if you buy one of those cheap guns you will for sure need something like this. but save yourself some money, go to Lowes or one of those stores and buy a 3/8 or 1/2" cold chisel and then just grind a flat edge on it, you can get one for under $5
I put them in my radio and the signal was weak.  I took battery out and put it in my battery tester and they read 'Replace'.  The date on the battery reads: 03/2017?  Disappointed.

I agonized over what table saw I would purchase.  The best deal I could find on this was at Amazon, and after a lot of "hemming and hawing" I pulled the purchase trigger.  I couldn't be happier.  I am on my 5th woodworking project and they all would have taken MUCH more time without this unit.  It is easy to adjust, easy to use, and exactly the right size for my needs.  The stand is a true wonder!  I can store an/or move the whole unit around my garage very easily.  Be careful assembling the stand, though.  If you don't follow the instructions carefully, you'll wind up with something backwards.  The way things fit together is not particularly intuitive, so this is one time you definitely need to RTFM!hb

I have been pricing LED desk lamps for quite some time now, because my son has a desk under his loft bed, and I didn't want incandescent or halogen bulbs under the bedding.  I put this bulb in a table lamp that takes candelabra bulbs, and it's bright enough to work at the desk without generating a lot of heat or using a lot of energy.  I would buy this again.
summary: Giant bulb.  It's the size of a small banana.  Amazing price.

reviewText: Thes are good quality nails.  They work just fine in a Bostitch nailer without any jams or double feeds.  The quality of these nails seems to be very consistent.
Great for transferring gas, water , or any light liquid. We use it for gas to our generator in our fifth wheel. There is no other way to transfer gas, hatch is to small.

I have tries these for years now, this is the first one that I actually liked.  This gets hot enough, very quickly.  The gas last quite long, very long compared to most others.  It is durable and easy to hold.  It has a built in stand and a cover.  If yo need portability in a soldering iron this one is great.  I actually retired my electric one away, and use this one all the time.
summary: Best butane solder iron I have ever had

reviewText: What can I say energizer batteries kick but they last a long time and if you recharge them (special charger available on amazon) they will last longer. For me it was the great price that got me.
This little tool makes quick work of any soldering job, even metal cookie cutters, when the spot welds broke.

I have been soldering for a long time using many different irons over the years (cheap corded irons, professional soldering stations, cordless battery-powered irons, and other butane soldering irons). I feel qualified to comment on the Weller PC2 soldering iron:THE GOOD:+ Piezo electric ignition is easy, reliable and more convenient that traditional "flint" type ignitors which usually take multiple tries to start and worsen as the tip/flint ages. You simply press down on the ignition button to light it. So far this iron is a dream to start compared to my previous Radio Shack butane soldering iron.+ Exhaust vent on tip is located on one side of tip. This is important as it can help prevent burning your fingers and objects close by (wire, plastic surfaces etc) during operation (from the hot exhaust gas). My Radio Shack butane iron has vents around the tip and sometimes it`s easy to inadvertently damage things or burn your fingers if you are not careful.+ The tip that ships with this iron is a flat tip (two flat sides) which is better for soldering wires etc than the typical round tips. (I don`t think anyone is going to solder fine pitch SMD parts with any cordless soldering iron).THE BAD:- The biggest drawback in my opinion is the lack of an integrated fold-out stand as in the Radio Shack butane iron. With the RS iron you can unfold the stand with your thumb finger on the same hand you use to hold it (i.e. it`s a one-hand operation), which is extremely convenient and can prevent accidentally damaging something if you need to put down the iron & grab a part or more solder during use. The PC2 unfortunately has no fold-out stand and due to the round shape of the iron it WILL ROLL if you try to put it down. This is almost a deal-breaker for me for obvious safety reasons. If you are careful or use some sort of stand this will not be that big of a deal but considering that most likely you will be working in the field carrying around & using extra stuff is something I try to avoid.- The gas control is located at the bottom of the iron and requires two hands to adjust (one to hold the iron and one to twist the control). While this is good for safety it`s not great for convenience - you can adjust the gas control on the RS iron with the thumb on the hand that is holding the iron (again it`s a one hand operation on the RS iron).- The gas viewport at the bottom of the iron is pretty useless for establishing how much gas is left in the iron. For starters it`s white plastic which is not very transparent, so it`s hard to see how much gas is left. There are also no markings for reference. Finally the iron must be held horizontally to see any movement in the tank. On the RS iron the entire bottom of the iron is clear plastic so it`s very easy to see how much gas is left (especially if the iron is inverted).OVERALL, I am a little disappointed in this iron, despite the easy of ignition the BAD outweighs the GOOD. This iron could have been PERFECT if the above issues were resolved.

I was originally planning on soldering the connections between the LED strips under my kitchen cabinets, but decided that I'd rather be watching hockey, so I bought these connectors instead. I did have an issue with one connector, where one of the terminals was raised slightly, but a quick jab with a screwdriver pushed it back into place. These saved me a bunch of time, and are all functioning properly.
summary: Quick way to connect your LED strips together

reviewText: Dremel 400-6/90 400 Series XPR Variable Speed Rotary Tool Kit With 90 Accessories is an amazing tool, i use it a lot! for craving, polishing, cuting, everything as you can imagine, you can use it! always can improve this model with almost any attachment or Dremel Accessory

I did have to tighten 2 screws that hold the plate, but everything was there and it works as well as any new one would. There were no blems. The accessories were all there, new, as was the blade. Am totally satisified with every reconditioned name brand tool that I have purchased from Amazon.

Bought one that had to be sent back as it was recalled.  Amazon then sent me an e-mail on this one.  It's sturdy and I feel safe on it but it's just a bit heavier than what I wanted.  But I know I'm safe on it.

For the price...you can't beat Rayovac.  Blow away those cheap "heavy duty" batteries and last almost or just as long as the premium brands.  Amazon's price seems like it is the best other than Wal-Mart...who is priced about the same or just a little lower.  Well worth the spend!!

I got "hooked" on these about 11 years ago when Sam's Club sold a huge variety pack at Christmas. Back then they only came in 3 sizes, all white. I used plastic paint and sprayed some brown for my unpainted brick fireplace to hang stockings and a wreath on my wood door.  I also sprayed some satin nickel, bronze, and black. They work well on appropriate and properly prepared surfaces.I now have at least 120 in various sizes and configurations, like the pencil cups, cord holders, and shower mirrors. I even use the 3M strips to mount other flat surfaced items that are within the weight limit, like eyeglass holder rings, stationery rack, USB caddy, and razor holders in the showers. The only con is the price and the fact that the clear strips do not stick as well to items like like waxy plastics (think: Sterlite desk drawer organizers).PS: If the swing cup hook is annoying when you try to remove an item, place a strip of tape across it.
summary: I love almost everything Command, except the price

reviewText: I purchased this light based on the glowing review.  No pun intended.PROS:+Super bright+Adjustable beam+Small size (Flashlight is held flush in your hand if you hammer grip it; width is about size of a quarter)+Triple AAA batteries+Modes (Bright, low, strobe)+Waterproof, although I won't test it+Price, competitive with $80 flashlights IMOCONS:-Housing feels like aluminum.Overall:I am not a flashlight guru but I am specific in my needs when I purchased this product.  I wanted a high value (performance & low cost) handheld tactical flashlight to use at home.  I don't really care for a weapon mounted light on my glock & not in the mood to spend $80-$150 for a Smith Wesson or Surefire light.  The strobe feature is one of the only reasons I got this.  Amazon user Arc212 said that the flashlight does not have a momentary button on but mentions the momentary cycle.  This is something that should be expounded upon.  Once the flash light is on, the light can be disabled as long as you slightly depress the push-button but will reengage upon release; this action can also be used to rapidly cycle through the modes.  Basically I feel as though this light would be dependable for tactical purposes.The last bit I wanted to mention is that the flash-light fits perfectly in an army issued, 9mm magazine clip for your belt.  I picked one up for $1.50 at a local Army Surplus store.$10 awesome light, $1.50 for an awesome case.  Great savings.This light would also be good for non-tactical things like really intense campfire stories or signaling for batman.Update  6/11/13I purchased theFordEx Group 300lm Mini Cree Led Flashlight Torch Adjustable Focus Zoom Light Lamparound Jan. 2013 as a recommendation from amazon user Cole Southworth.  The FordEx flashlight offers the same, if not better, lighting power while possessing a much smaller size.  The bonus is that it runs on 1 AA battery - this really gives you a better idea of the size.  I would consider using this as an EDC flashlight if not for myITP Light A3 EOS Version 3 Modes 80-lumen Cree LED Mini Keychain Flashlight - Black
summary: Save yourself time & money, just buy it now.

reviewText: I replaced an old B&D circular saw with this new Porter Cable and the difference is beyond description.  This left blade orientation makes eyeing the cut as easy as can be for this right-hander.  I replaced the factory blade with a good quality Freud blade and in a side by side comparison, will out-cut my contractors table saw in speed and smoothness.  My typical use of the dust port is to just install the elbo and direct the debris away from me and the cut.  But if I am sawing anything with a high dust quotient like MDF, I adapt my shop vac and a hose to it and about 90% of the dust and chips are drawn away.  I don't use the vac most times because dragging that plastic hose across the work gets annoying after a short time.  Everything about the tool says quality and it just feels good in the hand.  Well balanced, well made, and most of the controls fall easily to hand when working with it or changing blades.  My wish for any improvement?  Include a small dust bag attachment and an adapter for a dust hose.  I spend a lot of time comparing and researching before I spend my money on new tools, and this one came out on top in just about every aspect compared to the competition.
summary: Power and smoothness.  A quality tool

reviewText: I just started a new framing project on my house and decided to get this tape based on the reviews. My old tape was a Stanley. Not a bad tape but it had some annoying qualities and was getting pretty beat up.So I grabbed this one and took it to work. First thing I noticed was that it fits my hand nicely. I have big hands and this tape feels solid.Second was the stand off, I extended the tape over 6 feet before it got wobbly and bent. Nice.On top of that the numbers are nice and big, it's labelled on both sides and even the catch has an extra tab on the top for holding down with your foot or whatever else you may need to hook it on.It's a great tape and I'm really happy with everything about it with the exception of one thing.The main catch doesn't extend past the rubber bumpers on bottom of the box. What's interesting is that there is a circular groove that is clearly for pipes that the catch does extend into, so if you're measuring a pipe you can just set the tape down on one end and drag it out. No problem. I did use it a few times to measure out some PVC and it worked great.But on studs and other boards you can't just set it on the board and drag, I kept setting the tape on the end and dragging but the catch didn't extend past the box far enough to hook the board so I'd just drag the box along the board without the tape extending. When you work fast this gets annoying quick.After awhile I got in the habit of using my thumb to push the tape out a bit so I could hook it on a board but I miss the way my old tapes hooked by just placing them on the board and dragging.It could be my bad luck and I just got a bad egg. None of the other reviewers seem to have this problem. But if you have worked with wood for 15 years and have formed certain habits, changing them for new equipment is frustrating, especially with something as frequently used as a tape. I'd gotten to the point where I didn't even think about it anymore so the little change was pretty dramatic.When I get into the HVAC I imagine the magnet is gunna come in really handy.For general contracting I'd definitely recommend. If you're a long time woodworker you might be a bit disappointed in the catch, I guess it depends on how you work though.Overall the pro's outweigh the cons and I still really like this tape.
summary: Great tape with one catch (or lack of)

reviewText: I've purchased several flashlights over the past couple of years ranging from 3 cell xenon's to 9-volt rechargeable LED spotlights.  This one by far exceeded my expectations more than any other.  Dollar for dollar, it is the brightest (even compared to flashlights 4X its size), most flexible, best made of the half dozen different lights I bought.It takes 3 AAA batteries in a removable battery holder.  It's light is very bright from its LED that can be focused from a spot to a wide angle by pulling or pushing the smooth action head in or out.  When its focused to a narrow beam the pattern of the LED actually shows on the object the light is shining on - fascinating.  Very well made, solid and smooth functioning.  I believe that the rapid pulse setting would definitely disorient anyone subject to its shine.Beware of similar small flashlights that use expensive 3.6 volt lithium ion batteries ($3 to $5 each).  Besides their higher price, they may not be as easy to get during an emergency, and they are easy to confuse with regular 1.5 volt AA batteries - easy to mess up your other devices if one of these is mistakenly installed.
summary: The flashlight bargain of the decade

reviewText: What I like best about this safe is the flexibility of the locking system.  In its most secure form it requires both entering a code on the keypad to release the lock and the use of a key to open the door.  Used in this manner you have something I like to call two factor authentication. I base my two factor authentication scheme on something you know (the code) and something you have (the key). If someone watches over your shoulder and learns the code it will be useless w/o the key. If someone picks your pocket and gets the key it will be useless without the code. (if those two people ever hook up then you're in trouble)But let's say you don't want to be bothered with the key or the additional security it provides.  All you have to do is leave it in the lock.  Now the safe works just like the ones in hotel rooms; you enter the code and turn the knob (which in this case looks just like a key) and you're in.Aside from that, the thing is reasonably well constructed.  You can bolt it down or just load it with heavy stuff. You also get a special key that will open the door without the code.  It's for when the battery on the keypad dies.  Best to put that special key someplace safe (but not in it).  There's even a little light on the inside of the door that's almost useful!For $75 it can't be beat.

I received the shipment in excellent very high quality pieces immediately replaced damaged parts for my car With new O-Ring  and everything is excellent. Very thanks for the product and the seller deserves 5 stars I will Deal with him again.

reviewText: I picked up a few of these when we did our remodel, They definately do the job, i would reccomend picking up a few.

In my line of work I like to keep up with new materials that are coming out from 3M as their new tapes and other materials are improved regularly.This set includes a lot of fiber glass related products that are heat resistant to rather high temperatures. Also the chrome tape came in handy for some product testing as well. These kits have proven very useful in testing different materials to fit our products.If you think this may have something that fits your needs get the kit to make sure as there are similar products in the kits that may fit your needs better after testing.
summary: A good kit for testing if products will fit your needs.

reviewText: The TapeCase Design Engineer: Solutions Seminar Tape Kit is an assortment of 3M tape products organized neatly in a plastic tray within a flip top box measured approximately 14.5" x 9" x 2.5". It contains 11 different 3M tape products in rolls and some pre-cut lengths.The Amazon product page gives you a description and pictures of what are included in this kit, but does not describe what each tape is for. A detailed description is actually included within the kit, which I paraphrase below, in case you find it useful.1) 3M Glass Cloth Tape 361* coated with a silicone adhesive for high temperature resitance* strong adhesion and an abrasion resistant backing* premium masking product with a tensile strength equal to 182 lbs/in* removes cleanly with little or no stains in most applications2) 3M PTFE Glass Cloth Tape 5451* silicone adhesive provides a high temperature release surface for protection and insulation* performs in many humid environments because its mosture absorption is close to zero* used as a release surface on packaging and heat sealing machines as well as pressing equipment3) 3M VHB Tape 5952* very conformable closed-cell acrylic foam carrier* bonds and seals simulataneously to withstand vibration, impact and weather* good adhesion to many powder coated surfaces and plastics* replace screws and studs for various permanent mounting applications* reduces vibration noise in assembled parts4) 3M VHB Tape RP45* double-sided pressure sensitive adhesive tape* bonds a variety of substrates including metals, plastics and painted metals* made of a closed cell conformable acrylic foam carrier5) 3M Aluminum Foil Tape 425* excellent reflection of  both heat and light* dead-soft backing which helps to protect against high temperatures and UV degradation* serves as an excellent barrier against moisture, dust, flame and certain chemicals used in aircraft paint stripping and masking6) 3M VHB Tape 4905* ideal where a clear or colorless adhesive is desired* its adhesive is suitable for high surface energy substrates including metal and glass* similar to a foam tape but constructed of a solid, clear acrylic material that provides excellent clarity* used to replace rivets, spot welds, liquid adhesives and other permanent fasteners7) 3M Adhesive Transfer Tape 9626C* features 3M Laminating Adhesive 360* provides more strength with less adhesive and odor* quick stick properties to many low surface energy substrates8) VHB Adhesive Transfer Tape F9469PC* utilizes the high performances of 3M Adhesive 100MP* excellent long term holding power with a higher adhesion strength than typical pressure sensitive adhesive systems* ideal for many interior and exterior industrial applications to replace rivets, spot welds, liquid adhesives and other permanent fasteners9) 3M Damping Foil Tape 2552* damping foil helps damp vibrations on metal and plastic surfaces vibrating at their natural frequency* features a pressure-sensitive viscoelastic polymer and aluminum foil constraining layer* effectively converts vibrational energy to negligible heat* reduces irritating noises and decreases wear and tear on parts10) 3M Dual Lock Reclosable Fastener SJ3560* much stronger than competitive hook & loop products* self mating which eliminates the need for male and female components* features a clear acrylic adhesive combined with a clear backing which allows the substrate color to show through11) 3M Extreme Sealing Tape 4412N* a single coated, pressure sensitive adhesive tape designed for difficult sealing applications* the backing consists of a very though yet flexible ionomer film* excellent sealing properties and good long term outdoor durability* designed to seal over an existing joint, seam or penetrationThis kit is good test kit that allows you to experiment with different types of 3M tapes in your applications. You don't have to buy the tapes in full size and waste them if they turn out to be unsuitable for your use. I particularly like the way the tapes are organized within the kit and the included product sheet showing in color the location and description of each tape.
summary: A great assortment of 3M tape products designed for engineering applications

reviewText: Extremely bright LED light for the mini-mag lite.  The push-button switch light switch is another great product,  They are a fantastic addition to my survival kit.

One of the big problems with replacements for incandescent bulbs are their short lifetimes. We've never had a CFC last more than a year or two, but we had hopes for LEDs. We tried one of these. It worked rather nicely, but we installed it at the end of March and it died early in September. As we noted in the review title, that's just over five months. The incandescent bulbs we used to use in the same socket typically lasted 3 or 4 years. The CFCs we've been using for a while now last for 1 or 2 years. Apparently, LED bulbs can't even make it that long.We would have given this bulb more than one star, but the technology is really not here yet. Incandescent bulbs, while expensive to operate, are cheap to buy, and they last a long time. CFCs are cheaper to run, but need to be replaced more often. LEDs, we gather, are even cheaper to run, but the price is having to replace them quite frequently. We'll probably move back to CFCs, not to save money, but to help push the technology. We really can't afford to do that for LEDs. Maybe in another five or ten years.
if you own a bosch table saw you will not waste your money buying this product. makes one man work a breeze. make sure you get both side and back.

These tie-downs are an appropriate length (and probably perfect for) tying a motorcycle to the bed of a truck or trailer.  I have a boat and I find these to be frequently too short to be of use in securing the boat to its trailer.  That being said, the construction quality of these appears to be excellent and the handles make it very easy to tighten and release the ratchet even when it is snugged down very tight.  I recently made a dump run in my old beat-up Ford F-250 diesel long bed, with a full load of brush and construction debris.  I secured the load by using these across the bed, attaching them on either side to the fender wells.  I was actually able to use the ratchets on these straps to get them so tight that they distorted the body panels on the bed of the truck!  They are strong and durable, and they come in a handy little pouch which helps keep them organized in my utility box.
summary: Beefy and Brawny - easy to use, but perhaps a bit short

reviewText: Used in place of old sliding screen door - works well - would have been expensive to actually get the real slide - but - this does the job well enough.

This pair of racheting straps will hold whatever you have very securely.  I use a pair of these to tie down my kayak on my car's roof rack.  The 8' length is perfect for going across and then back around.  For some a 15' length would be more desirable so definitely keep length in mind.  The ratcheting action is very smooth and the plastic covered handles definitely make it easier and a pleasure to use.  The straps themselves are wider than lower duty straps, measuring 1 1/8".  The weave is medium dense--neither good nor bad I think but I do prefer dense weaves to lessen the chance of snagging and fraying.  The storage bags are of questionable worth.  Sure the straps fit in nicely when bundled neatly but who does that?In summary, these straps are quality, strong straps that are near perfect.  Just keep in mind the 8' length which depending on you application may be perfect or not long enough.

This is a good product. If you want to turn on outside lights at sunset, and off at 11pm P2 (prog 2) does it,even with timer indoors, it knows longitude and latitude, 6 other programs, one that turns lights on at different times when on vacation. Quality product as usual for Honeywell. A little expensive, but worth it, over many years use.
summary: Glad it has a default program

reviewText: We've been buying these for years, they fit our fridge and are easy to change.  The product filters the water taking out bad tastes and lasts for about 9-12 months in our home.

I was putting off installing this toilet seat because I knew I had to remove the groady bidet that I've given up hope of ever being able to use. (We have a man in the house who either can't hit it or hits it too well. Is that enough said?) Once I finally pulled everything off and cleaned the toilet in all the places I couldn't get to before, installing this toilet seat was really easy to do. I didn't have the tools I needed—you're supposed to tighthen the nuts on it until the bottom extender pieces snap off—but because we may be moving and I'll probably want to take this seat with me, I just hand-tightened the nuts and will retighten if needed. (I'm sure, however, this tightening-down step is critical to ensuring the heavy-duty seat does not slide back and forth.)Both the seat and the lid lower slowly, slowly...SLOWly.... There is no danger of slamming down the toilet lid or "donut" seat with this product. We're in the habit of NOT closing the top lid itself because we tend to bang it, and I've stopped asking the man of the house to put the seat down for the same reason. I'll have to get him in the habit now, though, of getting it started closing when he's finished so it'll be down when I need to use it. My sitz bath won't fit, either, so that's a bummer, but it's not the end of the world.Because of the slowness of closing and the sitz bath not fitting, I would have given this three stars, but I've upped it a star because of the best thing about it: The whole seat lifts right off for easy cleaning! It has two stobs onto which the seat proper fits; a locking/unlocking mechanism on each stob allows you to unlock the seat and just lift the whole thing off. So you can really get in there to wipe up pee when nobody knows how it got there.Now, if I can just train the man to clean the toilet, or at least the outer parts of it, I'll be very happy. I've always resented it that women are expected to take care of this task that doesn't ever seem to need doing when a man is not around! (Sorry, guys....)
summary: Easy to install, remove, and clean

reviewText: I agree the picture is misleading, but the description does say "Coordinating Claro wall plates purchased separately". In any case, I did not require the wall plate because I was replacing a regular switch with this dimmer. Installation was easy. All necessary parts were included. The dimmer worked fine with 120V lights. According to my electrician, this dimmer would not work well for 12V lights. Down the road, I wonder whether I would need to change my dimmers if I buy dimmable CFLs or LEDs.

I give the various hardware stores like Menards, Home Depot and even Ace Hardware a FAIL for not having these accessories right next to their extension ladders!  I've had my ladder for nearly 12 years now.  Every 4 years'ish, I get out the ladder and then with a pressure washer, I wash the house.  There are so many spots where the ladder is uneven, I'm stretching and leaning because of the feet placement.  I then saw a show on TV that had this thing and bought one immediately!  I now have it, but admittedly, I have not used it.  I told my father-in-law though about this and he said he's had this very unit for years and absolutely loves it.  (why did he never tell me?  lol).  Based on what I saw on TV and now his feedback, I give this 4 stars.  Once I know how easily it connects to my own ladder, I will then adjust the stars up or down accordingly.  I do know I'm very excited to get this thing up and running though.  I have lots of work this summer to do on the house and garage!  Just the thought of doing that work is already a lot less stressful knowing I have this.  I'm just not a fan of heights even though it's unavoidable if I want the work done.
summary: Why did I not know about this 10 years ago?

Overall I'm disappointed with this shower head. Like others have commented, it only has 2 spray settings. The packaging has 4 pictures but if you look closely, it basically only shows 2 different spray patterns. I thought maybe they would at least feel different (the important part) however even though the shower head itself has 4 pictures, again you can only 2 results. You can switch the flow between through the shower or the just the surround or both at once. The diverter is easy to use. Another problem I had is the installation. Since all the connections are plastic the main connection took A LOT of teflon tape to keep it from leaking and lot of cranking. I just don't think plastic female works well with metal male connectors. The overall build quality feels cheap as well. Like I said the whole thing is plastic or coated plastic and even the hose is plastic as well. The hose is fairly stiff and is not nearly as nice as Niagara hand-held shower head we purchased recently. Also the way the hand-held part sits in the main housing is not good. It is difficult to get it right and when it is in there properly it looks bad. It is not centered when attached and there are large gaps that don't show up in the picture on Amazon. 1-star for false advertising and cheap quality. We'll see if it holds up. I would definitely not buy this again.

This is a rather handy electrical screw driver and is useful to have, so as to sort out the odd DIY job around the home, I mainly got it to access a number of large NAS storage enclosures as well Pc cases, so there is a fair amount of screwing and unscrewing to be done. I must admit, on first use, it is a bit disconcerting when the motor kicks in and the screw action begins, it takes a bit of getting used to. You also need to try to get the `gesture' right to activate its action. I concur with other another reviewer that if you have any impediment such as arthritis this device is a real boon to getting the job done without the added pain or discomfort. Battery life is good, and you'll need to charge it for a while - also comes with a small selection of bits to get you started.
summary: Does a decent job - and not just a gimmick

reviewText: I bought two of these. One for working under my sports car in an unheated garage and another for personal heater to save on utility bills in the house. Have had them for about a month and moved them around a lot: very light weight and easy to move around. With this wattage, it is not reasonable to expect much heat in an open room if you are more than 3-4 feet away from it - it is a SPOT RADIANT heater for small areas, but that is why it is economical when used as intended.Perfect for working under a car in an unheated garage, since it heats surfaces and not air, so it is not always pulling in cold air as the fan type heaters do, plus: the car traps the convective heat for you. You just want to make sure there is no chance anything flammable will contact it.We have had several below zero F days here recently, which means cold floors in the house, and it has been easy to move this where I need it to keep my old feet warm.My only negative observation is that the shut-off switch on the bottom is kind of cheaply made and could be easily broken if you handle it roughly, but it works fine. Just don't treat it like a "heavy duty" device.

The first feature we noticed ~ even before the lid was tried out ~ is that this seat DOESN'T wiggle any.I would have wanted this seat for that feature alone.The bolt's have plastic ribs that center & snug firmly in the holes of the porcelain.First hand tighten the nuts ~ then use a 1/2" socket to tighten lower section of the nuts until the bottom 1/2 snaps off.This clever design torques the nuts to the maximum tightness with-out concern of cracking the porcelain.Half the nut stays in place for future use.The soft closing seat works wonderfully & both the top/bottom have whisper control.It's very handy ~ plus makes the seat worry free with young ones.The lid can still be closed as you normally would or just lightly push it and ~one ~ or both parts you push are on there approx 5-8 second journey.The top of the nuts can be turned ~ then the seat pulled up on either sidewhich pops the seat off for easy cleaning.To re-install ~ center over the top of the nuts and press.I used a cloth the first few times to turn the caps ~ they're pretty tight ~ but they get easier to move.We've kept our bathroom old fashioned with oak cabinets & trim so we've always used a solid oak toilet seat.Every seat we've used wiggles around and is impossible to keep tightened.We had some concern a white seat may not look good ~ but on the contrary this seat has a quality ~ rich look ~which brightens our bathroom and fits our 1937 round Crane stool perfectly.We're very pleased and impressed with it.The seat is made of Smart Wood which is ~100% re-cycled wood ~ finely ground into flour ~then resin added ~ molded ~ heated and compressed then baked ~and in the process is killed any bacteria ~ and processed to be antimicrobal ~then ran through 3 coats of paint & one coat clear sealant.This seat fits all manufacturer's round toilets ~ including: Kohler ~ American Standard ~ Crane.Available in round and elongated ~ made in U.S.A. ~ 1 yr. warranty.
summary: Classic ~ Rich Appearance With Advanced Technology

reviewText: Initially I thought it had a short but the "tip sensor" is just a button on the bottom and my floor was uneven!its awesome if you want to heat up your feet or something small without heating the whole room.5 stars!
summary: Great for heating small areas efficiently

reviewText: A great addition for a portable drill.  Give you a quick change for your keyless chuck.  A great addition to my tools.

Almost as good as the Cree BR30, the G7 Power has a slightly less natural looking light.  But really a minor difference.  It dims well, and was silent as far as I could tell.  I'd confidently suggest buying these if they're cheaper than the Cree, except I've had problems with G7 LED bulbs failing prematurely in the past (50% failure rate within about a month, but that was a different G7 A19 LED bulb).  It's possible that was a fluke, but I'm being cautious about G7 until I see how this holds up.
summary: Almost as good as the Cree BR30

reviewText: I bought one elongated toilet seat and one round recently; and today, I'm back to buy another round seatThe Mayfair slow close seats are great.  My husband installed them easily, and he's not the handyman type.When I bought the seat, I wondered if it was only the seat that lowered slowly or if it was also the lid.  Well, it's both.  I love it.  It's whisper quiet; but if I need to close it quickly, I can push it down to hurry it up.The entire seat does come off for cleaning, but I find it takes a bit of a push to turn the knob and pull it off.  I put it back easily, though.  I think I'll just leave it on like a regular seat unless it needs serious cleaning.PROS:+ easy installation+ toilet seat and lid close slowly and quietly+ attractive+ seat comes off for cleaningCONS:- takes a little push to take the toilet seat off._________________________UPDATE:  I have two round toilets.  One of them had a smaller seat on top than the other one leading me to believe one was elongated and the other round.  Well, they are both round and this seat fit both round toilets.  Take a good look at your toilets seats before buying!

It's easy to install and it keeps my backside off the porcelain.  Good enough for me.In addition to that, it doesn't slam when I close it.  (That wasn't a big problem here, but every now and then someone would slip and let the seat or lid slam, usually at three in the morning.)  And a simple twist of the hinges and the seat lifts right off the toilet.  I have a friend who visits occasionally... let's just say that I assume his aim was better in years past.  I don't bother to remove the seat to clean the toilet most of the time, but when this friend visits, removing the seat makes cleaning up much easier.It's been installed for about a month, and so far it's wobble free.  Yippee.And the installation was easy.  Insert bolts, place seat on toilet and line up, tighten nuts until the end of the nut breaks off.  There's no way to over-tighten.  And there's still plenty of nut to get a tool around if the seat needs to be removed later.All this needs is a blinking neon sign to warn me when the toilet paper is empty, and this would get six stars.
summary: Easy to install, comfortable, doesn't wobble, easy to clean.  Can't think of anything else I'd want from a toilet seat

reviewText: For a toilet seat I'm pretty impressed.Pros:Both the seat and the lid have the slow close feature.Probably the best attachment hardware/system I have seen for a toilet seatSeat can be quickly detached (and reattached) to the toilet for cleaningCons:A bit expensive for a toilet seatNotes:The attachment hardware was well designed. You can actually use a socket wrench to tighten the nuts. There is a small piece that is designed to break away when the nut has been tightened enough. The design is such that you could still use the socket wrench to remove the seat if necessary. By the way, they do sell replacement attachment hardware for this seat here on amazon. Finally the ability to remove the seat from the toilet to clean simply by flipping a couple of tabs is a really nice feature, although not unique to this brand.
A great addition to the 18 volt line of tools. Light weight and easy to use. Great for cutting all thread, kindorf/strut and conduit.Time saving tool to say the least.
A little goofy looking, but the handle feels very nice and sturdy!  And the tips seem extra strong!  Overall, I'd be more inclined to buy these IF they didn't look the way they look.
Offset flashlight mount on pistol with switch taped to double action trigger squeeze off round after round with blinding light showing target in the dark
summary: easy trigger mount with black tape

reviewText: Slowly replacing all of my closet and regular doors with this and similar door knobs.  You won't be sorry.  Good door knob.

No longer necessary to scream that to my nearly 7 year old.  I don't understand why we just didn't replace the seats years ago so that he wouldn't have to suffer through S L O W L Y lowering these things on his thumbs; even in the middle of the night.  I don't even want to think about his fingers under the seat!Installation was simple for Hubby :).  The seat is a round molded wood composite with an anti-microbial finish.  It is pleasant to sit on and has a nice feel.  I loathe plastic seats and hate having to sit on them at other's homes.  Our previous seats have been acrylic decorative seats that are very heavy.  After watching my son wrangle with the toilet seat in the middle of the night while half dead, I decided it was time to chuck them.  The tightness is amazing to the point of being rather overwhelming at times.  I am not sure if they have been over-tightened, but this lid takes a very long time to actually close.  Personally, that is not an issue in our home.  We don't care as long as the seat ends up closed eventually!  So it has been said countless times before... it is S L OOOOO WWW.  I love the fact that the top can be easily removed because of the lift-off hinges.  After a recent bout of stomach flu that crippled our family of five - it was nice to be able to just lift off and bleach properly.Highly recommend if you do not like having your toilet seat slamming and if you do not appreciate the feel of cold plastic on your rear-end.  Better priced than big box stores and quick shipping.  Hopefully the finish will last for a bit before it needs to be replaced; as well as the hinges.

This is a nice basic set of screwdrivers.  They seem sturdy and the handle seems to be attached well.  The handles are comfortable, just like most screwdrivers. The points of the screwdrivers are sharp enough and fit well into non-stripped screws.The one thing that irks me about tool manufacturers is that as the size of the diameter of the screw decreases, so does the overall length of the driver.  The make an assumption that if you need to drive in a small screw, that you need a shorter driver.  This is often not the case.To me the flames are annoying.  None of my tools in my workshop have flames or camo, but that is just preference.  This is a nice set that makes a great basic gift for the weekend warrior who does not have any special requirements for their screwdrivers.
summary: Good set of screwdrivers, magnetized tips always a plus

reviewText: Love the centering idea of the leds.  Worked better than traditional stud finders that I have had in the past.
Must have option with the Bosch table saw. Lifesaver from having to breath in saw dust not to mention if cutting indoors it save you a mess and a half
summary: worth it! must have accesorie for your table saw

reviewText: Highly recommended. Unlike may of its competitors, works reliably for metal studs.  Best one I have ever used- and I have used four or five others- light and easy to use in any position.

Works well on my Mini Mag. The light beam can be somewhat focused. The end cap switch is kinda cheesey though. Exposure to water causes the light to activate with a dull light until dry. The switch button will push into the on position by accident when in a coat pocket during work activity. Works well for light duty around the house. As for brightness, it is well above the original Mini Mag & batteries last much longer.

Fast, friendly communication, and quality bits.  I used these right away and found them to be strong, durable, and precise, even the #10 on a tight TORX security screw. Every toolbox needs one of these sets and I recommend the seller; CML Supply. I think the enclosure was very nice, stressing the quality they deal with, and their efforts to supply high-end tools, and to let them know of any problems. These were American made, appear to be a strong steel (no rounding of corners), and the centers are right on.

This portable soldering iron is much handier than having to use a electric iron, I have used it a few times and it does the job better than I thought it would to me its an Excellent Item.....I wanted to add a update to this review, this soldering tool is a must have for anyone that does any soldering at all it is the handiest tool I have ever bought worth every penny, it is a quality tool to have I have used it many times over and I can't say enough good things about it........

I can run my table saw all day and not fill up this bag one-eighth of the way. So why does it hang all the way to the ground where it gets stepped on, tangled in cords, and possibly even wet if there was rain the night before? It should have been half the size and cheaper. The spring clamp used to hold it on to the saw work okay but the way it's designed makes it so that you actually have to work to put the thing on the saw well enough that it doesn't fall off. It should have been simpler to get that right - maybe a flaw of the saw as much as the bag clamp. Lastly, if you use the zipper to empty this bag then be prepared to get covered in dust. I think the size of the bag has something to do with this since the bag on my miter saw, which is much smaller, doesn't have this problem.
summary: Too long, hard to get on, and needs better empty method

reviewText: I was looking for a compact driver bit holderfor my compact Makita driver.  This is it.I've use it several times now doing some home improvement projects.  Great product.
This flashlight is seriously bright, unlike most of the multi-LED flashlights around.It's also very light compared to my aluminum flashlights of similar brightness.

I got this on a Gold Box special, for what I thought was a good price. I'm now back to using my "old" way of opening up plastic encased products, which is by using my Stanley heavy duty box cutter.These scissors will barely cut through a thin sheet of paper, so that the "good price" I got them for should have been about 90% lower than what I paid.This pair of Black and Decker scissors really does rate a 0 and is one of the worse pieces that I've purchased since, now, all Black and Decker tools are being made in China.I won't be buying any more Black and Decker products.

The first scissors we received would not run after an overnight charge. We followed the supplied instructions implicitly, gave up, and returned them. Amazon immediately sent a replacement. After an overnight charge, the new scissors seemed to work properly. We cut several pieces of paper, even opened a plastic package. The scissors cut very well. We recharged the scissors overnight. Again, the scissors would not work. We even tried removing the head (without success), so we decided to again return them. As I was putting them in the box for return, they again worked. There must be an intermittent problem of some sort with these scissors. We did not want to take a chance that they would again fail so we returned them anyway. We received an e-mail from Amazon stating they had problems with this item and would send a refund rather than replacing it.
summary: THIS ITEM APPEARS TO BE DEFECTIVE

reviewText: Okay, I like to use the cordless scissors for cutting up boxes to put in the recycle bin. I've used them to cut Christmas wrapping paper. That was very cool.I tried to use them to cut open one of those "clam packs". I thought that would be a great use. Either they are not beefy enough to do that job or my battery was too low. Either way, it wouldn't work.As long as I plan to cut up boxes on a certain day (or whatever) and I charge the scissors ahead of time, it is okay. I have never been able to take them out of the drawer on the spur of the moment to use them. You might say they need 24 hours notice!!So I like my cordless scissors, but I would like them a whole lot better if the battery lasted longer.
summary: Wish It Had A Longer Battery Charge

reviewText: As a Medic, CELOX is indispensable for any Traumatic Body Wounds, where a major blood loss source needs immediate & temporary control measures. CELOX and other similar treatment options are part of my Med Pak's, which I have 2, one for First Responder and another for tac 'field-duty' purposes.

This worked fine for my led lighting.  The power brick isn't terribly large and doesn't heat up too much.The cables are pretty long so I ended up cutting them down shorter and soldering them back together.I've been running my lights with this power adapter for a month and no problems have surfaced.

You can buy the crappiest saw available and turn it into a board's worst nightmare with these blades.  My neighbor and I built a cedar fence in the spring using his cheap Ryobi saw and a Diablo blade. That experience alone made me a believer and I have been slowly switching all my tools over to using Diablo's since. I have used blades from several other manufacturers, Bosch being the most recent, and the Diablo's out-cut and out-last everything else I've used.

I live in a 1954 Sears Kit home with latte and plaster walls with rough / home cut studs, so nothing is centered.  I have tried almost every product under the sun to help me find the studs and nothing worked.  This is the first product that does what it claims.  I was hanging shelving on the wall and I never missed a stud or hit any wiring.  If your looking for a stud finder and only want to buy one for the next 10 years, this is your finder.

I got a Kohler kitchen faucet three years ago. I thought why not get the best! After a few months the faucets rotating ability began to stiffen, and now it feels like you are going to practically break it to go from sink-to-sink. No more Kohlers for me!!
we use these on a daily basis.  its seems to be a hit and miss with quality.  sometimes they hold up well and sometimes you stick your foot in and they tear.
summary: seem thinner than ones in past

reviewText: This is a really cool up grade to the standard hand held drill to come along in how many years?  Works great both clockwise and counter. The clutch works well also.  The two led lights are a great addition.  Battery life is fine and they seem to charge quickly. The only drawback I have found is they will not accept a standard round shank, rather only hex shanks. That being said I ordered online a small package of hex shank drills to use when needed.  The RPM is really slow at 400.  Have not tried it with a larger bit such as 1/4 inch on any material as yet. I suspect it will preform ok but may not have power to drill thru very many holes in metal depending upon thickness.  Time will tell.Yes I like it and glad I purchased this model that comes with two batteries.UPDATE today.  Did a test with 1/4 drill bit. was able to drill 29 holes in a pine 2x4 and ran out of power. To use as a drill the RPM is to slow IMO. Now I would say it would be fine to set small short screws. Perhaps a decent tool for the wife in the kitchen drawer but for a "real man" I would not think much of it for a woodworking shop or garage tool box.  Having second thoughts now.John G.

Saw cuts flawlessly on finish molding,  it is a must for a good finish carpenter.  I still am not sure how long it will last, but just did an average finish job in a 1500 sq. ft. area, and it worked great all the way through.

I have owned and used six different routers of various sizes and brands. Like my Dewalt 625 this one is built with the same high quality craftsmanship. Everything operates smoothly and is machined accurately. This has to be the best 1/4 chuck router on the market ! And I like that you can get dust collection attachments too. This was an even sweeter deal for me since I got it on a lightening deal for $110.00. The Dewalt deluxe edge guide will fit this and all other routers they make.
summary: One of the best if not the best !

reviewText: I half expected based on the pictures that some of the heads would be full-size. They are not (which is good) - what you get is a variety of different mini screw bits. The driver itself is plasticy and feels cheap, but it gets the job done.
summary: Good quality set - lots of options

reviewText: I purchased these clamps for making Doors, and i've since purchased about 20 more.  Much better control over my pipe clamps.

Cuts conduit and plastic pvc tubing  really well , cuts metal ok , it takes awhile to cut 3/16 or 1/4 inch steel but it cuts it .and the piece that you cut is hot . other than that it is a good saw ,had no problems with mine .

Yeah, these are nice candles.  I like that they are battery operated, and the flickering effect is pretty good.  But to maintain the illusion that they are real candles, you'll want to display them up high so the VERY obviously fake flame can't be seen.I'm not sure that there is any advantage to the candles being made out of real wax.  Anyone close enough to appreciate that fact will see the fake flame and know it's not a real candle, anyway.  So why use something as delicate (scratchable and breakable) as wax?The smell is okay, but it's not one of the better vanilla scents I've experienced.  It's a little fake and cloying, actually.  Some candles smell really good and make me want to just keep sniffing them.  This is not such a candle.  Other reviewers have mentioned that the smell doesn't last long, anyway.  I hope mine hurries up and fades, then maybe I'll dab the inside with something that smells better.Rather than using three AAA batteries, I wish these had been designed to use two AAs.  If these candles were more practical in that area, I would use them every evening!  I mean, who doesn't enjoy the ambiance of candles?  But I don't want to burn through so many batteries, so I haven't even left these on through an entire four-hour cycle yet.But my biggest complaint is the price.  I think $20 is just way too much for what you're getting here.

There is not a lot to say about this blade that hasn't been covered already.  I tried Freud blade years ago and wasn't all that impressed.  A few months ago I needed a blade for my 8 1/2" saw and all the big orange store had that day where Freud.  I was impressed, so when I needed a blade for my 10" I ordered this blade.The cuts are flawless.  I have cut oak, poplar, maple, beech, MDF and oak veneered plywood.  No splintering or edge chipping.  It cross cut the oak ply beautifully.  The cut edges are very smooth.  It also is one of the quieter blades I have used.I will buy this again.

I love that you can dial the sensitivity of this. i tried it and it works great. No false readings so far.I have concrete walls and i maxed out the sensitivity but i wasnt able to detect the live wire running to my light switch thats disappointing but i still like it.My other problem with it is how difficult it is to remove the battery with your finger. You will have to use something dull and thin (non conductive) to remove the battery due to the design.For the price its a great tool that can save your life. i recommend this

A good set of extractors made in the USA. You will however need a left-hand drill bits to get most out of them.IRWIN is a company that has several subsidiaries including Vise Grip. These sets are made by Hanson but are of top quality and nothing wrong with being Hanson tool as long as they are of good quality & made in the USA.
summary: No complaints; Made in the USA

reviewText: These are some of the best test leads around.  They are Fluke's 4mm banana to 90 degree 4mm banana plug set.  They are just about 3' in length and are made of high quality silcone rubber.  This means they provide excellent saftey with a CAT IV rating but at the same time a pleasurable working experience since they don't hold shape following storage.  Undo the twist tie and they fall free and straight!  Beautiful!!!  This is important to me since getting your probes tangled around switch gear is a recipe for utter disaster!  With the opposite end being a straight 4mm banana plug, these can be adapted to a wide range of uses with 4mm plug style accessories.  Large clamps, speciality probes, or daisy chaining test leads (with a coupler)are just a few options.  They are pricey at around $25, but take care of them and they will last a lifetime!  I wouldn't trade these for anything!

I love candles, but live in an apartment building, and am always fearful of accidentally causing a fire. So I decided to try these "no-flame"  battery-operated candle substitutes.Obviously I was looking for something that was close to a real candle in appearance.I was pleasantly surprised, subject to a few caveats which follow.The "flame" on the candles is actually a small light bulb sunken a bit down into the "wax" (actually a hard plastic substance).  So its very obviously a light bulb if you put it on a low table where you can look down on it. On the other hand, if you put it higher up, say on a mantle as I did, it gives a pretty good representation of a real candle. Somewhat less bright though.The smaller candle I have has an ivory color, while the taller one is brownish (taupe). I think the ivory ones are slightly more realistic.Both candles have on-off switches and various timer features. The larger one can even be set to turn on-off at the same time daily.I don't know yet how many hours standard alkaline batteries will keep these lit.Hope this review is of some value. I'm publishing it on both products' pages.

Ever since I bought  Fluke's Sure Grip Alligator Clips (made in USA and sold here) I wanted to purchase Fluke's TL224 SureGrip Silicone Test Leads.  These are probably the best test leads I've used and they feel even more durable/comfortable than my Klein MM200 test leads that came with the meter.  What really got me excited about these test leads is the fact these test leads are also made in USA, similar to the alligator clips.However, although I really like fact these are made in USA, the fact that these tests leads have CAT IV protection and conform to safety standards IEC 61010-2-031:2002 but also comply to EN standards EN A1:2008.  I am a big advocate in safety and even though these Fluke leads have dual rated CAT IV protection and CAT III protection, strict compliance to IEC/EN standards is a must.However, besides being able to use Fluke's alligator clips (AC285) these leads are also entirely compatible with Fluke's TP220 industrial test probes.  This is a giant plus and those probes are most certainly a nice addition to any Fluke test lead.I also like the that the wire is flexible and also simonized-insulated.  Because of that, these leads have superb resistance to both cold and heat.  These leads can withstand -20 to 55 degrees in Celsius, can withstand a humidity percentage between 0 and 95%, which is 0 to 35 degrees in Celsius, and last, but certainly not least, can endure an Altitude of 2000 m.In addition, the test leads are also reinforced to provide maximum strain relief.  This is exceptionally helpful if your in a extremely tight situation or where that even level of comfort would certainly provide a cushion for when your hands might become tired.I had forgotten to mention this earlier but this entire product is CE, SA and UL listed.  Knowing this information is giant relief to me, as some test leads only have Intertek protection, if even that sometimes.  More protection is always a plus and is worth having, especially UL listed.Now another plus to these leads, they are fused.  So even if your meter isn't fused, these leads will provide that level of protection, so your not only protecting yourself, but also your multimeter as well.  However, it's crucial to remember these test leads have a maximum current of 10 Amps and at no time, should that ever be exceeded.It's hard to tell in the picture but the length of this product is 1.5 meters and these do fit standard 4mm banana connectors.  In addition, these also have pollution degree of 2 as well.  Plus they are double insulated as well.Overall, these are exceptional test leads.  They may be simple, but they truly are well built and designed and will likely last a very long time.  If your looking for a test lead that will provide not only CAT IV protection, but will provide great service, these are the one's to buy.
summary: Exceptional set of Fluke Test leads.

reviewText: I like the Rikon 50-120 belt sander, and would have given it a 5 star, but the packing was terrible. The styrofoam was completely crushed into pieces. I was very lucky every piece was still in the box. This thing weights a ton, the box and packaging was not up to par for the weight of this belt sander. The plastic cord restraint was broken. I had to search for one that had the same treads. No box store had one that would fit, just so happen my work had a metal fitting that I made work. Rikon, you have to do a better job packing this belt sander!
summary: Good Rikon belt sander, terrible packing.

reviewText: I love this tool because of its size and quality of build. You could have this on your keychain and It won't bother you at all it's extremely skinny and nice looking.

This is a nice tool, i had purchased the style cs, which is a bigger version of this. This did all the tasks that my cs did, but in a smaller form factor, which was nice. So now i can cut down on the size of my keyschain again.

I you like a smoke alarm that has hardwiring then you will like this one.  Dual sensing technologies are a plus.  Easy installation is a plus.  The price which was 40% less than the regular price is a plus.  There is not anything I am not pleased about with this smoke alarm but then First Alert has always been reliable for me.

Hands down, best blade for the price.  There are slightly better blades, but much more expensive.  And you can buy basic dewalt blades that dont perform near as well for the same price.Why would you do that?These blades make any saw better.  I know use them in my table, compund miter, circular saws
It can be used for planning or even sanding.  Currently using to freshen cedar boards purchased in box store for closets and drawers.  Works well and not too expensive.

These are okay as long as you don't expect them to look uber realistic with the flame.  The flame is jumpy and very obviously electronic.  They look best in a votive holder that is colored or frosted so you can't see the "flame" so much.  They would be nicer if they had a timer option on them.  The flame has an amber glow to it, so the coloring, if not the motion, is realistic.  They are okay, but I have seen better flameless votives.
strong product and was super easy to install, with very little effort. has good wide view for security. worth purchasing

I started out using a stock saw blade on a 14' bandsaw.  I was having a hard time re-sawing and was basically about to give up on using a bandsaw.  I read about how blades make a big difference.  I bought this Timberwolf saw blade and it was literally like a hot knife thru butter.  The blade cut quickly and easily and did not walk over to the side.  Excellent saw blade.  I now LOVE using the bandsaw and I am amazed at what difference a blade can make!

I really love this flameless candle.  It looks like a regular, wicked candle, but I don't have to worry about going off to bed and leaving it burning.  The vanilla smell is nice but not too strong.  When on, it looks like it has been burned down about 1/3 of the way, and the top is wavy, as regular candles look after burning and softening.  The light is a nice, warm, yellowish light, as a flame would be.When you look straight down into it, you see the tiny bulb, but that isn't an issue for me.As much as I like it, there are reasons for not giving it 5 stars.  There is an on/off/auto switch on the bottom, and one that controls how many hours the candle is on when switched to automatic.  I really like that auto feature.  But the switches are tiny and the two look just alike.  It would be nice if there was contrasting labeling or if the switches were different shapes so it's easy to tell which switch is which.The candle doesn't come with batteries, and it takes 4 AA batteries.  It would be very nice if it came with them, but many products do not.  What would make that more acceptable is if the packaging more obviously stated the battery requirements.  It's there, but in tiny print on the side of the package.  If someone were buying this for a gift or to use immediately, it's would be easy to overlook the battery requirement and be disappointed.The packaging needs to be improved.  The candle comes in a clear plastic sleeve, but it is larger than the candle and the candle gets banged around a bit in shipping.  In my case, there were some minor scratches and marks on the wax.  Not a big deal, but still a minor annoyance.I do love this candle and will use it often, but there are areas where it could stand some minor improvement.

You can call it the little giant. By far exceeds the performance of any other even high price product. It is like a .357 round compared to a .38 pea-shooterI had to enlarge two holes on my Navigator suspension to fit heavy duty bolts, using a stone and this little beauty did it in only a few seconds. I also used it to sand down rough edges on my rotors. I suggest getting a 1/4 and 3/8 mandrel kit (72386) to make this grinder very versatile. I have many IR grinders but this simply impressed me

This unit is very well made. It does everything it is supposed to. The only problem I am having is it appears to be made to swivel where it meets the shower arm like the hose on a handheld. I need it to be fixed. While I am using it this allows the whole unit to pivot left and right which lets the right side handheld mount drop since it is much heavier and makes the whole experience a pain. Not sure if I can keep it if I can't find a solution for it.
summary: Great Delta quality item that works

reviewText: Writing a review for a bulb may seem strange and somewhat unecessary but if like me you've been burned by shoddy package or sub-standard lights then I thought it would be helpful to write my experience with the Eiko F15T8. The bulb went into aGE 16466 18-Inch Basic Fluorescent Light Fixturewhich, although it came with an existing bulb, I felt it worth trying the Eiko to see how it looked.The bulb itself was amazingly well packed (perhaps too much packing!) and arrived intact and it slotted into the GE fixture which I installed into a video arcade machine for the game's marquee. The bulb lights up without delay and is flicker free and works perfectly. In case you're unsure of a bulb's numbering system the F15 indicates it's (F)luorescent bulb rated at 15 watts and the T8 is for (T)ube-style at (8)x.8" - which means it's one inch around. Finally the CW is for Cool White in color.Everything works great and for the unbelievable price you should definitely look at this one.

Been using this light at work for a while now and am very happy with. Dropped it a couple times and it's still working. Cleans up easy after grabbing it with oily hands. The beam really does split the difference between a spot/flash light and a shop/flood light. Have bought two more since, one as a gift and one for home use.

This tape is very thick and sturdy and the adhesive is very tacky.  I expect it to hold up well.  Much different than the 3M duct tape I have been using for years. Not a tape I'd use for all duct tape uses but when I need strong and permanent this is the tape I will use.

I just had this toilet installed by Home Depot during a total master bath remodel (Not quite complete yet after almost two months!!). The flushing action requires you to push down and hold the handle in that position for a little less than two seconds before releasing it.  If you release the handle like you do on all other toilets, thhe flapper drops IMMEDIATELY and it stops water flow immediately before the flush is complete.  BUT IT DOES WORK VERY WELL! However it is NOT totally clog free!  But compared to the toilet in my other bathroom, it only clogs perhaps 10% as much as my old toilet, so I'm very happy with it... plus this toilet is slightly taller than the regular height toilets.  I love the one piece design which makes it easier to clean!  Highly recommended
summary: Excellent, but hold the handle down a bit before releasing it.

reviewText: This is a very solid product.  Easy to attach to your pipe and the turn handle feels very hefty and solid.It does the job.  Don't forget the plumber's tape to wrap around your pipe threads.The price is very good and the product is great.  You can't go wrong.

Purchased this diverter for use with my hand shower.  It is beautiful, matches the color of the other items in my shower.  It is exactly as advertised and I highly recommend it.  One setting allows for the regular shower, second setting allows for the hand shower and a third setting allows for both showers.  It's great.  Cannot speak to ease of installation it was done by a professional.

After looking at other models of faucets, this is clearly the most elegant and beautiful version.Installation was easy and the instructions are presented in a very simple, understandable format (even for someone like me who is not exactly a handyman).  No need for specialized tools - you can use what you have in your kitchen tool drawer.I highly recommend this product for making a guest bathroom really look like something special and timeless.

I was so tickled that I got to buy another new tool - Amazon and I have a great relationship as I have probably ordered 30 more tools and/or accessories since this purchase.  I am a handyman, contractor and hobbyist.  This is one of five routers that I own.  My main use of this unit is sign making - plunge is needed) and lighter work.  My Bosch trim routers are still the best for laminate work but I could see using this easily if you were not lucky to have dedicated routers for that use.  This will never replace my PC 690 or ever get close to the big PC in the stand but I like this unit a lot.  It is easy to see, easy to adjust and easy to change bits in.  The collet will only accept 1/4 bits, of course, so all of my bigger stuff wouldn't fit this one anyway.

Got this thing installed the same time as a new 52" Hunter fan for our living room, and it went up with no problems. Fit right inside the base of the Hunter Studio series fan.This remote is also significantly cheaper than the name brand remotes I saw available on Amazon, but I do believe this is actually manufactured by/for Hampton Bay. Certainly worth the gamble on a more inexpensive product.Directions were clearly printed out in China when it was made, but were still easy to follow and wire. We've had zero problems with the light turning on or off at strange times and all the controls work exactly as they should.I'd recommend this to anyone and will probably get one more for a room where we don't want the pull chains hanging down and getting in the way.
summary: Cheaper than the name-brand models, works just as well and goes up smooth

reviewText: Best socket holder I have purchased for my sockets. The magnet holds them in place and I can find the correct socket with ease because the size of the socket can be arranged so that it is viewed easily.

This just got here today, so I haven't used it yet, but a few of the smaller Torx bits are rusted.  This isn't spot rust--the whole bits are rusted.  I'm hoping it's only on the surface and will wear off, but Torx bits aren't the strongest to begin with, so I don't expect long life out of these.None of the other bits are rusted, so it was probably a storage problem before the bits were inserted into the case.The case is fairly clever.  It's made out of lightweight and somewhat flimsy #2 plastic, but the way it's built makes it sturdy enough for household use (which is what it's intended for, of course.)  It's also fairly light for a large plastic case with 129 bits.  It holds the bits well, yet they aren't difficult to remove or put back--even the smallest drill bits.If you're looking for something specific, this has:General purpose drill bits: 19, sizes from 1/16 (there are three of those--yes!) to 1/4Masonry drill bits: 4, sizes from 1/8 to 1/4Brad point (wood) drill bits: 13, sizes from 1/8 through 1/4Spade (wood) drill bits: 4, sizes from 3/8 to 3/4Hex keys (Allen wrenches): 12, sizes from .035 to 1/4Nut drivers: 9, sizes from 3/16 to 1/2Screwdriver bits: Flat, Phillips, Torx, square and hex: 66, a good assortment of short and long bits, lots of duplicates of the ones you're most likely to lose.One drill bit gauge, one magnetic bit holderI really like they way they've duplicated many of the smaller drill bits and hex keys, the ones that will break easily with normal use, and the screwdriver bits.  It's the simplest thing in the world, but it seems like I can never put my hands on a #2 Phillips bit when I need one.  With a total of 7 in this kit, I should be able to find one easily for... oh, about two weeks or so.
summary: Good assortment, lots of needed duplicates, too bad some Torx bits are rusted

reviewText: these fans are pretty good fans fairly quiet when running during summertime had it running constantly for about 3 months and it never gave me any problems so i ordered 2 more

Like so many other reviewers have said, “very powerful, but noisy.” I liked the fact that it already had a power cable already attached, but if I had to go through all the trouble of putting it in my attic, I decided to get a much quieter fan, play electrician, got a real inline fan, ran the necessary vent tubes, and spiced power. Quieter, more power, less money.

Many of the homes in my neighborhood had those nasty radon ventilation systems put in when the homes were last sold.  I was always suspicious on those quick 24-hr tests (which trigger this expensive, visually ugly and often unnecessary home addition).  I mounted the Accustar radon test kit  in my main living space (as instructed) and left it undisturbed for 1 year.  You simply mail it back to Accustar and then get a full report emailed back.  As expected, my home passed fine during the full year test.  The concept of monitoring radon has me now interested in installing a reversible basement ventilation fan (from Tjernlund Products).  This fan can run on both timers and auto humidistat controls.  Once I add this ventilation to our basement, I will certainly purchase the Accustar unit and run another year long test seeing how much ventilation reduces the average radon level.  The goal is to get it as close to the natural levels in outside air.
summary: This Product Gave Me a Piece Of Mind

reviewText: I live in rural Arkansas, (most of AR is). Trying to clear some of my land, I've encountered a local vine called "Greenbriar", it is as close to a natural "Barb-wire" as you could imagine. it has penetrated my heavy canvas gloves, my leather gloves, but not my Youngstown Kevlar gloves. The gloves are a little long in  the fingers, but do fit the rest of my hand well (a lot a trouble finding a XXL glove that is big enough, but these are). they are also breathable, and don't make my hands sweat. Good gloves, worth the money

It is small yet very powerful, I can easily wear it in my duty belt using the same belt loop I use for my maglight. This is the nicest patch cable I've ever seen. It's reasonably thin, and yet well shielded, a result of using dense cable, as opposed to the cheap twisted-pair-in-a-loose-sleeve that most ethernet cable is made of. The connectors are as solid as any I've seen, and they way they've attached them is very nice: the stress relief sheath is injected molded INTO the connector, making the connector essentially a monolithic whole with the cable. These cables are not going to come loose, as others do, with repeated use and tugging. To the limited extent an emotionally healthy adult can get excited about a Cat 5e ethernet patch cable, this cable does it.I'd also like to digress by sharing with you the fact that thanks to my fortuitous ordering of this wonderful cable, I just discovered I'm a veritable giant among men. Measuring myself with this cord, I am 2.8 cord lengths tall. It turns out that I was grossly mismeasured by the nurse at my last physical, and I am not 6'3", but in fact around 11'2". I am not joking. This is awesome. Other parts of my anatomy are also, it turns out, quite a bit larger than I, or my wife, have properly given me credit for. So, in addition to a reliable conduit for ethernet frames at an aggregate rate of 1 Gb/s, this cable has been a boon to my self worth and esteem among coworkers and friends' spouses. Really, an unbelievable bargain, even at full retail.UPDATE: It turns out I'm not actually a freakishly large engineer, but just a normal-sized engineer who was sent a cable significantly shorter than the advertised four feet of length. While my comments about the cable's quality stand, and this may just be an innocent packaging error, I feel it nevertheless appropriate to dock this product one star for causing me significant embarrassment during an Celtics open try-out day, as well as the expense of having to have yet another driver's license made.
summary: Very nice cord, but either I'm a giant or this isn't 4 feet long

reviewText: I have garage door openers installed in 1995 that are genie BlueMaxx. This was very easy to program. I programmed two of the garage doors into it that have 13 dip switches. Instructions were easy and works flawlessly from a good distance away too.
